Reviews.Title: “Balanced Review”
Reviews.Author: alison_barr_johnston
Reviews.Content: Positives: * Great location * Efficient Service * Clean * Room (deluxe) was exactly as per the hotel photo Negatives: * Everything is 'extra' (1l of water - €7.50, wifi - €12 / hour, coffee and pastry €18, fruit salad €12) * Service is really impersonal (although efficient) * Pay TV (not just movies, almost EVERYTHING is pay TV) * Food very average but and again over priced. One other beware, not related to the hotel, be we were charged €60 in taxi from Ciampino to hotel, it should be a fixed price. Taxi back was €35. You should not pay more that €42.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifiscent”
Reviews.Author: Anju N
Reviews.Content: This was an exquisite hotel situated right at the top of the famed Spanish Steps in the middle of Rome. We booked purely by chance and at the last minute , but we have never been more surprised at what this unassuming building had to offer. The rooms were a good size and had all the usual amenities that one can expect from a 5 star establishment. The bathroom with the combined shower in the bathtub was a tad small , but could live with that size for a few days. The guest toiletries more than made up for the lack in bathroom size- all were expensive Elemis products , from the shampoo to the shower gel and bar soap and body lotion- all smelled and felt heavenly. The food was something else. We emjoyed 2 dinners on their rooftop signature restaurant and had a fantastic view over the city that looks magical at night. Breakfast was standard Continental fare with a distinguished touch of excellent taste and using products of the higest quality. Will ceratinly want to stay there again on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Bar, OK Rooms”
Reviews.Author: b0nnieb00p
Reviews.Content: The primary reason to stay at this hotel is the location. Located a few feet from the Spanish Steps, you're central to all the sights. The breakfast buffet is good and the hotel is quietly elegant. We had drinks at the bar after dinner on 2-nights of our stay and the bar staff were great. Our room was OK -- nothing to write home about. I wouldn't stay here again if I were to return to Rome (I'd either really splurge and stay at The Hassler, which is right next door, or I'd stay in a small boutique hotel nearby), but for a first visit, the location can't be beat. I think you can probably find a nearby location with nicer rooms (our window faced a noisy street), friendlier service (the front desk staff were a bit surly), and better prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, old rooms and casual staff”
Reviews.Author: Spankytoes
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights in the penthouse here. The room looked great. However, the hotel is old and creaky. We heard the elevators moving constantly. The 360 degree view of Rome more than made up for it. The staff was nice, but didn't really go out of their way to make us feel welcome. It's a great value atop the Spanish Steps and a few blocks from the Trevi Fountains. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: NEWHORIZONSGlasgow
Reviews.Content: As already said, located at the top of the Spanish Steps, within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain, Colleseum, Forum, Piazza Navona, Campo Di Fiori, a short Metro ride to Vatican, Termini, this hotel was very comfortable and friendly. Concierge was very good and our 1st floor room was spacious, comfortable and quiet. This was all on Priority Points. We have stayed at InterContinental's all over Europe and this was as good as any.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: SurfriderCA
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Intercontinental de la Ville two weeks ago was very nice. I was flying solo on this trip so the room was the perfect size for what I needed and had a great view looking out over the city of Rome. The location at the top of the Spanish Steps was excellent. I could not have asked for a better location. Close to the Metro stop, though I never used it. I walked everywhere, and the hotel was within easy walking distance of almost all the major sites of the city. I didn't want to miss a thing by traveling underground as the city has history around every corner in the least expected places, so I wanted to walk the city as much as possible and the Intercontinental provided a great location from which to do this. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Experience to be repeat certainly!!!!”
Reviews.Author: reina y
Reviews.Content: Great Location, convenient to get a bit' all over Rome. Impeccable service and courtesy, with constant attention to every detail. Really great experience to be repeated certainly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice typically Italian hotel...but mind the expensive extras!”
Reviews.Author: Wesmeistergeneral
Reviews.Content: Great location at the top of the Spanish Steps! Our room was okay; bathroom very nice though didnt like having a shower curtain (come on its not the 1980's!). The room was nice; traditional 5* and the bed was very comfortable. As for the "extras" - totally rediculous!! A vodka and coke, €20!! Paying for Wifi at €12/hr!! A bottle of Champagne for €120!! Seriously...get some perspective. I really didn't expect to pay for Wifi in a 5* hotel and am glad I realised the cost of the champagne I'd ordered in time to cancel it! A great little hotel and good value for money (for the room!!) but I'd avoid buying anything over and above the room.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive good location”
Reviews.Author: pseuro
Reviews.Content: Great location, restaurant expensive and 'ok' but great outdoor breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good traditional hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 11Give-me-strength11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 2 friends in February 2012. Our friends paid for the hotel using points the husband had collated though staying at the group's hotels in the UK. It was a lovely, old, traditional, grand hotel. Lovely high ceilings, decorative touches and solid furniture. The room was ok - good. The carpet in front of the bed made a funny rustling boise, almost as if the floor was lined with plastic carrier bags under the carpet. It was weird. We had a meal and cocktails in the restaurant/bar and it was good, if a little pricey. The cocktail waiter made one of my cocktails far too strong and was mortified and quickly made me another. He was lovely bless him. Drinks, coffee and tea etc. comes with a little plate of nibbles whcih are lovely. Location wise it was great. Right at the top of the Spanish Steps. Perfect. Great staff. I prefer boutique hotels but I would still give this a 7/10.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, perfect location and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: foursomefamily
Reviews.Content: I booked our hotel through lasminute.com "Top Secret" and was disappointed to discover the hotel was the InterContinental, having read several reviews here. However, my reservations were unnecessary. The hotel may not have the typical luxury of a five star, but it is certainly adequate and situated in a fantastic spot. Close to the Spanish Steps and a five minute walk from the metro. Our room, although small had everything we needed, was at the rear of the building and we were woken to the sound of church bells and birds.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: M1DLD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business and found the hotel to be pleasant and staff attentive. My room was clean, modern and quiet although I had an internal court yard view. Internet is pricey at €23 per 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, Unresponsive Staff and Management”
Reviews.Author: plytime1
Reviews.Content: I am truly disappointed by this hotel property. I was given a room next to the noisy street, with no other rooms available away from the street. I have been a platinum member for nearly 13 years and this is truly the most disappointing stay I have ever encountered with all of IHG brands. The hotel listed a pressing service that would be available starting at 7 am. When I contacted the hotel to use this service I was told that first, that this service was not available, then when I pressed the issue stating it was listed in the hotels directory of services for the hotel property the desk staff said that the person who does it was late. The desk staff said they would call when the individual showed. Nearly an hour later I received a call, but by that time it was too late, and I was late for my meeting and pressed the clothing myself. This is not what I expect from the flagship brand of this hotel chain. The only offering for any inconvenience caused was more water and more fruit. Sorry, but this service was BEYOND unacceptable. I hadn't had time to drink the water, I am a very busy executive with a government body. As for the fruit, I had not eaten any of the fruit that I received upon checkin, I had moved the orange in that basket and marked it. Upon my return to my room I found that same orange replaced in the basket and a strawberry that looked rotting placed in the fruit basket, no change of the fruit or anything. I asked to speak with the manager, he never showed or called or left a message. The individual never showed up while I checked out to discuss these issues with me. Nothing. I travel quite a bit for my work. I will NOT be using this hotel again in Rome. I make all the decisions for my people that travel to Rome, I will be using either a competitor or another IHG Brand. This brand has truly lost my confidence if this is what I can expect from staff and property managers at this particular hotel in this brand. Truly Disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Otherwise not to the standard expected.”
Reviews.Author: travelg
Reviews.Content: I think the title says it all. The hotels location is excellent but as a Plat Ambassador the quality was below what I would expect of other Intercons I have stayed at. We were upgraded to an executive with balcony but the balcony was in the internal courtyard always covered by the shade and while warm outside it was too cold in the shade so we never used it. Double bed was two singles zipped together so there was always a hard bit in the middle. Plat amenity was a plate of fruits and small bottle of wine. To go to your bedrooms you have to walk through the hotel cafe which involved walking between rows of tables and getting a peek at everyone's dinner. The room itself was an adequate size for Rome. Staff were cordial. Our room was not ready but we were seated in the cafe mentioned earlier and had complimentary drinks while waiting. Again half an hour turned to an hour waiting which was not up to standard. For the price paid, I would stay elsewhere as there are many hotels close to the Spanish steps

Reviews.Title: “Location, superbly hospitable staff and pure class!”
Reviews.Author: Qonrad G
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Francesco at reception is just a service professional. Anyone wanting to book for a stay should not hesitate!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location and location”
Reviews.Author: MarioPTY
Reviews.Content: In spite of the mixed critics found on trip advisor, I finally choose the Intercontinental de la Ville In Rome for my February 2012 stay.  The hotel is too old but the location is the best: just steps of Piazza Spagna near the high end shopping area in Via Condotti and the via del Corso. Easy to walk to Via Vittorio Venetto, Villa Borghese and the Metro station Spagna. Besides, there are plenty good restaurants within walking distance.  I was very dissapointed when I left the cab at the entrance with my luggage: no one was there, no help at all, the door is a small rolling and I cannot handle my three pieces of luggage. Both side doors were closed from the outside and no one helped me. Very bad first impression.  Marco at the reception took excellent care of me and assigned a room with a terrace on the fourth floor. The room is ok, nothing spectacular, had a king size bed (two singles joined but it doesn't bother ). Nice sheets and duvet make the best rest after a ling day walking  It had a LCD tv with computer access and a mini bar.  I am a Platinum Ambassador, I received the welcome fruits and water with a small bottle of red wine. Very nice.  The bathroom wasn't big but was comfortable and the quality of the linens was good too.  It was snowing in Rome, not normal, but it doesn't stopped me to use the beautiful terrace. I will attach a picture.  The Internet is very expensive, 23 Euros a day and the quality of the signal was so so ( for this exhorbitant price a better connection will be highly appreciated ).  The breakfast was expensive too 35.00 Euros for the buffet. It was very good but the one at the intercontinental Le Grand in Paris at the Cafe de la Paix it is huge and cost just 5 euros more).  Due the winter, restaurant at the patio were closed but due the weather, I had dinner one night at the Cafe de la Ville ( you can see my review under la Piazzeta because I couldn't find this one) and value for money was one of my best deals in Rome.  The concierges were nice too, service at the restaurants fair but in spite of all, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff. Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: traveller_aa86
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a snowy weekend in Rome, just before Valentines. The Hotel was very busy due to the Rugby and the snow was causing delays, but the staff were still helpful and friendly despite the added stress. The rooms were small but comfortable, although the room did get very warm in the night. The Laundry service stained two of my boyfriends shirts which he needed that week for work, but they were quick to offer to resolve the situation - although it ended up taking 5 more days until we heard from them and they had sorted the stains. Location is great for exploring Rome. Would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Christine H
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Intercontinental Hotels in other cities I was sure this property in Rome would be equally as good. The location (at the top of the Spanish Steps) was great but that's about all that was great. The Reception and Concierge staff were useless - I was forced to physically go down to the lobby to speak to someone as nobody ever picked up any call. I observed that other guests were frustrated with the Concierge staff... one couple had to wait a very long time for a taxi. The guest said that's why they had asked the staff to order a taxi for them but the concierge said there was "always a taxi available"...I had exactly the same experience - asked for them to arrange a taxi for me to the airport but they said there was no need - and then of course there were no taxis. The property comes across as one that the company forgot - The rooms were so-so... a bit drab, not very well-appointed - more like a 3-Star. The shower curtain in the bathtub was at least 12 inches too long - so much so that it swirled around my feet and clogged the drain unless I kept pulling it away. The staff in the breakfast room was very nice but the coffee was never hot enough and the buffet selection was pretty boring and none of the selections were outstanding, even the prosciutto - and that's saying someone when one is in Italy! The bar/lounge on the ground floor is dark and unattractive and the whole time I was there the Ladies Room was out of order - directed to "go back to your room" if you wanted to use the facilities. In short, give it a miss... many other hotels that are nicer AND less expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: njenga n
Reviews.Content: Couple on holiday. Central location near Spanish Steps. Concierge very helpful. Staff very courteous.Rooms very clean.Service cant complain. Excellent Italian food dishes in main restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Return”
Reviews.Author: Rjbrownmalta
Reviews.Content: We along, with some close friends returned for two nights to a very cold and snowy Rome to the Intercontinental. Its location at the top of the Spanish Steps is perfect for getting around, the shops and the Metro. We arrived at the hotel early, our Roomss were ready and we received upgrades based on my Intercontinental Ambassador status. Indeed we stayed(by chance) in exactly the same room as we did two years previously. Concierge services were excellent, we were helped out with a missing wallet, which was located in our room and rescued from the Hotel Splendide when the snow was so thick that no taxis were available and one of the employees came out in her own car with snow chains to drive us home at 1am in the morning. Breakfasts were good and filling and the hotel bar was an excellent meeting place with good bar snacks along with the drinks. Only fault and a very small one, was the failure to replace used toiletries for the second night, necessitating me having to use my wife's shampoo!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: anotnioefa
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is really on an amazing location, close to almost every single mayor site in rome, but... for me being a Royal Ambassador the experience was not as great as It has been on every other single Intercontinental Hotel I have been, and because of these I decided after returning to rome to go to another hotel. The staff didn't have a clue of my benefits as Royal Ambassador, the internet was going to be charged to me, the restaurant where they serve breakfast was not as clean as it should be, the terrace restaurant was closed, no intercontinental club, actually it was a really annoying experience to stay at the hotel on the other hand the holiday inn express where I stayed later on the attention everything the service the staff are just one of a kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nels1792
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last night on business. Excellent hotel and staff. Very nice front lobby and attentive staff. Two things that stand out are the location and breakfast. Both outstanding. It couldn't have a more convenient location. Yards from Spanish steps and Metro. Within a minute of walking out door u can start your Rome experience. And the favbulous breakfast starts the day right. I love to walk the streets of Rome and explore with the Metro as an easy, safe and clean way to move longer distances quickly. Room was 213, nice corner spot w plenty of room and purchased wifi was strong and reliable. Overall, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: 5starry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at the top of the Spanish Steps, next to the Hassler Hotel. The entrance and lobby are fairly ordinary, but the room we had facing the courtyard was gorgeous. This was, I believe, a standard room. Lovely furnishings, beautiful bathroom, wonderful outlook to the central courtyard. The staff were all very very friendly and helpful. The restaurant was lovely and the buffet breakfast was very very good. Dining was both indoors and out in the courtyard, food was excellent. It is a very old building and has loads of character. Be aware that if you have problems walking this could be a difficult location as you need to go down the hill either by the Spanish steps or walk downhill on the sidewalks, but loads of shopping whichever way you turn. The shopping around the Steps is outstanding, every top end store you can think of..and a few more. Walking down the hll by the road takes you past lots of lovely little stores, John didn't get past the gorgeous linen shirts in one window! Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: panter
Reviews.Content: As far as location, this can't be beat - right next door to the Hassler Hotel, and seconds from the Spanish Steps and all the shopping your heart can desire. We joined Priority Club and were able to get a free weekend night, upgrade, and free breakfast. We had a two room suite with a balcony for our family of three and as far as rooms in Europe go - this was extremely large. Concierge service was not great, but Priority Club helped us with a discounted tour of the City and Vatican. There is something very special about this hotel, and the feeling of Rome and the history of the city you get while staying there. Beds were comfortable, breakfast very good. Can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “3 days in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mack-73
Reviews.Content: A three night business trip saw me arrive at the intercontinental de la Ville at around midnight. Although pretty much closed the bar staff went out of their way to see that I was fed and watered –it was a much appreciated, great no fuss service. The room was tiny, looking at the fire escape map suggested that room 531 was the smallest on the floor and if it was any smaller it could only have been classed a broom cupboard. But it was warm, clean and the bed very comfortable; it was also a nice surprise to find elemis toiletries in the bathroom. The TV "system" was terrible; in this day and age it's disappointing that so many hotels have terrible systems. Breakfast was not value for money; 35 euros for a very average buffet seemed to me very steep even considering location etc. and the service despite being friendly was slow and needed a few reminders to bring my coffee. The decor of the hotel is just what I expected, old grandeur and in need of gutting. It reminded me of the grand hotel et de Milan before it was re-modelled. Overall, the intercontinental fitted my needs as a central base (its right at the top of the Spanish Steps –so a perfect place for shopping, eating and sightseeing) and I'd stay again on my next business but would head straightforward hotel de Russe if I was vacationing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding Venue”
Reviews.Author: nikkiobr
Reviews.Content: The ideal location and venue for a fairy tale wedding..... This hotel has loads to offer those looking for something special!! I'm Irish and my husband is Italian from Rome. I was looking for something different particularly for those travelling from Ireland and wanted a venue based in the city centre. We checked out a couple of places and finally decided on the Intercontinental. My husband loved the place from our first visit and I have to be honest I thought the hotel looked somewhat tired (similar to a number of the reviews), but the hotel grew on me and that's the charm to this old hotel. The hotel staff couldn't have been more friendly and Domenico ( Food & Beverage Manager) couldn't have done more for us to make our day perfect. So you might ask what makes this venue so special... So for me it was the variety of atmospheres we were able to offer along with the good food & wine. We had a fairly large wedding party (95) and got married at the end of sept. weather was amazing so worked perfectly for our venue... We started our wedding reception on the roof top terrace of the hotel which offers stunning views of the city and we enjoyed the sun setting with our family & friends ... Some apetitizers & prosecco.. We then moved to the internal gardens on the second floor of the hotel for an amazing antipasti buffet - my friends are still talking about this part of the wedding reception as they loved the food and atmosphere... Following this we moved into one of the main rooms just off the internal garden for the primi & secondi.. Again the food & wine was excellent... Finally, we ventured back out to the garden to an assortment of dolci and the wedding cake... ( you might think that it was a lot of moving but if you know Italian weddings this was over about 5 hours....) again the deserts were amazing. Finally, as the Irish must do we started the party & had the dj and dancing in one of the adjacent smaller rooms off the garden and danced till approx 1.30... This was really good as I thought the hotel were going to stop music at 12... The location of the hotel is second to none and the venue offering is spectacular.. That with good food & wine makes it a top class venue for any major event along with the assistance of Domenico and all the staff who served our food & drinks on the night... And of course as the bridal party we were provided with a complimentary suite in the hotel.. Again amazing with large balcony ( sun loungers/ table & chairs for 6 ) over looking the city where we enjoyed breakfast the following morning... Finally, all i can advise is ..if you are getting married in Rome check this hotel out as it gave us a truly amazing day/night we will never forget.....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location at the top of the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: irmos
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is centrally located right at the top of the Spanish Steps, two minutes to the main shopping street. The triple room was big enough for 2 adults + 1 child. In my opinion it was a little too hot in the room but maybe somebody likes it. Our bathroom was a good size with the window to the back of Spanish Steps. The breakfast was very good compare to Italy hotels in general. In general it is a good 5 star hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Good, but tired”
Reviews.Author: alexzhdanov
Reviews.Content: Be in the middle of everywhere! Good property with slow service, but "excellent" history. Too small rooms, too expensive, too nice, too cold in the bathroom (freeze wind from the street).. So! But, so strange, it is really good!

Reviews.Title: “Great Ancient Rome location at the top of the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: joycandoit
Reviews.Content: In the historic heart of a very ancient city in very ancient buildings with very ancient narrow streets, the hotel rooms are small, the elevator is tiny, and the common areas for lobby and food service are also very small. Of course such an ancient historic location in a world-class city is also pricey. BUT, the atmosphere is romantically and inspirationally ancient, both inside the hotel and outside, as you ponder the age of the real estate, the view of church domes adjacent as well as in the distance including the Vatican, feel the ancient pitted stone railings of the massive Spanish Steps, consider the repairs etched into the stones over the centuries and run your fingers through the water of the same fountain that has been there since the Middle Ages. Looking up at thousand-year-old balconies adorned with greenery and flowers in the middle of the city streets, one almost expected to see a Romeo and Juliet scene emerge in front of your eyes. Our small-but-adequate hotel room had a window on the interior marble courtyard which added to our romantic illusion of ancient nostalgia. We could walk to almost everything we wanted to do, except tourist attractions in other areas of Rome. Yes, the hotel service-charged us to death as they added an automatic percentage to everything, and uniformed staff attempted to serve us at every turn. However, the food in the hotel was very good, whether a full meal or just a cappuccino, and the service was excellent. We arrived from America on a Sunday, when most businesses including restaurants are closed, so we were grateful for the hotel's ability to provide a dining option. The wine list was also quite nice. Our room did not include breakfast in the price, but we saw the hotel's breakfast buffet menu in the tiny breakfast room, and realized that breakfast was very overpriced. However, we headed for the Vatican on Monday morning, and had a delicious breakfast in a cafe there at a very reasonable price. One morning, we purchased a cappuccino in the hotel's breakfast room, and the waitress brought pastries to go with it at no additional charge. This was a wonderful location in the heart of the best of ancient Rome. Americans who perceive this hotel as cramped and overpriced really need to remember where they are!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: cathysterling
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the De La VIlle 5 times, and this New Years Eve was even more incredible than the other 4 times! The lovely rooftop bar , The Emperors Terrace,was turned into a New Years Eve Party place...small and intimate, open to the sky, fire pots burning, lovely tables set with fresh oranges and panetone and our own bucket filled with champagne! The entire Roman panorama was filled with the color of fireworks...could it be anymore magical than this? The room was lovely and the most comfortable bed ever! Did not want to leave! The staff is always impeccable, helpful, and what a joy to be greeted everyday by all the staff! The restaurant is fabulous, what a chef! I also totally enjoyed the varied and delicious breakfast buffet....the gentleman that greets and seats you is of old world charm... THe location is perfect, make sure you go to Gregorys Jazz club and the end of the street....I love the old world charm of this hotel and its gracious staff. Thank you !

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: JerseyFamily_20
Reviews.Content: My daugther and I just came back from a five night stay at the Hotel de la Ville. We had a great time. The hotel is centrally located and is a short walk to the main shopping area and lots of great restaurants. The staff was very helpful. Our room was small and had no view but we were rarely there other then to sleep. The food in the main cafe was great - we had dinner and lunch there. I agree with the reviewers on breakfast - it was so so and on the expensive side. I would go again and would stay here but would look to get into a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “A Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Animitra
Reviews.Content: Small, cramped overpriced rooms. In a single room, you get enough room to either put your suitcase on the table or on the bed. If you put the suitcase on the floor (there being no such luxury as a stand for the suitcase) you don't have adequate space to walk to the door... Pathetic service. The "included" breakfast was a joke... Extremely over-priced food. The View is beautiful but the view doesn't fill your stomach or give you a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great service, frighteningly expensive”
Reviews.Author: cheapskate1959
Reviews.Content: FIrst off, remember this hotel is ANCIENT, and the rooms are indeed small, some truly tiny. If you are staying with a cruise line, try to ask for a complimentary room upgrade on check in -- blame it on having too much luggage, or spouse or whatever. They do try to help when they can, the staff is terrific. Rooms facing the courtyard on say floor 5 and up are nicest and very quiet. Internet is stupidly expensive, there is a cafe about half way down the hill on the same side of the street that has free wi-fi. Go there for a less expensive breakfast (though still far from cheap) and use the free wi fi at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay again”
Reviews.Author: SKWCRH
Reviews.Content: Room was smaller than our cabin on the cruise ship. We had requested 2 beds-only got one. No view. Breakfast was not ready when we went down 1/2 hour after it was suppose to have started. Concierge and bell hops were not helpful or friendly. We were charged nearly $1200 for this room. I have stayed in Choice hotels in the USA that were nicer, friendlier and paid less than $100. My cousin and I feel like we were really ripped off on this hotel, both by the hotel and by Regent Cruises who booked it for us.

Reviews.Title: “A great location and well run”
Reviews.Author: CES911
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days here during October. The location is fantastic, top of the Spanish steps and yet without the crowds and noise. The concierges were extremely helpful and even though they were quite busy they were patient and helpful with each guest. We had a deluxe room and although on the street, the double pane windows made it perfectly quiet. Service is excellent - I was finishing a document on my computer when I noticed that my battery was almost drained, however, when I went to plug it in, I had forgotten my converter! Within 5 minutes the hotel delivered a converter to my room, saving my work and getting my document out on time - very good internet connection btw. The roof top terrace is a great view over the city but, be warned, it is kitsch and some very loud Americans can be present and the food is only mediocre so go for drinks and then head out for dinner. Yes, the hotel is not cheap (and if that is what you want then don't stay here) but you get what you pay for and the hotel delivered on value.

Reviews.Title: “Grate shopping location”
Reviews.Author: cyprianc
Reviews.Content: If you consider visiting Rome for little seasonal shopping, I would stay at InterContinental de la Ville. It has a perfect location, right in the middle of shopping heaven. Besides a great location it offers quite and comfortable rooms, although the view depends on your room option. I am a picky person so here are some of the bed things: - shower - bad lightning, very small - safe - in wall safe next to the bad in a hard to reach place - air-condition - didn't work, but the window was sufficiently airy - breakfast - very little choice in the buffe - closet - very small - internet - expensive if you stay longer then 24 hours (around 23 Euro per day) Overall I give 4 stars... and yes I would stay their again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and perfectly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peltt
Reviews.Content: There were lots of positives at this hotel. Our first impression was of the beautiful Christmas decorations in the lobby, lounge and on each level of the staircase. The lobby is small, but leads onto a cosy and comfortable lounge and bar area. The concierge service was very good with knowledgeable staff, keen to help and respond to questions. Our room was a good size, with a balcony decorated with flower boxes. From the balcony we could look down onto an attractive courtyard garden, lit with Christmas lights. The room was attractively furnished, with a high ceiling, a large and comfortable bed, a good size flat screen television, and formal furnishings. We had a large smart bathroom with plenty of Elemis toiletries. There were only two minor negatives during the stay. The first is that in our room, we could hear clearly the voices of the guests in the next room and could hear their television, so the sound-insulation was not very effective. The second, even more minor suggestion, is that the hotel could insert those small magnets at the bottom of the shower curtain to hold the curtain against the metal side of the bath. While taking a shower the curtain wrapped itself around me, so I switched to taking baths instead. Overall, we really enjoyed our weekend stay at the hotel. Using the Ambassador Weekend Certificate for one free night, a complimentary room upgrade, and the 'welcome pack' of wine, water and fruit, helped make this a decent value hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traveller73London
Reviews.Content: We spent a great long weekend at the Intercontinental Rome. Very warm welcome at reception and helpful concierge. As an Ambassador member we received an upgrade from an executive room to an exec room with a view. Not the biggest 'leap' but any upgrade is always welcome I guess. As other reviewers have remarked, the rooms are on the small side although we were lucky enough to have a small terrace which, even in the November sun, we were able to use. However, the 'view' did require you to really lean over the parapet to see beyond the building across the street. This is a good sound choice for a stay in Rome in a great location. In terms of value, the rates are pretty steep and I had hoped to use a free night voucher which unfortunately did not arrive in time. Although similar grade hotels seemed to be priced around the same level. Rome generally is extremely expensive. I was happy with our stay and other than wishing for a larger room we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Summer Vacation 2011”
Reviews.Author: realfan68
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at this hotel in July 2011 for four days during our visit to Rome. We absolutely loved the location of the hotel which was right on top of the Spanish Steps and just a few minutes from a number of shops, restaurants, etc. We thought the hotel actually could not have been more well located. As for the property itself, we were given a family suite which consisted of one separate bedroom/bathroom and then a large family room outside of the bedroom with a pullout sofabed. We had an extra small rollaway bed brought in to accommodate my son. The only downside was that the four of us had to share one bathroom. We never ate at the property (why would you?) and were able to find great places for breakfast, lunch and dinner every day. Overall, we'd stay here again. I am a member of the Ambassador program for frequent Intercontinental stays so that played into my decision. There are probably better places to stay, but this hotel fit the bill for us and we'll likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: MdeS2011
Reviews.Content: Staying here now on the 5th floor. Room is spotless and plenty big enough. However it says it's a junior suite so not sure what the classic room we paid for would have been like! Amazing concierge who is ultra helpful. Lovely staff overall.

Reviews.Title: “PreCruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: howelldw
Reviews.Content: Hello, We recently stayed at the Intercontinental Roma on 10/29/11 for one night using my Holiday Inn points. Upon arrival at 9:30am, we were offered an upgraded room if we want to wait approx 1 hrs for it to be available. That was a very nice gesture and we took them up on it. We dropped off our bags at the desk and headed out for touring. There is a cab stand right outside the front door and about $10E will get you to any main attraction. We went to the Vatician for the first half of the day and the Colosseum the second half of the day. It was approx 6pm when we made it back to the hotel. Our room was nice with a balcony overlooking the courtyard. It was a little noisy around midnight, but other than that, it was great. The next morning we took 3-4 hours to go see the Trevi Fountain, the Pantheon, and the Spanish Steps. Our car service picked us up at 11am local and took us to the cruise port. The drive is approx 1 hr depending on traffic. Rome can be seen and a day and a half, but you have to push thru jet lag and keep moving. Car service from FCO airport to hotel is $40E, Hotel to Port is $110E Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: MonyetS
Reviews.Content: Sure the location is good, but otherwise it is certainly not worth the price. Our room was very ordinary and there are were not even coffee making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “great location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: penerica
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with spouse and 14 year daughter. Hotel staff are very accommodating. Consierge was great and went out of his way to try to locate a lost bag at the airport. Location is right at the spanish steps top. Subway is close and could walk with bags easily. Clean, well kept hotel with old world charm.

Reviews.Title: “Roma at its best!”
Reviews.Author: drtw2503
Reviews.Content: Classic old time Roman hotel. Very well kept, immaculate rooms and public areas. Staff friendly and helpful. Don't be afraid to use the concierge - extremely good insights and recommendations. Yes, it is at the top of the Spanish Steps, but there is an elevator a few stores to the left of the steps!! Location can't be beat!!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location at top of Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: mbeth1403
Reviews.Content: Spouse, adult son and I recently spent five nights at this hotel. As it was son's first visit to Rome, we wanted a central location. Hotel is at top of the Spanish Steps (all 135 of them), but during the day there is an elevator next to the Metro station that will bring one from below to the top, thus avoiding not only the climb itself, but also the touts flogging all manner of cheap tat: blob toys, umbrellas, flowers, etc. Learn the phrase, "in nessun caso," (certainly not) and make waving away motions with your hands. As to the hotel: lovely, traditional property, nicely furnished. No minimalism here. Rooms on the small side, but clean and bright. The water was hot and had good pressure. Bathtub was nice and deep (good for soaking after a long day of sightseeing.) Staff was efficient. Only, minor, issue was front desk being unwilling/unable to change 50 euro note to smaller bills one morning. Later, spouse had no such issues. We stayed here on points, and were upgraded to a room large enough for a separate bed. Still small, but if one packs light that is not an issue. Food is expensive, but good. We had a lovely meal at the rooftop resto one evening, which, as it was the weekend, featured a good singer. That resto does close in colder, windy weather. One must pay for internet access if not possessing a laptop. However, staff was very helpful so we could buy Vatican Museum tickets on-line an avoid the long, long lines. Worth the 4 euros per person: less time in line means more time to see art. I would certainly stay here again if I can accumulate enough points, as it is pricey, especially with such a weak dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Well location”
Reviews.Author: h2a
Reviews.Content: Close to the up the spanisch stairs, it is well located. The room is small but suitable a couple. The restaurant is bad. I found this hotell thru priceline.com by $ 300 per day (a nice price to this categorie in Rome)

Reviews.Title: “Very central location”
Reviews.Author: greeneyes010
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and wonderful location. Room was comfortable and big enough. After few days of walking around the city... those 133 Spanish Steps felt like 500. Definitely would recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, ok location”
Reviews.Author: EarthWanderlust
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well appointed, my room was well appointed but very small. I had a nice patio to stretch out and relax. The best thing about this hotel though is the restaurant/bar on top of the hotel, the view is amazing and its very relaxing up there after dodging cars and people all day in the bustling city of Roma :)

Reviews.Title: “First time in Rome - hotel is ideal”
Reviews.Author: J W
Reviews.Content: Staying in hotel for 5 nights following a 2 week cruise and first time in rome. The location is very convenient, the staff very helpful and room is large, luxurious and clean. We love the classic old world decor and being within eye sight of the spanish steps are close to everything. We are in love with Rome but have not broken the code of good restaurants yet. After a stop with lunch in FLorence on the cruise we are disappointed with the food choices so far. However I would recommend this hotel, it isnt inexpensive but we are very happy here thus far.

Reviews.Title: “Good Staff, the rest, OK?”
Reviews.Author: dodger1226
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 8-11 October 2011. Staff was very nice, accommodating and friendly, we put the Concierges to work, they are patient people. The room was clean and quite, even being on the 1st floor overlooking the street. It was also about the size one would expect for the center or near-center of Rome...a little small but OK. The bed was a bit strange, two twin beds pushed together, separate sheets and all. I am a Priority Gold member and made the reservation about a month in advance so I would expect this is the type most available in the Hotel...not complaining just stating a fact. Wifi worked well throughout. We did not eat a the hotel. The Hotel was just at the top of the Spanish Steps, next door to the Hassler, for us a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on our last night in Rome. Our room was fantastic (we were upgraded to the room with the two balcony doors!!) I highly recommend having drinks or dinner on the rooftop - you get a spectacular view of Rome, the food and service is excellent and there is entertainment as well. They also provide you with blankets to cover your shoulders if you feel chilled. Fantastic experience. The hotel is located two doors down from the Spanish Steps. If you're looking for a good restaurant, try going up a block and you'll see a number of restaurants that are good. We unfortunately went down the steps to the neighbourhood below and had horrible food that had to be sent back. McDonald's would have been better, and we don't eat at McDonald's.....

Reviews.Title: “Room with a View!!”
Reviews.Author: patsones
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first experience in Rome! We started our trip with a couple nights stay at the InterContinental. It is a luxury hotel as advertised, with age, beauty and history that adds to the experience. The service was excellent and it was very helpful that most spoke english. We were in a suite with a beautiful marble bath and a balcony looking towards the Spanish Steps. The highlight is the view from the rooftop lounge at night. Magnificent! Looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and classy with à suburb vieuw over Via Dei Condotti”
Reviews.Author: DACHALADACHA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week and Will check out later today. Had an very comfortable stay in one of the suites. Which were Nice Spacious and classic decorated. THE building itself is old/classic but well maintained. Breakfast was more than good and à lot of choice... Can say conform the standards of the kind of hotel. THE service they are giving you is good, Nice and friendly. Whatever department. Room service quick and whatever whish I had, Nothing was impossible....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Petracca
Reviews.Content: If shopping is your thing, then you couldn't ask for a better location. However if you want to do the tourist thing & not up for walking then the can rank is just outside the door. The hotel provided good service. Roof top bar offers great views of Rome & live entertainment. Service was good and rooms well maintained. Balcony was a nice to have however offered no view.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: MichelleC06
Reviews.Content: I'll start with what's good - the rooftop bar has an awesome view of the city and the service there is quite good. Now, on to the rest of the hotel. This is by no means a 5 star property. Not even close. It's an old building. I get it. But the rooms are musty, moldy and stinky. Our a/c vent was covered in black muck and our clothes felt damp after being there a day. We stayed 4 nights at a rate of $325 per night and shared with the hotel by email in advance that we were celebrating our honeymoon. As far as I could tell, our room was about as basic & blah as the hotel could offer. Tiny. No view. Uncomfortable. Smelly. Service is pretty standard. Not very personalized or elegant, but OK. The location is central and I imagine if it was a 3 star hotel at a substantially lower rate I would not have been as disappointed. However, having just spent 3 nights at the FABULOUS St Regis in Florence this was a major, major let down. Don't go thinking luxury in anyway. Rome is a blast though!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic old style elegance”
Reviews.Author: freeball
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, rooms slightly small but this is a hotel in the centre of town so probably what you might expect. Staff very friendly and knowledgeable, service exceptional. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: drorcohen
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well positioned, very nice and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a dream”
Reviews.Author: ISRAEL K
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Hotel De Ville,after switching from another top hotel nearby,what a difference,everybody smiles to you,the rooms are very very comfortable and ,again,the service is perfect. Planning our next and longer stay in this paradise hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and wonderful Rome experience.”
Reviews.Author: Deefifi
Reviews.Content: We rang the Hotel directly to make our booking, requesting a King room interconnecting with 3 singles for our family of 5, which was exactly what we received on check in for our 3 night stay. The Hotel was really helpful in assisting to arrange an airport transfer. Fabio was waiting for us as we came through customs which was fantastic especially after 24hrs plus of traveling time to Rome. He collected our bags and delivered our tired family safely & in comfort to the Hotel. This is Rome, where Hotels are housed in ancient buildings, not USA or Australian modern day structures, so as to be expected our rooms were not large, but instead, lovely, authentic & well appointed rooms with gorgeous opening balconies onto via Sistina below. Beds & pillows very comfortable & breakfast great in a lovely courtyard. The staff were always friendly, helpful & courteous. Fabulous location for exploring Rome, a little on the pricey side, but worth it if you want a great location & true Roman experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but very nice”
Reviews.Author: miless
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights ahead of a cruise in September 2011. First night booked via reward points (40,000). Second night was booked via last minute dot com @ £160 for the room only (Intercontinental wanted 350 Euros). Great location at the top of the Spanish steps and also only 15 minute walk from Trevi fountain. I emailed hotel twice ahead of our stay to say we had two reservations for the two consecutive nights but via different booking methods, giving full details of both bookings. I asked if we could stay in the same room for both nights. On arrival, they seemed unaware of the second nights reservation but quickly confirmed I could stay in the same room ok. On the seconf day, on returning to our room mid afternoon, the room key would not work - clearly we were only booked into that room originally for one night - I went to reception and they sorted it quickly though. The room was ready for us despite arriving at 11.15am - nice touch. Room was a decent size (classic double) without being large - certainly not small though - with nice period furniture. Bathrrom was lovely with robes, slippers and luxury toiletries etc. TV was modern and had internet / movies but extremley pricey. Concierge staff where very helpful and knowledgeable and where happy to adivse on routes / sightseeing / timings etc. Roof top bar was nice with live music (Saxophone player) - Diet coke and a glass of wine approx 19 Euros. (Wine was 13, coke was 6) We purchased internet for 24 hours at approx 4pm on first day but it did not work at 9.15am the next day, our departure day. Told reception who immeadiately removed the whole cost from the bill - great customer service. Lounge area on ground floor is warm and welcoming. Lounge / bar on first floor (with piano) was closed during our stay - not sure of the reason?? All in all, a lovely hotel but a little pricey. We ate out for breakfast, lunch and dinner as the hotels meals were way too pricey for us. We got train from airport to Termini station and then taxi to hotel. 23 Euros. I handed him a 20 Euro note and then looked into my wallet to get another 5 (I was going to give him the 25 with a 2 Euro tip). When I handed him the 5 Euro note, he was holding a 5 Euro note himeself and then argued that I had only given him 10 Euros. I know for sure I didn't. I ended up giving him another 13 Euros - so I had been ripped off to the tune of 15 Euros. On return to train station we got Hotel bell boy to order a taxi and asked him how much we could expect to pay - 10 to 11 Euro's he said. Good enough, at Termini station, the driver asked us for 11 Euros - so beware of theiving Taxi drivers!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Roux58
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a perfect location, right near the Spanish steps, The service at the hotel is quite good, particularly Nicolas, the concierge. However, the tiny rooms do not justify the exorbitant rates.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Italy, Intercontinental Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JK89KDW
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located at the top of Spanish steps, a perfect location! Great restaurants onsite and several also located around the hotel. Our room was nice and comfortable and the staff very responsive to every need. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My 40 year old daughter called it "life changing"”
Reviews.Author: stecor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the de la Ville on 4 previous occasions. On our eldest daughter's 40th birthday, we took her on a cruise around Italy with a 3 night stay in Rome prior to sailing. We secured two seventh floor rooms in a suite arrangement - she had a wonderful courtyard view and we had the room and view of Roma we always request - including a 10'X25' terrace. Our daughter was speechless as she stood on our terrace and saw all of Rome before her - the Vatican, The Pantheon, Victor Emanual, etc. When the church bells rang it was even more perfect. She saw all the sights she could in 3 days, but besides the Borghese Gallery, her favorite thing we did was to buy cheese, mortadella, olives, bread and vino and then eat and drink on the terrace every evening as the sun set and the lights came up over the city. The hotel is quirky good in design, and the service is impeccable. Location at the top of the Spanish Steps is great for walking to sights or taking subway. I know Intercontinental is a large chain, but the uniquiness of this property shines through. Unqualified two thumbs up for unique experience, consistent service and great memories. It draws us back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I also stayed here in January all by myself - LOVE THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cleopatra561
Reviews.Content: This is, in my opinion, the BEST hotel in Rome. It has the best location, the best service, the best breakfast, and the best rooms. The staff is wonderful and attentive, and a very special thank you to Mr. Giacomo Pica, the duty manager, who always takes such good care of us, and makes sure that every little detail is perfect. I stay here at least once a year, sometimes 2 to 3 times a year, and I am never disappointed. It is beautiful, and the recent upgrades are fantastic. Love the new luncheon/bar in the lobby, as well as the refurbished restaurant. All the rooms are beautiful. You cannot go wrong with this hotel. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Had my Wedding & Reception there, Not a great experiance!”
Reviews.Author: angel34
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at this hotel, but I had organised my Wedding and Evening Reception there.. The communication before the wedding was brilliant, and the general Manager met me as I arrived at the hotel.. I was told the day before that my guests were not allowed to arrive before 3.30 (which was the time the ceremony was to start) I got there and we had the wedding in the Garden Terrace on the 2nd floor, Wedding was beautiful and incredibly private, The evening reception however was a completely different story.. We were told there was somewhere to plug in our ipod and that was fine, however when we went to put the music on to dance, which I assure you was not loud we were repeatedly told to turn it down!! I was then on tenderhooks and kept telling the person incharge to keep it down! they had opened the other section of the restaurant to guests, something i was not aware was going to happen, there was 1 couple eating and apparently they complained to the waiters!! They should have not been allowed to eat there or at least been told there was a wedding going on.. I had originally booked a room for the evening reception but the day before the wedding was told we would be in the garden terrace for everything and would not be using the room!! At 8.30 we were being constantly looked at by the staff and I was made to feel like my wedding had come to an abrupt end.. I was absolutely devasted.. I complained to the hotel, and all they told me was that the music was too loud and they had guests in rooms overlooking the terrace, but we did have a bottle of wine extra they didn't charge us for!! I have since complained to the hotel via customer services twice, and customer services assured me on both counts that I would hear directly from the hotel to resolve this.. I have not heard a word from the hotel and I am deeply disappointed by there customer service!!. Despite the General Manager telling me as I arrived they were honoured to have our wedding as it was the 1st English wedding they had ever had there.. If you want an incredible hotel with incredible service stay at the Hassler Hotel, right next door!! I certainly do not feel i got my monies worth after the way i was treated

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged and unresponsive”
Reviews.Author: b h
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights in Rome at the end of our honeymoon. We'd booked the hotel through Priceline and paid them for the room. When we checked out, the desk clerk told my wife that the hotel had a different arrangement with online sites and we actually had to pay the hotel, not the site. Since we needed to make our flight home, my wife had the clerk run the card and we left. The clerk was wrong. Priceline had already charged us and, although it has been two weeks, we've not heard back from the hotel nor have we been refunded the hundreds of dollars the hotel charged us. They've even been fined by InterContental's customer service office because of how poorly they've treated us and how unresponsive they've been. This is an unprofessional hotel and no one should stay here. Also, they gave us double beds when we explicitly requested one bed because we were on our honeymoon. The clerk even told us we'd have one bed and we didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,”
Reviews.Author: Justanotherguest
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well located, location, location, location hotel recommeded a few good restaurants including La Caprichosa, which is 10 minute walk from hotel. We had a room on 6 floor facing the back, quite a small room in need of renovation. No alarm clock or coffee/tea machine in room, Maid woke us up twice at 8:30 by knocking on the door and then just leaving, when asked her what she wanted she just said sorry, I think she did not speak english or much Italian. Breakfast is fine, on outside terrace on second floor, service could be better. Terrace bar on 6 floor is great, live saxophone player. did not have lunch nor dinner in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs to improve in service.”
Reviews.Author: Carlos147320
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days, the hotel has a great location but needs to improve in a lot of areas. Restaurant services lack food quality. Dinner and breakfast were extremely expensive and the quality of food was poor. How can you serve a bolognese for $30 cold? Wi Fi services were very expensive and the connection very erratic. You spend almost $35 per day in wifi in this time and age for an inconsistent connection that does not let you downstream video content. Finally, the icing on the cake, concierge services made you feel they were doing a favor to you although they always sent you to the same restaurant. Only the woman working during the day knew what she was doing. i'm convinced that Intercontinental needs to revamp the service of this hotel drastically.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Simon J
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - situated at the top of the Spanish Steps it is ideal for exploring Rome. The room was very impressive, but dining or having a drink in the hotel bar is incredibly expensive even by Rome standards. Finally I would not go again in August - far too hot and far too crowded!

Reviews.Title: “never again, i am not a liar!!”
Reviews.Author: sbwsbw
Reviews.Content: What is your Priority Club status? Royal Ambassador, stayed 2 nights last weekend both on Reward Were you (or for multi-stayers are you generally) happy with the hotel/stay? Not at all Which room did you book and which upgrade did you receive? Booked a Classic room, got a Executive Room with Balcony How are the rooms? Room was already when checked in. the smallest room I have ever stayed in any IC hotels. The balcony faces inner garden. No kettle or coffe maker. a small safe in the wall. no exec. lounge What was your welcome gift? Half bottle of red wine with a small basket of fruit and a small bottle of stilll water. What was good? * Nice location, 1 min to Spanish Steps What was bad? *Waken up in early morning both days by the hammering works. *Staffs on ground floor just walked pass you without any greetings. *Very rude male staff when check out. *We were told the mini bar would be free but tried to charge us when check out. They said that they never would mention 'free' and we might not understand english. That rude male staff even said no IC would give free mini bar on Reward stays but I told him that New York Time Square has just done it. Would you return? Not in a million years unless they change their standard of service

Reviews.Title: “A great location from which to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: LesW2020
Reviews.Content: August is holiday month in Rome/Italy so it isa good time to get good deals but the main restaurant was closed except for breakfast. The Terrace was a good substitute. The hotel is located above the Spanish Steps but we only walked the stairs once in each directtion. Taxis are readily available but we walked mostly everywhere. The staff were very helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful”
Reviews.Author: leighdesigns
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried about this hotel because of some of the reviews. We booked through our AMX platinum card and were treated to a delightful breakfast and gift basket in our room! The concierges were extremely helpful with dinner reservations. Most importantly they really got us out of a jam, we forgot our passports in the safe, they found them, overnighted them to our next hotel, call our hotel in Positano and gave them the numbers. We will be back! Thanks for making our first trip to Rome so fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: funky18
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel and everyone is eager to assist you, I was very disappointed that the front desk clerk did not recognize my mobility issue and gave me a room on the second floor whereby I had to walk up or down 20 steps. This is definitely not a hotel to stay in if you have mobility issues. The General Manager attempted to fix it but we were leaving the next day on a cruise. The food is excellent and the staff attentive. We took a private limousine tour from the Hassler and this was the best sight seeing tour I have ever had in Rome (I have been there 15 times). I do not know how he navigates in and out of the traffic but he was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “hotel location is fantastic, rate too high”
Reviews.Author: motek m
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel is fantastic, but we find the rate is too expensive . the room is small and the amenities are not good. the hot water did not work for one day, when we called for service , it takes more than 30 mins to show up, and she still cannot fix the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: MamaPlanner
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel location. We walked everywhere and never felt unsafe. We only took a cab when we were really tired. Did not try the public transporation in Rome, as we were only there 3 nights and one was the day we landed. Food overpriced at this hotel, so we did not eat any meals here. Breakfast was not included for us as we were a reward stay. Hotel staff was very helpful and polite. We had two rooms at the end of a small hall way, so we could leave doors open to each room when needed and close outside hallway door. Kids room was two twins and ours a double. Kids room bigger and better than ours. beds were extremely comfortable and bathrooms fine. great closet/drawer space for a short stay. great view of spanish steps.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: fayeq8
Reviews.Content: this hotel has great location very closed to spanish steps and shopping center and very safe. highly recommend this hotel and nice breakfast although a little bit costly but it is good.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, great service, decent but pricey hotel.”
Reviews.Author: inga07
Reviews.Content: Let's start with what I didn't like - When we first checked in, the room was stinking of something - I assume the previous occupant had smoked (non-smoking room) and they had tried to cover it up. The stench, luckily, disappeared after a while, but one would expect this to be sorted out before one checks in. The services and food in the hotel are definitely overpriced - 20 eur for a drink, 23 for pasta? And my biggest complaint, Wi-fi really should be free nowadays and not 12 eur per hour! The rooms and bathrooms are small and the hotel obviously not newly built, but otherwise everything was of good quality and clean, no complaints. What I did like - location, of course, can't get much better than this. Very good service, especially the concierge desk - could answer all my questions and offered excellent suggestions. So in conclusion, yes would probably go there again.

Reviews.Title: “SO SO Honeymoon stop...”
Reviews.Author: Brewer503
Reviews.Content: On my recent stay a the De La Ville Roma I experienced a issues that affected me stay in a negative way. Being a Platinum/Diamond/Gold member at multiple hotel chains, and not having to pay $200 EXTRA for "Ambassador" membership at those chains I expected a lot. The top benefit to being an ambassador, Upgrade to a superior room: My room at your hotel was slightly larger than the "King" bed that it contained. When i say "King" I am referencing the two twin beds that were covered with King bedding. This makes for an extremely uncomfortable night’s sleep(I was on my Honeymoon, unable to sleep next to my wife). Perhaps I am expecting too much based on my last two stays at the Rome Cavalieri. Looking at the floor plan on the fire escape map I didn’t see any other rooms as small as mine, without a porch and no city view. How is this an “upgrade" at a luxury Hotel? Please explain this to me… Skip the so-so breakfast buffet, 50 Euro for the wife and I to eat! The Location was nice, we were able to see St Peters with no line and Gelato on the Spanish Step just outside the hotel was wonderful. Being that this was a points stay I cant comment on the value, but i will being staying at the Cavalieri on my next trip to Rome, Points or Paid... Platinum Ambassador

Reviews.Title: “We have found a true home away from home and wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: spikespike
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is perfectly situated - at the top of the Spanish steps - with breathtaking view from every room, The outdoor breakfast was perfect way to start each day - the rooms were perfectly appointed - and very quiet despite the lively scene nearby.The rooftop bar was the perfect place to end the night - overlooking all of Rome! But the staff were the true stars - they actually removed doorways, installed haindrails and built ramps- on the spot to accomodate our needs- They made our comfort a priority - and we would never stay anywhere else in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Location is numero uno (no 1) ...”
Reviews.Author: nexus69
Reviews.Content: Having been to Rome many times, we chose to stay in Intercontinental de la Ville this time because of its location at the top of the Spanish Steps. We were most delighted with the prime location because we liked the convenience of walking around to the main areas of interest around the city e.g. Piazza del Popolo, Fontane Trevi, Pantheon, etc .... all of them a pleasant walk from the hotel. Rome is a city that is best explored on foot. At the end of the day, it was always a pleasure to come back to Piazza Spagna and walk up the Spanish steps to the hotel. The hotel was quietly luxurious and the service was helpful and friendly. The room we had was comfortably large and overlooked a small beautiful courtyard which was beside the breakfast hall. Breakfast was served in a beautiful hall and it was delicious. We had a very good room rate due to the time of the year, which made it even better for us! We have stayed in other fine hotels in Rome such as Cavalieri Hilton (now Waldorf group) and Lord Byron - but these hotels, though more luxurious, was rather far away from the Rome city centre and we very much prefer the location of Intercontinental. When we left to go to Milan, the doorman, who was most charming and friendly, asked me why was it necessary for us to go to Milan, since the only good thing in Milan was the train from Rome! We would hope to stay here again one day ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Betweenmeals
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in intercontinental hotels many times we were disappointed no executive lounge existed. The room was clean yet small. The outdoor area was an excellent place to enjoy Rome by night albeit expensive. The location is the best thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cocokelly
Reviews.Content: I felt a little guilty about staying in a chain hotel in Rome and not a smaller inn, but since everything historical is recycled in Rome, we were very pleased that it turned out to be an old hotel with plenty of charm and ambiance. Its not as slick as some of the modern intercontinentals I have stayed it (which is where I think some of its negative reviews have come from) but it would be a crime if it was. It is lovely, crisp and clean and well cared for. We had two different rooms during our stay and both were spacious (for Europe) and beautifully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel By American Standards”
Reviews.Author: adamsaintlouis
Reviews.Content: Overall the InterContinental de la Ville is an average hotel by American standards (Hilton/Marriott quality). The room was nicely appointed and clean; the bathroom was large for Europe (had a tub that fit 2 of us easily). If you travel to Europe often you will likely find this to be a 4* hotel. For Americans not used to the European hotel standards, you may be disappointed. I would never pay full price for this hotel. We got it on Priceline for a steal. The service is aweful. Typical Rome, but still I expect more out of a property of this caliber. Staff was very rude and not helpful or courteous in any way. The location is very good - literally right across the street from the Spanish Steps. Overall we liked the location, the large bathtub, and the nicely done rooms. The service though was quite poor.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: nine52
Reviews.Content: A warm welcome, a nice room with a balcony overlooking the city, a very efficient concierge, a buffet for breakfast, which is average level and a very nice location (above the Piazza di Spania) and close by taxi or by walking for the brave ones from every important place to be seen in Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, average, great location”
Reviews.Author: asia6666
Reviews.Content: Nothing special , well below Intercont standard , but nothing WRONG with it per se. Breakfast was good, room service was too expensive and poor food quality, the rooftop bar deserted most of the time. Needs quite an overhaul

Reviews.Title: “Awful service, expensive for what they offer. Only the location is 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: risrz
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights and were extremely disappointed with the level of service and the condition of the rooms. The lack of attention to detail at this hotel made our stay extremely disappointing. Would not recommend it to anyone. Only the location was is 5 stars! The hotel should not be rated 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ZiadR
Reviews.Content: The decor and furnishings  in the hotel are very plush and attractive and the location at the top of the Spanish Steps is excellent. The room was nicely furnished and was the small size you would expect in Europe but there were no drawers in the room, nor an iron. Also, the safe was not working. There is very little space in the bathroom to put anything although, like the room, it looks very nice. At 8 morning I left a "please make up my room" sign on the door and when I came back at nearly 4 the room had not been done. When I asked about it they said I had to request room cleaning. At the front desk I tried to change some money into smaller denominations and they said they couldn't. Sitting in the coffee lounge you are totally ignored by (some) staff and you have to go up to them and ask to make an order. Finally, being a Priority club platinum member meant absolutely nothing to them nothing to them. This was a disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here on a deal - great for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: SlapstickBeds
Reviews.Content: I am a Brit and used to average service and I am not a regular at IC hotels. Hubby and I booked a holiday in Rome and got a great deal at a great price on a UK travel website, which gave us accommodation at the Intercontinental de la Ville on a room only basis. For the price we paid, it was fantastic. Before we arrived, I contacted the hotel and asked for a firm bed if possible and a room away from the road, which I understood could be noisy. The hotel replied with a polite, helpful response. On arrival, we were given a quiet room with a decent bed. The room itself was small. However, we decided that the dimensions of the room weren't a problem, so much as the lack of furniture in which to store our clothes. Anyhow, this was our only niggle. The bed was fine, the air con worked effectively, the bathroom was clean and functioning, and we had a teeny tiny balcony, too. The hotel has a bar on the roof, which means it is a really lovely spot to enjoy views over Rome. It was a shame for us that the menu was very expensive in all respects: no good value house wine, no happy hour, nor promoted drinks. It offered 'international' food which didn't make us inclined to eat there. A beer was 10 Euros and a glass of wine was 12 Euros upwards, as I recall, with none of them fantastic wines. Our room rate didn't include breakfast and I had imagined us popping to a nearby cafe for a coffee and reasonably priced pastry or similar for breakfast. We did frequent a cafe just down the road from the hotel, which made an excellent coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice, but it was a wallet-draining experience for little joy (on the food front). The hotel interior on the ground floor is rather nice with a pleasant lobby and bar area. We found the staff very pleasant and helpful and particularly (and for us probably the highlight of the hotel) the concierge desk. We asked for information, directions, help with booking a taxi (our choice of taxi) back to the airport, and we asked for restaurant recommendations on several occasions. On every occasion the concierge staff were polite and happy to help and the recommendations for restaurants were excellent. I would return to this hotel, although I would be loathe to have a similar room at full price. On the deal we had, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, dirty rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Joecristeveami
Reviews.Content: Like I've never had a bad meal in Italy, I've never met an Italian I didnt like. Until now. The staff at the hotel was extremely unaccomodating and not service oriented. Everything was a problem or a hassle for them. They were rude and abrupt with us. I will never pay that much money again to be treated so poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Classic luxury and service”
Reviews.Author: afalduto
Reviews.Content: For a solo traveller and first timer in Rome, this hotel is perfectly located at the top of the Spanish steps and is quite central for exploring Rome on foot. Staff are helpful and friendly. An evening listening to live jazz on the terrace overlooking the city is a perfect way to end a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “All of Rome in View”
Reviews.Author: Lori S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the beginning of a tour through Tuscany and Umbria, to get over jet-lag prior to the tour. We each booked a room with a balcony overlooking the inner courtyard, and with the AMEX Platinum upgrade we received an AMAZING suite with a private terrace overlooking all of Rome. We could see for miles! The room was huge with a bathroom the size of a normal European hotel room. The decor was old world but stylish, and the linens were lovely. The location is also perfect, right at the top of the Spanish Steps next to the Hotel Hassler. The included breakfast was one of the finest I have ever seen, with everything you can imagine being served buffet style! We were meeting up with a tour at another hotel, so we also enjoyed the 4pm check out service offered by AMEX. The only problem we had was finding a convenient place to eat dinner close to the hotel, and we should have asked for help from the Concierge. We walked all over town seeing the sites to try and beat jet-lag, and were perfectly successful at doing that, but were exhausted by 6pm when it was time to eat. The next day we enjoyed the open-top bus tour, and I recommend that as a good way to see ALL of the sites in town. Overall, this was the perfect beginning to a perfect Italian holiday!

Reviews.Title: “These people should be sued.......I may well do that”
Reviews.Author: BarryAscot
Reviews.Content: I am going to review all I can, which isn’t much. Here goes:- My family are a family of FIVE (two adults and three small children). We ALWAYS reserve either a two-bedroom suite with an extra bed for child number 3, or two interconnecting rooms with an extra bed. We have been doing exactly this for the past seven years with no exceptions. We had booked to visit Athens to show our children the sights a while back but had to cancel after the riots started. To make up for it, some months later, with no sign of Greece settling down, we decided to substitute a trip to Rome. As we intended to be out site-seeing every day, we didn’t book our usual two-bed suite but went for two interconnecting rooms, with an extra single bed. We made the big mistake of booking through Intercontinental Central Reservations. Although the emailed confirmation I received on booking did not include much detail, the Intercontinental agent assured me that we had the exact accommodation noted on file that we required INCLUDING the extra 5th bed. Days before our Rome holiday, my wife was told by her doctor that she was not allowed to fly, my little boy was not too well and so we decided that I would cancel one of the rooms and retain the room with the extra bed and I would still take my two daughters, meaning there would be three of us. Intercontinental Hotels told me that we had not reserved a room with a 3rd bed (rubbish and totally untrue) and that the rooms were too small for a third bed. If true then they must be VERY small indeed. After a futile discussion, I told them to find me a room or suite with room for an extra bed. They told me they were full and could not accommodate me. I then contacted many other hotels, including Leading Hotels group and they were also all fully booked. Rome was full. I had to cancel my booking as I was not prepared to leave one of my daughters behind.
