Originally, after securing hotel accommodation for the FIVE of us, I had booked and paid for FIVE return flights from London to Rome on British Airways. I lost the cost of all five flights thanks to the central booking service for this hotel. I did not check the hotel out on Tripadviser before booking and I wish I had. I expected the hotel to be good as I’ve been a regular at the Carlton in Cannes for some years (also an Intercontinental). Now that I’ve read about it, it’s possibly a blessing in disguise that they messed up our booking and I lost our BA flights as a result. Complaining to Intercontinental Customer Services was a waste of time. They offered me some hotel points! That is not good enough, I don’t want points, I want the service I should be reasonably able to expect from an Intercontinental Hotel. I used to use Intercontinental Hotels when they were good, in the 1970’s. Now they seem to be owned by Holiday Inn. Certainly their Customer Relations service was rubbish and their escalated “Hi-Guest Relations” department had the cheek to insist that I did not book a room with an extra bed but only accommodation for four people. They are so wrong. I never forget about my third child, I booked five BA flights and this arrogance displayed by their Guest Relations is just appalling. They seem to think that they can do no wrong. We will return to Rome, we will check out hotels on Tripadviser first and will no doubt stay at one of the Leading Hotel group hotels and avoid Intercontinental. My tip for this hotel, don’t trust central reservations at Intercontinental. I booked for five, I paid for five flights and so this is my review of the holiday in Rome that I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: nuvit
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly and unprofessional reception, dirty and not enougly cleaned rooms. Location of the hotel is good for a short vacation but besides that there was nothing proper to say. The price - quality comparison is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “love it , but they need to upgrade their rooms .”
Reviews.Author: gwillmousa
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for a week , the rooms the only thing we didin't like , because they are small and the furniture looks so old . other than that it's great . great location , very friendly staff they'd do anything to help you and a cute breakfast place .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: debs0712
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome on June 4th and went directly to the hotel. We were staying for 3 nights. We were 3 couples traveling together and only our room was ready. We were upgraded to a junior suite and it was 2 rooms and very clean. Our friends had deluxe rooms and asked to have the locations changed and the front desk couldn't have been nicer. Breakfast was included in our room rate and it was lovely especially when we could eat in their beautiful courtyard. All the employees at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The location was excellent and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location - decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hrhweezie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental in June for 1 night after switching from my business hotel outside the city. The rate was quite pricey for me but I did get upgraded base don my Platinum status. The room was tiny. Seriously. I could barely walk around the queen bed. Luckily I didn't have much baggage to get in the way. The bed was super comfortable which is very important to me. Unfortunately my room overlooked the courtyard where the restaurant is and I could hear the music until very late at night. But other than that - I slept perfectly. The bathroom was also very good with nice toiletries and good lighting. The location is key - right above the Spanish Steps so almost everything is within walking distance - attractions, shopping, restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “THIS WAS THE WORST EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: SteveinLaguna12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental De La Ville Roma in May 2011. (Please know that we had just spend a few days at the Intercontinental in Paris and had a wonderful experience) From the moment we walked into the hotel we had a horrible experience. We were informed by the front desk of a problem with our reservation. We produced our reservation confirmation and were told that the hotel had different information. The front desk clerk argued with us for 30 minutes. They did not want to view our records, they only cared about what "their computer showed." Finally we were given our room keys. There were so many problems over three days! The concierge was rude and not helpful. The rooms were small and not very clean. The overall feel of the hotel was not good. I highly recommend finding another hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Usual overrated European hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jullian G
Reviews.Content: There's one great thing about this hotel: location. Situated near the Spanish Steps, it is a short walk from anything in Rome. People were quite helpful and efficient, however for people who's used to staying at Hotels in Asia, do not expect to have anything close. Rooms are slightly damp, musty, and postage-sized. Prices are also crazy in Euro, but at least breakfast is OK. Internet is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful oasis at the top of the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: Camwas
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not enjoy the spaciousness of some other Intercontinentals, but can offer a prime location and an oasis of peace in a busy city. The rooms are comfortably furnished and if you have one on the upper floors you can enjoy grand views over the city to St Peter's and the 'Wedding Cake'. The staff are friendly and helpful. A visit to the rooftop bar is a must - the view across the city at sunset with a cocktail in hand is a treat, as are the free classy nibbles. This is an excellent place to entertain (and impress) friends or colleagues. Come out early in the morning and enjoy the Spanish Steps devoid of the later crowds. It is an easy walk to the Borghese Gardens or along and down to the Piazza del Popolo.

Reviews.Title: “Mamma Mia The price of the Bia”
Reviews.Author: gringottsgoblin
Reviews.Content: Lovely location right at the top the Spanish Steps (downside is having to walk up them). It is a sweet, old hotel which is small in size and is a real old fashioned small city hotel. It is still quite elegant on a tight little Roman street packed with shuttered buildings and Fiats. The rooms are filled with solid brown furniture and flowery fabrics, but they are really well air conditioned and sound proofed so get little street noise. It is a nice little hotel but holy moly if you get a beer expect a wallet shock. Though it must be said they have a very nice roof top bar and this does seduce you into a pocket squeezing beer drinking experience which is just about made worth because of the ambiance..but two beers ..phew...contact your bank manager. In any event you're in Rome ..go find a bar and a place to eat out..sure thats what you there for, so if you want to eat and drink in the hotel what do you expect.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location!”
Reviews.Author: Much2bdun
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the location of this hotel. It was located at the top of the Spanish Steps and a short walk to the Spagna Metro stop. Be prepared to climb the steps to get back to the hotel. The hotel was lovely. The room was smallish and I wasn't wowed by the decor. However, the room was fairly quiet and clean. The staff was absolutely terrific and accomodating. They helped us with everything from dinner reservations to having wrinkled clothing pressed. We were on the fifth floor which almost provided a view over the city. Some street noise up until 11 - 12 at night. If you'd like a quiet room, ask to face away from the street - Via Sistina. All in all a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surpirsed...We had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: LAK1113
Reviews.Content: When booking our hotel for our Honeymoon we were quite concerned about booking this hotel based on the reviews. My husband and I are Ambassador Members of the Intercontinental and stay there alot in the states so we just decided to go ahead and book the hotel for our 3 night stay as the location was great. When arrivinging we were greeted by the door man who was very frinedly! Checkin in was a breeze and front desk was very friendly and English speaking. The hotel common areas were very clean and nicely decorated. When arriving to our room we found it to be better than what we expected. We were located on the 5th floor with a semi view of the Spanish steps. Our room was very large with high ceiling and ample closet space, a very comfortable and large bed and a wonderful and bright bathroom. We were not dissapointed! The concerge was amazing and extreamly friendly greeting us everytime we walked through. I believe his name was William. He helped us out often by giveing us excellent restuarant recommendations as well as arranging a private guide for us one day for the Colosseum and Roman Forum. I dont remeber her name but she was a young girl from the US who was extreamly knowledgeable. One afternoon we had drinks on the roof and it was very nice. I have seen numerous reviews on here where people complain about the cost of things. But in general yes the Intercontinental is expensive when it comes to food etc...and it doesnt matter where you are staying. We payed $100 for breakfast one morning in San Fran and we paid $50 for a pizza when ordering room service here in Rome. But I must say...the $50 pizza was surprisinly good! I always say you pay for what you get specially in the hotel industry. Although my husband (who is Italian decent) and I overall did not like Rome as we felt it was over crowed, dirty and extreamly rude people (surprising for my husband to say as he has thick skin) we would not return to Rome. We spent 3 days and saw what we wanted and find no reason to ever return to Rome. But I would recommend this hotel to anyone as we had a wonderful experience at the hotel and actual was the best part of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, just steps to Spanish Steps, and great service!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTracy33
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research to find the hotel that would suit our needs in Rome, and this hotel was perfect! You can't beat the location. Literally steps from the Spanish Steps, and a very friendly and helpful staff. We were celebrating our anniversary, so we wanted to make sure we had a queen bed, instead of 2 beds, so we emailed them with our request, and they fulfilled our request. The only problem is that we could not get internet in our room, only downstairs, closer to the front desk. Wifi is an additional charge, and not cheap, so it was a little disappointing that we could not get it in our room. We enjoyed the rooftop for a sunset overlooking the city, and moonrise over Via Sistina. Marco was our server and made sure we had everything we needed and more. When one of the heaters wasn't working, they brought out a little blanket for a woman that was feeling chilly. Beautiful evening. The breakfast at 25 Euros was not worth it. Ernesto the doorman was delightful! The concierge helped us book a train ticket, and had it delivered for us. City tips... you can change up to $300.00 per day at the front desk with no service fee, but if you try to change money at most banks in Rome, they will charge you 18.95% or more. We had to pay almost $60.00 to learn this, so I wanted to make sure you know this in advance. Also, we discovered a wonderful restaurant, just at the bottom of the Spanish Steps, and a few short blocks away. It's called "34" A family restaurant that has been in business for 40 years. The owner was 34 when he bought it, and the address is 34 Mario de..... and the rest is up to you to figure out. I took a picture of the street name, but the rest of the name was covered by leaves. Nicola is the son of the owners, and he brought us the best soup we've ever tasted! He took the time to hang out and talk, even though the place was very busy. Delicious food, cozy fun atmosphere and great prices. We loved the Intercontinental! It was our home in Rome! Very comfortable bed! Great views from rooftop (photos are when you look to the side), and from our room as well.

Reviews.Title: “Worst luxury hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: pasadenatraveler32
Reviews.Content: I came here with my mom and sister in May. We were booked for four nights but our experience was so bad that we moved hotels after 2 days (and tried to leave after the first day but were told we would be charged for the 2nd night). The room was $549 euro/night and was a room with three beds, no closets and absolutely no space. Our room didn't come with breakfast which was an additional $75+ euro/day. The service was BAD. The people who worked there (with a few exceptions) were snobby and generally unconcerned with service. The concierge was rude. The front desk didn't have change. The service at breakfast was awful. Internet was $12 euro for 1 hour (which we used to find a new hotel -- ASAP). This was one of the worst hotel experiences I've ever had. Our room was bad, the people were rude, and every extra was incredibly expensive. We moved to a SUITE at the bottom of the Spanish Steps (which is actually a better location) with free breakfast and free internet for $150 euro less/night. So glad we did. I would absolutely NOT recommend this hotel. A lot of people like book it because "Intercontintal" is a familiar brand but you can do MUCH better for MUCH LESS.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT IN EVERY WAY”
Reviews.Author: OhioRunner53
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great! Walking distance to most "attractions." The staff was very accommodating. Everyone spoke english. The hotel was very clean. The rooms were large, especially by European standards, Did I mention that everything was so clean? Air conditioned rooms. And very quiet for sleeping. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: THJ
Reviews.Content: This is not a cheap hotel - that much must be clear by the location. It's at the top of the Spanish Steps and within easy walking distance of some of Rome's major attractions. We stayed here on points and as I'm one of the top levels in the Priority Club Rewards programme they bumped us up to a Junior Suite (basically a bigger room with a sofa in!). We were overlooking the inner courtyard which was fine - just a little noisy when there's a function going on in the courtyard. Room was very comfortable and they gave us complimentary internet. My wife uses a wheelchair - a standard chair doesn't fit into their elevators but they do have a smaller one that you are free to use. Check in and welcome was excellent. Didn't eat at the restaurant or have breakfast there as the prices were a bit steep! Walk down the road a short way and you'll find breakfast for €5! Parking wasn't cheap either and you have to inform them of your car's registration as you are technically in a restricted area for traffic. We forgot and the Rome police didn't seem to mind!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, but that's it.”
Reviews.Author: Dutchguy71
Reviews.Content: We are Platinum members for some years. We are staying approx 3 nights per week in a hotel of IHG. We reserved a room with our points, this was very disappointing. When we made the reservation we asked if we could be upgraded (willing to pay extra), the reply was immediately that they would try to give us an upgrade. Upon checking in the receptionist said immediately that an upgrade is not possible because the hotel is fully booked. Check in took for ever. We spend approx 15 minutes at the counter while all are details are already in the system. We were escorted to our room. The room was very disappointing, the smallest room I ever saw. We could walk next the the bed and that was it. The bathroom was okay. We did not have any view. If you drop your Platinum guests in these kind of rooms, you do not understand the concept of loyal guests! We immediately complaint at the reception. And then we got another room. This room was a normal size room, not spectacular but normal. We had 2 windows with no view. We had a room on the street side. Because of the old building I know that we did not have a view, but still it's a bit disappointing. The bathroom is tiny. We could not be together in the bathroom. If you want to take a shower you have to step into the small bath. The shower curtain comes to you the entire time. The shower itself is not a high quality shower. We also saw molt in the shower. We asked for Internet (WIFI). This is EUR 12 for one hour or EUR 23 for one day. This price is too expensive, however we took the Internet for one day. We did NOT have any internet in the room. Only one point (next to the door) had some Internet access. If you dare to ask EUR 23 for one day for WIFI be sure it works throughout the entire hotel and not only in the public areas. I contacted the reception and they said maintenance would fix it the next day. It was not fixed. So staying in Room 324, do not use Internet! We did not have a turndown service. This is something you expect in an Intercontinental and in a 5-star hotel, but here nobody comes to clean the room in the evening. When we asked for suggestions for restaurants, one of the concierge was rude. He immediately informed us where to eat, without asking what kind of food. We said we wanted to go to a quiet restaurant he said: " on a Saturday night, come on". This is not the service you expect in a 5-star hotel. The other concierge took it over and suggested a great restaurant. The roof bar is a perfect location for a drink. Not cheap, but worth it. Checking out was efficient however there was no bellboy. I asked the receptionist if he could contact a taxi. He said he would do it, but he never did. We had to walk out of the hotel with our luggage to the taxi place next to the Spanish stairs because the staff does not look after its customers. I do not like this hotel at all. The best was the location, the worst the service and Internet. Next time I will go to a real 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but beware Taxis outside”
Reviews.Author: AJSGILLAM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The rooms can be hit and miss. They are a little small but this is central Rome. Some are close to the road, others have nice terraces and even the suites can be a little tired decoratively and dark. The options for dining in the hotel including breakfast are very pricey but again it is a hotel in central Rome. There are some good restaurant options nearby including a very passable chinese should you tire of Itlaian food and their constant attempts to rip you off. That said AVOID at all costs the Ristorante La Tavernetta" as they will attempt to charge you a "cover charge" a "10% Service Charge" AND a "Tip" ! The rooftop bar is great to get a glimpse of the rooftops of Rome. AVOID like the plague the Taxis outside in the piazza above the Spanish Steps. Indeed should you be wanting a Taxi and the hotel offer to get one for you insist thatb they get one from elsewhere as this group will conive to rip you off charging twice the rate they should.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views with old world charm”
Reviews.Author: eelizabeths
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days in May 2011 to celebrate my 40th birthday. What a perfect time to enjoy Rome - sunny, high 70's during the day, and cool breezes at night. We walked everywhere, never took a cab, and a few times, caught the Metro to as many of the sites as we could fit in. Walking is truly the best method of seeing the city - hands down. Upon check in, we were greeted with a round of "Buon Giornos!", told we were given an upgrade from a balcony room to a terrace room, and when we asked for glasses and ice, received prompt service. I can't complain about the service at all. The front desk was always friendly and helpful. Despite the age of the hotel, the room was clean and the bathroom was always well stocked with supplies/towels. The terrace was key after a long day of walking all over the city, allowing us to unwind with a glass of excellent wine while we downloaded our pictures to our laptop and review our day. In the evenings, we discussed where to have dinner among the MANY wonderful and little restaurants around the city. There were lots of great little places in the side streets just off the Piazza di Spagna, where the Spanish Steps are located, just below the hotel. Wander around a little bit and you'll be sure to find a place that will make you happy. The Spanish Steps are lively in the evenings - EVERY evening - but one comment about that location: the hotel is at the top of the steps. After a long day of walking all over historic Rome, the last thing you want to do is climb those infernal steps. If you can't do steps very well, this hotel may not be the best place for you. You can also get to the hotel by walking up the street from the other side but that's uphill as well. We decided that next time we visit Rome, we'll choose a spot near Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. That's a great area - and it's level! In sum, the hotel was very nice. It was clean, had friendly service, and the 6th floor terrace bar had beautiful views. The drinks were expensive as was the room but we chalk that up to the norm inasmuch as the Intercontinental competes with the reknown Hassler, which is right next door. The location is perfect for a bird's eye view but not so perfect after a long day. Our experience at the hotel was interwoven with our over all experience in the Eternal City. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but high fees for internet”
Reviews.Author: kiwigalabroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and found everything to be ok except for the incredibly high internet charges which turned out to be an enormous inconvenience €23 for a day €12 for an hour. In contrast two nearby internet cafes charged €1.50 p/hr, and the other equally rated hotels we've stayed at on our trip in Paris + Ireland have both provided free internet access with the room. However, it's location at the top of the Spanish Steps is fabulous and a great base for sight seeing. Be sure to take the 'Spagna' exit from the station and find the elevator just to the left of the exit which will take you and your luggage to the top of the steps. We were fortunate to have a busy sightseeing schedule where we needed to be up early, but the rooms are not conducive to sleeping in as the walls are thin. This is probably just due to it being a character building though and it is very charming. The rooms were elegantly decorated and the bed very comfortable. We also had a balcony which was nice in the morning sun and a bathroom with full size bath and shower.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: kevintiobraid
Reviews.Content: I find some of the complaints in the reviews below ridiculous..... not enough English tv channels....there is a building opposite the hotel and people can potentially see in.. Anyway, the hotel was excellent. We stayed in room 505 which was facing the street, with limited views of the Rome skyline. Room was average sized and comfortable. Service was good. Anything below 5th floor, you will have no view. Didn't have breakfast or dinner so no comments here. Location superb. Rooftop bar excellent. Yes, most extras in the hotel are a rip off (e.g. €5 for 15mins internet access, €10 for 0.4l beer), but are on a par with prices in other Rome hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience - Not Worth ?”
Reviews.Author: iimz
Reviews.Content: I found Intercontinental De La Ville a very diappointing property. Its a typical 3 Star property with a 5 Star Name. Location is good however the ambience around the Hotel is not that appealing. Maintainence is poor and make sure to flex your muscles before booking this place because on most occassion you will not find concierge services. Restaurant is awful especially for people comming from East or those who prefers Arabic / Asian food. Hotel lack privacy. The neighbourhood around the Hotel have a clean view into the intercontinental rooms Overall i would never want to return back to this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Missed wake-up call which caused missed meetings.”
Reviews.Author: AlexMarklund
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is a real ripoff. NO services what so Evert included, not even as a Priority club Platinum member! Bottle of water was 9 euro, coca cola smallest ever seen 9 euro. INTERNET which one expect to be included in a hotel that flamma to be five star was 23 euro! But worst of all, the last might we called for a wake-up call at 7:20. NO wake-up call was made and we oversleept with missed meetings and a bad start of the day. The frontdesk confirmed, after a while that the hotel did recieved over quest and that they forgot. The only thing they did was to give a lame excuse and a promise that the supervisor syltor take care of this and come back with some kind of "compensation" as soon as she arrived the very same day. Since then we have heats NOTHING! This is unacceptable for a five star hotel! They caused us a LOT of problem and did not give a damm about it, shamefully bad!

Reviews.Title: “great location, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: vivek_s
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 5 days. the location is just great, right above the spanish steps which is a beautiful spot and popular destination for tourists and locals. trevi fountain and galleria borghese are withing walking distance of the hotel. public transport (metro) is also available nearby and a great cafe/restaraunt called campiani is just around the corner. the rooms are well furnished but a bit small. bathrooms are well equipped. what is lacking is lack of tea/coffee making facilities in room and adequate english channels on tv. cant watch bbc and cnn all the time. concierge desk was ok for infoirmation, not exceptional as experienced by me in other intercontinental hotels in europe. extras like breakfast (39 euros per person) and food and drink very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “5 star prices for a two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: londoner71
Reviews.Content: Small smelly rooms, was woken up every morning by the building work being done to the terrace. Room didn't even have tea/ coffee making facilities or an iron. Our room key was deactivated twice so after a long day sightseeing we had to keep going to see the unfriendly reception staff who didn't even apologise. Internet access is 23 euros for 24 hours and a bottle of water from the minibar was 9 euros. I don't mind paying for quality but this place was a ripoff. Hotel is in a great location but that's about it. This hotel does not deserve its 5 star rating, I've had better service at Holiday Inns (who give you free internet!)

Reviews.Title: “A solid 3 star hotel at best.”
Reviews.Author: KitsGQ
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively and this hotel is sub par in so many respects. To start, the rooms are extremely tired and in need of a renovation. Very small rooms but not atypical for Europe, however small for 5 star standards. Service is non existent at the front desk. Location is fantastic, and so is the rooftop patio and bar. The highlight of this substandard visit was the waiter at the bar who delivered drinks with a smile and exceptional service. Overall, unless you're on a budget and get this hotel on the cheap I would look elsewhere. There are too many good hotels in Rome so do yourself a favor and keep on looking!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Mary_Pap
Reviews.Content: An excellent romantic getaway ideally located in the heart of Rome. Walking distance from the Piatsa di Spania. The room's were very quaint, clean and very cozy. We had a small balcony overlooking the inside courtyard/garden which was quite a delight to wake up to in the morning. The service needed some work. We had to ask a couple of times to get what we asked for. In all a very romantic and charming hotel which I would definatelly choose for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: obriens19
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room on the sixth floor overlooking the courtyard. The double-door windows were wonderful, allowing us fresh air and great view of Borghese Gardens. The staff seemed genuinely happy to see us. They were cheerful and enthusiastic. The concierge service could not have been better. The breakfast option is a must. We loved almost everything about this hotel. I would, however, not recommend eating dinner at the restaurant. Even though the breakfast was terrific, the food at dinner at the hotel was without a doubt the worst food we ate in Rome. I do not understand why this is, but there are lots of other places to eat in Rome, so it shouldn't be an issue when you stay there. One thing we particularly enjoyed was having a drink at apperitivi time in the lobby lounge.

Reviews.Title: “ROMAN HOLIDAY-4**** WAY!”
Reviews.Author: chicchick707
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is given 5 stars I would have to debate that. The hotel is in an excellent location - next to the Spanish Steps but the interior of the hotel is a bit tired and the lobby and rooms are a bit weary! Our room was a delux with a nice big king size bed but the first evening we discovered there was a leak near the bidet and could not use the bathroom at all so since it was the evening and a plumber was not availalbe we were given the key to a tiny room quite a distance from our room where we could use the bathroom. Not the best solution to wake up in the night and take a walk down the hall. The next morning we were moved to a suite which was very large with a bath and a half and a living room area but unfortunately a very small queen size bed. The breakfast was average at best , maybe even a little disappointing for a 5* hotel. The rates are reasonable but I really believe you can find a much better accommodation in Rome for the price. I doubt I would recommend this hotel to a friend or return. Rome is such a magnificient city too bad our hotel did not meet our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: ParkBrook
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the review we were a little worried. We found the hotel to be very good. The location was so good We either walked or used the metro to travel everywhere Our room was booked as the lowest level and the size was OK. Bathroom was nice and had all the toiletries that my wife likes - that was a bonus. The only meals we had at the hotel was breakfast - the cost was what you'd expect if you stay in this level of hotel - the service was good and so was the food. We had drinks in the lounge - the guy serving drinks was very friendly without being too much. We ended up eating out whilst exploring the city. Overall we'd stay again

Reviews.Title: “rabbit hole....”
Reviews.Author: LIK0S
Reviews.Content: I am really a huge fan of intercontinental hotels but this one was a dissapointment.Our room was so tiny that we fell on each other.We even could not open our laggage properly.The bed was small for double bed and old.Generally the hotel needs to be renovated asap.If you are interested in staying in a hotel which is on a good location in Rome stay in this rabbit hole because it is by the spanish steps.Everything else is poor.

Reviews.Title: “Billing NIGHTMARE, Stay Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wirelesswestporter
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms in February 2010 for our stay in September 2010. I booked through a travel agent and paid in advance. I called Intercontinental in March to confirm that the reservation/payment was made and it was pre-paid and they confirmed it was and gave me my booking numbers. 2 weeks prior to our trip I contacted all the hotels that we were staying at in Rome, Venice and Florence and again confirmed our reservations, payments, etc. I also printed copies of all confirms and bought them with me. When we checked out of the de la ville, the last hotel of our stay, I asked for a copy of our reciept reflecting the zero balance but was told the copier was broken, the printer wasn't working and they couldn't email me a reciept. This of course was of great concern but I was assured there were no charges and as it was 6am and our ride to the airport had already been waiting 20 minutes I couldn't pursue the matter. Unfortunately my October credit card statement reflected the full 3 rooms/2 night stay from the de la ville. I contacted customer service at Intercontinental and was told it was a billing error on the part of de la ville, but it was a separate, independant hotel from Intercontinental and therefore they didn't have access to the hotel's billing so the hotel would have to provide the credit. I received an incident number and was told I would have a resolution within 30 days. The charge was dropped and then put back on my January statement. I immediately called customer service again at Intercontinental and was told again, that the rooms were prepaid and the charges should have credited and they said the hotel never contacted them either even after several attempts by Intercontinental. They called the de la ville while I was on hold and told me that the hotel would look into it. I finally just heard back from the hotel after 3 more emails to them with no response. They said the charges stay as they weren't paid by the travel agency (from a year ago). I requested a copy of my reciept with my signature authorizing this and asked why suddenly after a year of being told everhting was paid for and all set they are now stating differently. I'm still waiting a response. So bottomline, if you want to have your wonderful Italian vacation ruined by being double charged and spending endless hours fighting this upon your return, then this is the hotel for you. To add insult to injury, our rooms were in a wing that was under construction so we had carts both and forth overhead and banging all hours of day and night and our "view" was a dirty exhaust fan and dirty window into the garage. The 3 other hotels we stayed at, including the Hotel Grand Minerve, were wonderful and there were NO billing issues or follow up needed.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, everything was PERFECT at the InterContinental de la Ville”
Reviews.Author: Cleopatra561
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many, many times at this wonderful hotel. On this trip, I was all alone, and the staff took such good care of me!!! From the moment of arrival, everything was just perfect. The front desk staff, the concierge staff, the dining staff, the housekeeping staff all receive highest stars from me. Mr. Giacomo Pica, duty manager, is always mindful of past guests, and sees to every minute detail to make our stays the very best. The new cafe in the lobby is exquisite and the food was fantastic. The new internet room is also a bonus, as well as being able to access it in my beautiful room. Thank you to all the staff for making my trip to Rome another memorable experience. I will be back in May!!! and ONLY at the InterContinental de la Ville!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel has its pro's and con's.”
Reviews.Author: theredmango
Reviews.Content: Forany of you who are plannin a summer vacation to Rome, cancel it. It is so remarkably hot and humid during the summer that even the locals flee. But during the winter Rome is one of my favorite places to go in the world. I would recomend staying at the the Itercontinental because it has better service than any other hotel in Rome. It has a beautiful dining area outside and the food is outstanding. The Itercontinental Hotel lacks a pool and it is a very old building therefore the rooms are not the nicest rooms yet the staff does a wonderful job of keeping everything clean. My favorite part of the Intercontinental hotel is the balcony. On this balcony u can see all of Rome and it is trully spectacular and breathtaking. While you soak in the outstanding view the staff will kindly help you too any drink/ cocktail you would like. If you are planning a trip to Rome i highpy recomend the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jabei
Reviews.Content: I had some trepidation based on the other reviews here but I can say that I found the staff to be incredibly nice and helpful. I was using Priority Club points so I didn't actually have to part with any cash, therefore I can't really comment on the value aspect. The location is out of this world and the rooftop bar gives a great view. The room was relatively dated but perfectly adequate and clean. I was there for New Years' Eve and all in all had a magical time in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Magical, historical charm, proper sense of luxury in a super location”
Reviews.Author: 01Guy
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, truly historical, with a most convenient location, right next to the Spanish steps and great for shopping in the small boutiques down the side streets away from the rip-off stores down the Spanish steps. I stayed in a suite, which was effectively a sub-penthouse apartment with a large terrace that provided views over Rome and the Spanish steps. The room itself was very large, very luxurious and tastefully decorated with chic materials and fittings that were most suited to the period of the building. The service was good, staff are polite and speak multiple languages in many cases, although you need to be clear about prices as they are often quoted without VAT! Many criminals, fraudsters and scammers exist in Rome on a mass scale so beware! Rome is entirely different to the rest of Italy, where people are completely the opposite... However, if you fancy a bit of true luxury, you want to be centrally located, and you are looking for a nice getaway from the insanity of Rome, I would highly recommend this excellent 5* hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but over priced”
Reviews.Author: Tamreez
Reviews.Content: The stay was great and being an Ambassador of ICG hotels, I was given a better room (upon my request). However, the charges were too much as compared to other Intercontinental hotels providing variety of amnesties. But I think all the hotels in most of Europe are like that. Small and over priced. I have better options when I go to Rome next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but hugely overpriced. Zero atmosphere and they charge for everything. Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: RobStone_UK
Reviews.Content: We used our Priority Club points to book a 4 night stay over the New Year. We're also IC Ambassadors and expected much better treatment, especially in terms of the room we were initially allocated. Can anyone tell me whether this always happens when you redeem your Priority Club points? We complained and on the 2nd day were grudgingly given only a marginally better room as, allegedly, the hotel was booked out. We didn't see a whole load of guests to bear this out, but how do you argue the point? Both rooms we had were small and had little storage, albeit they were quiet and adequately furnished. Twin beds pushed together to form a King wasn't ideal. No tea/coffee facilities and only a very limited number of TV channels in English were a nuisance for a 5 day stay. The hotel charges extra for everything - I'm surprised it doesn't include the elevator! Not only that, but prices are ridiculous - a small glass of wine and a cocktail were €30! Presumably priced to retain a certain class of clientele, I think it backfires as there were only a few guests in the lounge area and absolutely no-one in the bar upstairs. The result is zero atmosphere. The New Years Eve menu was priced at €330 excluding any drinks and service charges, so we skipped that too, largely because we thought the atmosphere would be non-existent (we were constantly asked to book). On checking out, our bill incorrectly included charges from the mini-bar and the receptionist displayed the same lack of customer service as the one checking us in 5 days previously. At least the bill was amended. We requested a 4 p.m. check-out to suit our flight home as part of the Ambassador privilege and went out for the day only to find on our return at 3 p.m. that the keys had already been cancelled! We rang reception from a house-phone only to be told to go to reception where the key would be re-activated - no apology - shouldn't they have come up to let us in? For all the above reasons, we won't go back to this hotel, despite it's great location at the top of the Spanish Steps, and really can't recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe anybody would complain about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RonFMiller
Reviews.Content: I was debating on which of two hotels to stay in at Rome for Christmas. Both were 5 stars, similarly priced and approximately in the same area. Based on the reviews here, I chose the other hotel. My first day in Rome, I went to the De La Ville to see what I was missing and realized I had made a mistake in not being there. Fortunately, I could check out of the other hotel after one night and check in here for the next four nights. From the moment you walk into the place, you feel like you are in old world Italian elegance. (I cannot believe some of the comments here about the lobby - yes, it's not the Danieli in Venice, but it is still beautiful.) I was in a standard room and still everything about this hotel was great from the Frette sheets, the size of the rooms and bathrooms (luscious tub surrounded by marble), the view, and the location. It was beautifully decorated for Christmas. I always "eat well" when in Italy and was hesitant to eat at the hotel, but little was open Christmas evening, so I ate there. Everything about the meal was wonderful including the quality of food and wine, service, and ambiance. At about $100 for a full course meal including wine, it was also a relative bargain. The staff was friendly and helpful and the concierge service even provided high quality umbrellas for the days it was raining. I've stayed in a number of hotels in Rome over the the years and I must say that this one has by far the best location to be at if you are a tourist. If I had to wrack my brain for a negative, the only thing I can think of was the restaurant which was recommended for Christmas Eve dinner. It was the only restaurant I went to in Rome where the tables were too close together, almost all the patrons were English speaking tourists, it was overpriced, plus they charged a cover charge and a service charge. (However, the food was good.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice but stuffy”
Reviews.Author: TrevisoMA
Reviews.Content: Amazing location. Everything was an extra. A bit too formal for us as it was not all that. Very overpriced food at hotel, cold staff and okay rooms. We had a balcony which was nice..... Cannot beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bnadon
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst IC hotel I have every stayed at during all my years of travel. The staff must work on commission because from the moment I arrived all they did was try to up sell my stay. As a RA member I stay on average about 100 nights in IC and Holiday Inn hotels around the world. This hotel has now made the bottom of my list. To start, the rooms are old, the staff is unfriendly, everything has an up charge, no club lounge, better locations in Rome for the price and did I mention the staff!!! Please do me a favour and read all of the reviews and I think you will find this hotel isn't the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights during the first week of December 2010. We prepaid by bidding on Priceline and received a spacious, quiet room overlooking the courtyard: flowers on the balcony, comfortable king sized bed with soft fluffy pillows, huge bathtub with endless HOT water. Everything else costs extra and everything is obscenely priced. Who would pay 25 Euros for coffee and a roll? We checked out not owing a cent. When we checked in, we did not receive a room key-card because their machine was not working, so the porter let us into our room. When we returned to our room on our second day, still no key. On the third day: “But madame, your key was ready yesterday and you did not pick it up.” Sorry, I don’t read minds. On the fourth day, I had to take the key back because it no longer worked. Again, it was my fault according to the Reception. The Reception staff was most unwelcoming. The Concierge was very helpful though. Excellent housekeeping service. Nice location at the top of the Spanish Steps. There are lots of places to eat and drink within a short walk. There is an elevator in the Spagna Metro station, but don’t count on it being available and you still have to negotiate a short flight of steps at the top.

Reviews.Title: “No way to treat a return guest”
Reviews.Author: roxanne99
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Hotel de La Ville based on a wonderful stay there 6 years ago. The location is great & the staff is very attentive, but on our return stay in Sept. 2010 we were really disappointed. Sadly the hotel has become run down & much in need of renovation. The rug in our room was worn out & bucked in several places & we kept tripping over it… I noticed it was like this in the hallways too & I saw a maid trip over the rug in the hallway. We requested a king bed & what we got was 2 twins pushed together with a really skimpy mattress pad on top of it. The mattresses were old & uncomfortable. The bathroom had black dirt in the corners of the floor & the enamel of the bathtub was completely worn off & there was black mold on the shower curtain. Not what I would expect from an IC Hotel. Noise from the 35 euro buffet breakfast started very early every morning & music from the piano bar was audible in our room every night. The only internet in the room had to be run through the TV so we couldn’t upload pictures from our camera or check e-mail from our laptop, & the charge for internet was ridiculous. I wondered if they gave us a crummy room because we were using priority club points, but we also had to pay extra to stay here. Attempts to resolve this with the hotel were unsatisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Location rooms enivronment”
Reviews.Author: Michaela55
Reviews.Content: Excellent location \ top room top class breakfast what do you need more in rome it is a shame that in the 21 century you need to pay for the internet

Reviews.Title: “Turned out okay”
Reviews.Author: zingmaster
Reviews.Content: Checked in late on a Saturday night with lots of luggage. Had booked through Priceline and was given the smallest room I've ever seen. A closet about 18" wide and no drawers to put away clothes. The dresser actually had the drawers removed with a mini bar in it's place. We had to stack the luggage on top on the chair and desk and still couldn't move around the room. The bathroom was very nice but had a step up to get into it. A little unsafe to manouver during the night. The bathroom was probably half the size of the room. We were staying 4 nights and I knew we couldn't survive 3 more nights in this room. Spoke to the front desk Sunday morning and calmly explained our predicament. After a few minutes we were moved to a room next to the fitness room which was at least twice the size of the previous room. A large closet and drawers and a bathroom without a step. This turned what could have been a horrible experience into a good one. Didn't notice any noise from the fitness room so that was nice. As others note, the hotel is in a great area and we walked all throughout Rome without taking taxis or public transportation. The hotel services are very expensive. Breakfast buffet was 35euro/person and internet 30euro/day. Staff was very friendly and the concierge helpful. Overall, it was a good experience but I don't know if I'd take a chance on booking through Priceline again and getting stuck with that tiny room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on top of Spanish Steps!”
Reviews.Author: EricBeirut
Reviews.Content: Was in Rome with my wife on 17-11-2010 for 4 days to celebrate our 10 years wedding anniversary, and stayed in this hotel on our Priority Club points. Loved the location, on top of the Spanish Steps, where you get within minutes walking to all the great shops you can dream of for your medium to up scale shopping. The reception staff is top class (except when you get the trainees), and the concierge service very helpfull. All premises are very clean, although a bit old, which is especially seen in the bathroom (although it is still very decent). Some rooms are also very small so be carefull to ask for a larger room if possible. Buffet Breakfast looks gorgeous, although expensive (35 EUR). Didn't try the food though. All in all a very good experience I would repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Being in Rome I always stay here!”
Reviews.Author: WinnerMoscow_Russia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Rome several times a year and each time we stay in InterContinental De La Ville on Via Sistina. We’ve made this choice long ago because of the location – the loveliest Spanish steps are very close to the hotel, literally less than 50 steps away. Being in such a location is very good for shopping as major shopping streets are coming to Spanish steps, and also this central location is a great start to explore great Rome again and again. This particular time we had a room on the 7th floor with a great terrace overlooking Rome – it was a most fantastic room I could only imagine. The room itself was quite a small one, but this is an ordinary situation for Rome and we never complain about that. The staff at the hotel is helpful by all means. I also would like to say special thanks to Francesco at Front Desk – he did his best to make our trip the most memorable. Hope we return soon as the service was absolutely fantastic and professional! This time I’ve also decided to write a review as I slept so well on a perfect bed with perfect pillows! I paid special attention to this fact as Rome was the final destination in our 8 days trip to Italy this time and we were coming from a lovely spa hotel in Toscana where I could hardly sleep because of pillows I’ve found uncomfortable. And in Intercontinental I was sleeping like a baby and did not even want to leave bed in the morning! I recommend this hotel to all travelers interested in great location and hotel with great and friendly staff. Hope to return to Rome soon and back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Priceline gem.”
Reviews.Author: CanadiaK
Reviews.Content: We Pricelined this sucker, and it was great for the price we got (about half the advertised rate for a king bed + bath). The room was average, and very comfortable. They make a big deal out of their decor, but I didn't find it particularly terrific. The concierge and doormen were very attentive, as was the bartender at the rooftop patio, where we treated ourselves to some Moet one night (pricy, but you can't beat the view up there). The menu prices were laughable: we calculated it could cost as much as 35$ Canadian EACH to buy some eggs and bacon for breakfast, but why would you want that when you're a 15 minute walk to Tazzo d'Oro? As far as location goes it can't be beat. It's close to everything. We didn't get on the subway once in Rome, preferring instead to walk the city. If you can get a deal on the price of the room, go for it. I would not pay full freight to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Save yourself! Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: jslice34
Reviews.Content: This is the least comfortable place I've ever stayed and I'm a college student, so I've stayed at some sketchy places. I literally had to check and make sure that we actually had a matress and weren't sleeping on box springs. I requested a mattress pad which I never recieved. I've never had so many sleepless nights. Seriously, stay somewhere else so you're not tired while visiting Rome. The location is awesome, but it's so far from being worth it. I read all the other reviews and thought that people must be picky or something because I've never been at a bad IC hotel. But there is and it's in Rome. Whatever you do, don't book it! Read some more reviews and listen to them. They all same the same thing! I should have listened to them.

Reviews.Title: “If it weren't for the great location, nobody would ever stay here!”
Reviews.Author: WishICouldTravelNow
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal InterContinental customer but, unfortunately, this is the single worst InterCon I have ever stayed at. The location is fabulous but the rooms, restaurant and service were average at best. The lobby area is cute, the rooms are adequate, if a bit tired, and the hotel itself could be classified as quaint, but the restaurant and bar are severely overpriced. We stayed at this hotel specifically because we had a voucher for a free night (thanks to my InterContinental Ambassador membership), but upon checkout, the hotel wouldn't honour it (even though it was mentioned upon booking). Unfortunately, this hotel does not offer good value when you compare it to other hotels in Rome (and in the same vicinity). if you have your heart set on staying literally at the top of the Spanish Steps, then overpay to stay here; if you don't mind staying in some of the other great parts of Rome (or 250 steps from the Steps instead of 10), stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bordeauxbound
Reviews.Content: This is an impressive hotel. My wife and I just stayed there and loved it. The location, as noted, is right at the top of the Spanish Steps, so it's a short walk to a lot of local sites. The rooms are 5 star quality. Nice size for European rooms, and everything is clean, polished, and first class. The staff is extremely helpful in recommending restaurants (every one was a hit), and helpful with general info. We stayed on the fourth floor and certain rooms have their own private deck, so ask for it if you can (and it's worth an extra couple of dollars). The roof deck is amazing. Great view (but kill the crane), and the team that works there is entertaining and attentive. I didn't see a table that waited for a drink, and the staff was great at starting conversations when they could and giving you helpful tips, and cracking jokes. Clearly, the people working on the terrace enjoy their work, and it shows. Worth it to be an Ambassador for Intercontinental hotels as the upgrade for one night pays for itself. Lobby can make you think it's too formal, but we had a blast. The area near the Spanish steps is upscale Rome, so you probably want to walk to grab a cheaper meal

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up to IC de Ville”
Reviews.Author: Grhill5
Reviews.Content: Wife and I are staying here now. Very nice property and good location at the top of the Spanish steps. We booked through Amex and bad the option to add breakfast on for $6 per day. That is a steal for the large buffet and fresh made cappuccinos. Take that option if you have it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Rude”
Reviews.Author: 49joneslake
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here in September for 3 nights while on vacation and were given the cold shoulder. Front desk staff greated us with a smile and as soon as he knew we were a gay couple, gave us the cold shoulder and the rest of the staff did so as well for the whole 3 days we were there. Rooms are clean and the hotel is very well situated in the city. Would never go there again that is for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “UNFRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: DebbiePlantation
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location by the Spanish Steps and is quiet. We are members of the Ambassador through Intercontinenal Hotels. We had a free weekend voucher, which they would not let us use and the staff (other than the young man at the front desk) were rude and unhelpful. The air conditioner in our room was not working and it was hot in Rome during our stay. The young woman at the front desk merely shrugged her shoulders and said "oh well". Finally another woman helped us and they sent a very nice man who attempted to fix the air. They gave us two fans for our room. However for the price we paid for our room, this was unacceptable. It is a nice hotel, clean with a good location, however, the uncooperative staff makes a stay here unpleasant and because of that, I would not recommend this hotel nor would I stay there again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but regarding only some rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sibvaleo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel three times because we had some free nights on our PriorityClub account. Each time we paid for 2 nights in Junior Suite and took one night for free in a Standard room. 2 times the hotel management upgraded our free night to Junior Suite and so all three nights each time we stayed in JS. Both rooms 641 and 839 were great to stay in Rome, mainly because of their georgeous terraces. It's one of our best experiences in Rome. On the third time they had no opportunity to upgrade our free night and so we stayed one day ina Standard room before moving to our favorite room 641. Standard room is too tiny and I would never stay in such a room. Another problem is that many of these tiny Standards overlook Via Sistina - one of the busiest and noisiest streets in Rome. I guess I could never sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to like the Hotel , but left with very mixed views”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like the Hotel Intercontinental De La Ville in Rome, but left with very mixed views. Not sure I would hurry back. Though I suspect that many tourists, especially those from outside of Europe would find it charming, historical and reeking if old European charm. For me, it was more an expensive, slightly dated and old-fashioned place. Positives · The staff are friendly and welcoming. This is true across all areas. · The location is great. It is right near the top of the famous Rome landmark of the Spanish Steps. It is great to stand there in the evening and watch people gather and enjoy themselves. There are great shops and lots of restaurants close by. · The rooms are large, and as the building is old has high ceilings. Although very traditional styling, which not to my taste, would be generally well liked. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The negatives · Costly! Everything costs a lot. The mini-bar charges are outrageous, the food is costly (breakfast is 35 Euros!), and even spaghetti and tomato sauce is over 20 Euros. · Noise. I was kept awake by booming band, it was clear that the hotel know about this, and seems to come from a disco and park nearby, so they have limited control over it. Also the sound from the outdoor restaurant (music and talking) gets loud. · Power cuts. This may be more a quirk of when I was staying, but in our meeting room we had regular power cuts which meant resetting up the projector etc Overall a mixed experience. it is worth looking at the video I took of my room, as some people I have shown it say “wow” what a great room. So clearly a hotel that gets a mixed reaction. But no-one can argue that it is expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cranky staff!”
Reviews.Author: LovesFirstClass
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Intercontinental in Rome! Check in was efficient and for the most part the staff is "professional", but cranky. Our plan included early check in, a room upgrade, room amenities, breakfast buffet, and late check out. When we arrived, our room was not ready but wenwere offered a temporary room to relax in or two drinks at the bar. I thought either were good options. We were told the hotel was at full occupancy so an upgrade was not possible. I booked an executive room with a balcony overlooking Rome at a rate of 421 euros per night. The room was on the sixth floor and it had a decent view with some obstruction. The room and bathroom was very small. My husband and I had to squeeze by each other as we passed the bed and could not be in the bathroom together at the same time. I did see on the room plan pictured on the back of the door that this was the smaller room in the executive category. I did call to change but once again I was told the hotel was booked and nothing could be done. The hotel is in a good location. We were able to walk to may attractions or take a taxi to the Vatican or colosseum area. It is on top of the Spanish steps so you do have to be in decent shape to walk up the steps every day or take a route a little out of the way to avoid the steps. We thought it was good exercise and usually opted to burn off all the pasta and gelato. The staff at the hotel is professional, but some of the concierge and front desk people basically cranky and unfriendly. The door men are nice but some do not speak English well. I thought this was odd for an international hotel. The breakfast buffet was good and had a nice variety, but some of the hot items were always cold. The service in the restaurant was very good. When in return to Rome I will not return to the intercontinental. I like warm and friendly people. I'm sure I can find another hotel that will provide the same amenities with friendlier service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: blondeylocks
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two day stay at this hotel. I found the hotel to be quite pokey and dated. The bedrooms are small with poor sound insulation. The staff could have been a lot friendlier and the concierge certainly did not impress me when he recommended a restaurant that ended up costing €233 (for 2 people) after I asking for something casual and informal! Certainly would not return there.

Reviews.Title: “You are in the midst of it all”
Reviews.Author: Shakers_7
Reviews.Content: My family and I moved to the Intercontinental after checking out from another nearby hotel and we were not disappointed at all. The room we got was nicely furnished, clean and spacious. The hotel itself is quite elegant with lots of nicely decorated and beautifully furnished spots for you to simply sit and relax, read or enjoy the sights of this wonderful and extremely charming city. One of the best such spots is the roof that gives you a panoramic view of Rome while you sit and sip your drink, nibble on the nuts, chips or cookies they serve you while listening to the soothing music in the background. The hotel is located right in the middle of all the action is and extremely close to all the sites be it the Spanish Steps, the Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Villa Borghese (with the exception of th Vatican, as well as all the hot shopping areas. It makes it very easy to move around and it is a great feeling when you step into the hotel just to catch your breath after a long walk or between tours or to unload the numerous bags you amassed at this very tempting city for shopping. The hotel staff were very gracious in arranging for us a special tour, with a dedicated guide, for a lovely visit to the Vatican. The hotel serves an ENORMOUS and DELICIOUS breakfast that can keep you going easily until dinner. In Italy, and particularly Rome, you do not come across such sumptous breakfasts often. I have to note here that the service of the staff at the bar on the roof as well as at the breakfast was exceptional. To give but an example, my mother is quite elderly and has some difficulty walking and going up and down steps and noticing that, the head waiter (quite a sweet man) noticed that and insisted on taking her by the hand to the buffet, assisting her while she filled her plate, and back to the table. When she wanted to go wash her hands, he accompanied her and kept a watchful eye on the ladies' room door to make sure that he is there to escort her back. A lovely person. When we go back to Rome - one of our most favorite cities ever - we will certainly return to the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Peace in the hectic city of Rome”
Reviews.Author: LondonJo2204
Reviews.Content: Anybody who has done city breaks knows how unusual it is to come across a city hotel with a central location and huge rooms. The standard rooms at the InterContinental are small, as you'd expect. We are InterContinental gold card holders but were told that the hotel couldn't upgrade us as they were fully booked. As it turned out our room was very comfortable and VERY quiet. Space was tight (you can't get two people in the bathroom at the same time), but the bed was incredibly comfortable. All furniture, bedding etc is of a high standard and bathroom was clean and the shower, powerful. We did a breakfast package which was worthwhile. Continental breakfast was good. Hot food, loads of meat and cheeses, fruit and pastries and champers. Served till 10.30 which ensured we could sleep in. The internal courtyard of the hotel is really pretty. It's great to be able to sit outside and have breakfast (shame about the pigeons though)! Roof-top bar had a nice relaxing feel and was never super busy (at 11pm anyways) and the staff were super friendly and helpful. The location is the best - close the the Spanish steps, shops, bars and countless restaurants without being in a tacky part of town. The steps can be a killer after a long day walking around sight-seeing though! Staff were great on check-out. We moved on to Spain midway through our trip and our flight was late in the evening. Front desk let us use an empty single room to shower and change which made all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Neil H
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms each for 2 nights using Priority Club points. Checked in early at 11.30am for one room and waited till 5.30pm for the other (upgraded) room, but well worth the wait - room had a panoramic city view including St Peters. Check out allowed at 4pm for both rooms, so no complaints with the front desk - they even allowed 15 minute free use of the computer to check in for our flights. The concierge desk was extremely helpful with suggesting restaurants - Ciampini and Life were both outstanding. Ernesto the doorman went overboard with assisting us with taxis, ensuring that the driver knew where we wanted to go. This hotel oozes old world charm - it is a very old building, not a new purpose built hotel with a bling lobby and you should expect some quirkiness. Be prepared for the cost of everything here, Rome is a VERY expensive city, from the minibar a Coke will cost 8.50 (euros), a Mars bar 7.50, room service will set you back 12.00 for a half grapefruit or 22.00 for a bowl of soup and if you have a drink on the terrace - then they are 19.00 each. All of which are available for a fraction of the cost if you can be bothered to walk a few minutes from the hotel. The only gripe is that this is a chain hotel, so why cant Intercontinental have the amenities in rooms the same at each location for example, there is no in room coffee maker or IPod dock - as there has been in every other Ic I have stayed in. None of which however is enough to deduct a star. All in all an excellent (if expensive) hotel in an excellent central location, we had an excellent long weekend, made partly by the very helpful staff. An excellent tip - pre-book the Sistine Chapel online and avoid a 4 hour line to get in.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great service - worth the extra expense”
Reviews.Author: Piripi_NZ
Reviews.Content: The memory of an amazing stay in an idyllic location will last a long time. Pleasently surprised to be upgraded on arrival as it was our wedding anniversary - to a suite no less! Tried to fake it so my wife thought I had booked it all along but didn't get away with that this time! Lovely meals, attentive service. Drinks on the rooftop in the Emperor Bar ( I think it is called that) provide a spectacular setting. I noticed some complaints about prices but I don't believe you book a 5 star Hotel ( whether you think it is or not) and expect to have all the accompanying services on the cheap. We booked it for an experience and that was certainly delivered. In fact we have booked for 4 more nights in October at the end of our Italy trip. So will be interesting to see if anything changes. But for now it was a winner. Off to Capri and Amalfi next.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Susannalovesjim
Reviews.Content: The room was gorgeous, great view of the inner courtyard which was just beautiful. Private roof bar on our floor with a spectacular view of the entire city and all of the sites. Loved this place.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel with surly service”
Reviews.Author: milspec1953
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered this hotel, the reception was cold, surly and unprofessional. No questions would be answered until a credit card was presented. Disgraceful housekeeping, no replenishment of toiletries, missing robes, unannounced construction, failed promises to correct inadequacies. Overcharged on drinks, feigned and thinly veiled excuses on restaurant service and just generally an overall rude and lazy attitude towards guests. Only one redeeming value was Pino at the concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tresura
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental de la Ville in September 2009 prior to embarking on a mediterranean cruise. On this trip, I was 18 weeks pregnant. We had a very difficult flight, and I was exhausted and not feeling well. When we arrived at the hotel, I really needed an early check in, but nothing was available, because the hotel was fully booked and the staff was still cleaning rooms. The general manager of the hotel named Giacomo, however, took notice of our situation, and immediately stepped in. He provided us with a room that was technically out of service due to some wiring issues, but was otherwise perfectly fine and very clean. My husband and I were given a place to rest until our official room was available. I am eternally grateful for Giacomo for being kind, understanding, and very hospitable. Although my husband tried to give Giacomo an extra tip for his services, he profusely declined and said that it was his pleasure to help us out. I understand that Giacomo was doing his job, but we really felt that his kindness went above and beyond what we experienced before while travelling in Europe (and in the USA for that matter). Once our official room was ready, we found out that Giacomo ugraded us to a room with a very nice balcony with a full table for sitting outside. It was heavenly! I used to live in Rome and stayed there many times. I had never stayed at this hotel before, though, and was very excited to get comparably a good rate through bidding on the hotel via Priceline. The hotel is in a great location - right at the top of the Spanish Steps. It is beautiful, with lots of lovely balconies and a very nice roof top terrace. I highly recommend this hotel for the superb service and the lovely setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: CurryA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the Hassler Hotel at the top of the Spanish Steps and near the Borghese Gardens. It's not of the same quality as a five star hotel, but we didn't pay five star prices, so we didn't expect that level of service/quality. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The outdoor breakfast buffet is really a treat. There is a beautiful terrace overlooking Rome that is is nice for a pre-dinner drink. The one thing that annoyed me about the hotel was the internet connectivity was €28 for 24 hours which is absolutely outrageous given that most hotels these days don't charge for internet access; so business travellers beware.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the InterContinental, we had the trip of a lifetime to Rome”
Reviews.Author: ancarlex
Reviews.Content: My family, with 2 college students and a 15 yr old, spent 4 nights at the Intercontinental while exploring Rome. We couldn't have been more pleased! The manager and staff went out of their way to make us feel pampered and served. My husband and I had a suite while the kids had a Rome view room with a pull-out couch. The breakfast buffet was amazing and served in such a perfectly charming setting. (We still talk about it). We had questions daily for the concierge desk and they were always helpful and gave excellent advice. The location is perfect - we walked to so many sites and had Rome at our beck and call......I hope we can get back to this beautiful city soon. We will certainly be staying at the InterContinental de la Ville!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value...also the outdoor breakfast was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lvtauro
Reviews.Content: I was a little bit unsure whether the hotel would live up to its 5 star rating considering the price (weekend special of approx 230 euros) which inclued breakfast, but i was pleasantly surprised, The rooms were well appointed and comfortable with high quality toiletries.There were several restaurants including an outside terrace for late evening cocktails. The breakfast area was my favorite due the the courtyard location, and a very extensive breakfast buffett. The staff (Ana and Lorenzo) were very helpful and highly professional. Also i enjoyed the front desk help of Marco, and the concierge services of Pino. The location is next to the Hassler hotel on the top of the Spanish steps, very convenient and central. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spanish Steps Location”
Reviews.Author: parrot50
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel where we have stayed many times previously. There is no better location in Rome. You are at the top of the Spanish Steps (doors down from the much more expensive Hassler), and can walk to all the major sights. The rooms (while varied i size and decor) are all elegant. Some rooms have a balcony or terrace. The ones facing the city can be noisy, so you need to keep your windows closed if you are trying to sleep. (Air conditioning works great.) The staff is professional and helpful and there are no better doormen anywhere. The bar is a nice place for a drink, and the food is good. The breakfast, while very expensive, is an incredible buffet of all the best that italy has to offer...fresh eggs, cured meats, cheeses, fruits, etc. Through the Hotel Chain and club you can sometimes find good deals (relatively speaking) for the rooms. I would return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ECKM
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Intercontinental de la Ville Roma for 2 nights. The location is excellent, right at the top of the Spanish Steps, in the heart of the luxurious shopping area. It is walking distance to most of Rome major sites. Also, very close the Borghese gardens. As for the hotel itself, the room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The only complaint was the service. We had ordered room service, which was delivered on a tray. The next day, after housekeeping cleaned our room, the tray, with the dirty dishes was still sitting on our table. Items from the nightstand were thrown on the floor. Definately, not impressed with this type of service. The do not take pride in their housekeeping. Otherwise, no complaints. The conceirge recommended excellent restaurants. He was very helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Hernan1953
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastical hotel. Its location is superb, the rooms are clean, and the service is excellent. We have stayed there 3 times in the past seven years, and each time we Iiked more. In our last visit, what we most enjoyed was the breakfast with its splendid buffette (it was included in the price...). The people at the front desk are very helpful in advising you on dining and touring. I found its rate reasonable comparing with what they offer.

Reviews.Title: “wish we could have stayed longer and can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: lewhubbell
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful and clean. Beautiful and delicious buffet breakfast was included each day. Eating outside was wonderful. Very good service throughout hotel. We had a junior suite and teenagers slept on a pull out sofa that they thought was actually comfortable. Bathroom was large. The only complaints we had were that the pillows were not full enough and the airconditioner must have had a governor on the thermostat because it never got colder than about 74 degrees, but I think that is typical for Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jimaryann
Reviews.Content: Great location close to Borghese Gardens. Everything else was very disappointing. Trouble with phones and internet that the staff never fixed, housekeeping was sporadic, concierge staff unfriendly and even gave incorrect information on train schedule in writing. Air conditioning ineffective but that may have been due to Rome being in the middle of heat wave. Expect more from this rank of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: TrvlChica
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, in a wonderful location. Expect to pay for every extra at a premium. Room service delivery fee 10 euro, 1 phone call to local tour company cost 19 euro, basic continental bkfst 18 euro, internet 24 euro per day. Perfect location near Spanish Steps (they come alive at night!), and near amazing designer shopping. Room had very good air conditioning, very clean, and we never saw the staff who cleaned - in/out quickly. Attentive staff - but we paid for the service. If budget is of no concern, this is the place to stay. We walked to all areas of the city - Vatican City, Colleseum, Borghese. Great view from restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JaSt_Travellers
Reviews.Content: The only thing this hotel has going for it is its location - at the top of the Spanish Steps. Other than that I'd struggle to find anything good to say about this place. Initially sent to a room that had not been cleaned since the last person checked out. No apology from the very rude and unhelpful reception staff (a consistent feature throughout our 3 day stay). Eventually sent to another very small room, which had a small but filfthy balcony littered with cigarette ends. Special mention to the iron, which resembled something from the victorian era which should have been heated by hot coals ! Definitely not 5 Star and a million miles away from the usual Intercontinental standard... AVOID !

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: oceangirl2008
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop in Italy and the most disappointing hotel. There was construction outside the hotel, so the front door was left open, letting the hot and humid air in. There was no lobby to speak of, only a small front desk with two people working. There was a line of people waiting to check in. Our bags were left by the open front door and we kept an eye on them to make sure they weren't moved. It took quite a while to get checked in - the clerk looked right past us in line and helped an Italian couple who were in line after us. This did not bode well for the rest of our experience. We were told that someone would help us with our bags - no one did - so we grabbed them and headed for our "suite." The room was terrible. Very old, very small, dirty carpet, cracks in the ceiling, and just not a place we wanted to stay. We had stayed in excellent hotels throughout Italy, but could not imagine staying here.
