We left immediately and fortunately, found another great hotel to finish our trip in Rome. All in all, this was a very disappointing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: LittleDeuceCoupe
Reviews.Content: My family of four and I stayed here for four days and would have enjoyed it more if the facilities and rooms had been updated. Some of our friends had stayed next door at The Hassler and commented that it was overrated, so while we loved the location of the Intercontinental, it felt very old with its tiny elevators, unmarked entrances to the spa/fitness center and sixth floor bar, and small outdated bathrooms with flimsy shower curtains. Our children's room had poor air conditioning. Realizing that it's hard to find "new", luxurious, and affordable in a central location of Rome, this property was fine considering the pleasant staff, complimentary buffet breakfast, and efficient/knowledgeable concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: rafrommer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit dated (i.e. elegant in an old world sort of way) and the rooms are very small. Great location though at the the top of the Spanish Steps and about 20 yards from the metro. Tiny elevators so not for wheelchairs. Service was decent as expected. I am not sure we would stay here again as it was expensive for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,needs refurbishing!”
Reviews.Author: swisscheck
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently located on top of the spanish stairs,which is great for nearby shopping at via condotti and many sights.It offers a nice view from the roof top terrasse,where you can enjoy drinks but no snacks. The breakfast buffet at € 35 (!) offers a good choice and has a nice courtyard. The bred selection,however,felt like it came out of a plastic bag!We needed 3 interventions of the engineer to make the airconditioning work,which was a bit painful given the outside temperature was over 30 degrees C.Service was mixed: reception and concierge very helpful, roof top terrasse pretty rude.Overall,the hotel needs serious refurbishing to live up to the high standards of the Intercontinental Hotels.I prefer the Hotel de la Russie.

Reviews.Title: “Recently at a conference so most likely...”
Reviews.Author: Debtheweb
Reviews.Content: Recently at a conference so most likely rates inflated. Was with a group so saw some and heard about many of the rooms. Paid 515 euros per night. My room fortunately has a lovely terrace and two twin beds. The rooms are old and in need of some updating. The bathroom has been done and very nice, although small. Beds were good and slept well. Rooms have nice views of courtyard or city. I did get to see other rooms which I would say were extremely small and had a closet the size of a broom closet. Some of the rooms didn't even get Internet access. My co worker got a room he barely fit in. He is on the tall side but still ridiculous. Finally after many calls was able to get a room with a bed he could fit in. Prior to my stay of five nights. I sent many emails to ask for advise on restaurants and taxi service etc. Most were never returned. I called once and was told it would take few days to make a restaurant recommendation. Not impressed. When I checked out did see an incorrect Internet charge but not going to bother. Also terrible experience when our hired car came to pick us up the bellman refused to put our bags in the back. They were worried they would scratch the van. I raised my voice to say after paying 500 euros a night you won't lift my bags into this van. I had tipped the bellman to bring my bags down. No way I was leaving anymore money at this place. Also my friend had car come to pick her up and hotel said she was not a guest. Also cut off her incoming calls. The location was oustanding. Breakfast was very good and have lovely selection. Prior to this stayed four nights at westin. Now there is a great hotel int that I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Quality international hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: ktownluv7
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent Christmas here in 2009, wonderful experience. The staff, notably the concierge, are exceptional, even offering us tickets to Christmas Eve mass at the St. Peter's. Their restaurant suggestions were superb, and don't miss breakfast at the hotel. Location can't be beat (well, only by The Hassler next door), atop the Spanish Steps. The rooms are tight, and it's not the most relaxing place, but that's to be expected in Europe. The lobby does leave a bit to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Visit this hotel and experince the magic of rome”
Reviews.Author: ghtraveller
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this hotel and it did not dissapoint. The location is great well withing reach of the major attractions and some splendid resteraunts. The rooms are clean and the beds very comfortable. Breakfast is wonderful particualary if you have a table in the courtyard. It is a great place to sit and enjoy the extensive breakfast menu. The staff are all very attentive and polite. The concierge booked tours for us and was able to advise us on the most appropriate tours. There is nothing negative I can say about this hotel as it really is lovley.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: MauritsLondon
Reviews.Content: These reviews are all about how expectations are met: all I wanted was a good nights sleep in a good hotel after a very long journey. I booked a single room for 1 night and indeed, I got what I paid for: a single room as big as a shoebox, with a single bed and the bed wasn't even that comfortable. The 'wetroom' (don't even dare to call it a bathroom) was so tiny that you can barely move and the shower couldn't hang properly. Tiles were damaged everywhere. All this at the price of € 200 without breakfast. They charged € 25 for internet use. Service at the desk was aloof but polite. This hotel does not, in any way, offer value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Hotel with Great Location in Badly Need of Refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: angiesc08
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Decor in lobby - love the richly colored drapery and antique wood furniture but looks a bit old and in need of refurbishing. - Great location, right next to the Spanish Steps by a lot of high end designer stores Cons: - Tiny, cramped bathroom and hairdryer didn't work - Small and dark room, bed somewhat uncomfortable - Mixed bag w/ concierge - some good but some unhelpful recommendations I would give the hotel 3.5 stars - overall I felt the hotel was tastefully decorated but in need of updating, and the layout was reflective of the city - cramped!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, serene and civilzed at top of Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: domrocsmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel has many wonderful qualities and if you are lucky enough to get one of their 7th floor rooms, beautiful views of the city. The concierge staff was knowledgeable, very helpful and friendly - printing out maps, arranging transport, etc. Our experience was a mixed bag, however, which started out rough, but ended up well. My husband and I were travelling to Rome for 3 short days to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary, and I wanted a very special place with great views from our room. We have in the past travelled quite a bit and have had some wonderful hotel rooms with incredible views, so for such a special occasion this was a priority. I had booked, after much research and reviews, what I thought was a city view room with a terrace or balcony on either the 6th or 7th floor (their lower floor rooms have only a limited busy street view or inner courtyard view) with one King bed. We had let them know that it was a very special occasion and requested the nicest view room in our category. Upon arrival I was shocked to find that our room was not only NOT a city view room, but on the bottom, first floor. The "view" of the courtyard was a view of the ugly a/c unit and the deck was a shared patio with no privacy at all. There were also two separate double beds and after calling down to reception we were told that someone would come up and move our beds together. What??? So, we went to dinner and hours later when we came back, the beds were right where they were and so we squeezed into the one double bed. We were so exhausted at that point after travelling almost 20 hours to get there and full day and night of walking around, we were dead tired. We did not purchase the lowest tier category of room and also were promised a room upgrade with our paid Ambassador club status. The clerk upon check in was of no help and told us there were no city view rooms available. After seeing our room and being extremely disappointed, we asked to speak with a manager. Pamela was able to find us a room on the 6th floor with a city view for the next two nights. So we had to stay in that room for the night and switch over the next day. So the next day after 4:00 p.m., we packed up and they moved us. From here it all gets better... not only did they move us, but we now had a top floor room on the 7th floor with a sweeping view of the city with St. Peter's in the distance and a very private huge terrace with 3 french doors that led outside. So one night in a lower class, non-view dark, dismal room and 2 nights in the other beautiful room with one King bed and views is what we got. The inner courtyard outdoor eating area was absolutely lovely - although it rained during our entire trip so it was unusable. But, the indoor restaurant was equally appealling and the breakfast, which was included in the price of our room with our Ambassador Club status what elaborate and delicious. We did not eat there for any other meals however - there are just way too many other wonderful places to try. The bar on the second floor was cozy and we loved the bar staff there. Very friendly and professional. They also have a rooftop open area bar, but it was pretty much closed because of the rain. I'm sure in nice weather it would be a great place to have a cafe or cocktail with a view of the city. Our bed was very comfy with crisp, clean white sheets. Our bathroom was large, clean, but could definitley use a higher quality toilet paper. Seriously, it was rough and one ply. For $500 a night, you expect a little more. All in all I think the de la Ville is a very nice hotel (right next door to the uber-expensive Hassler) but they need to work on their handling of room assignments and reservations desk. Everything else was wonderful and we didn't let it spoil our trip. However, had they not been able to accomodate us and give us the room we thought we had booked, we would have pulled out and gone somewhere else. If you want a room with a city view be extra careful and book it directly with the hotel and get a confirmation IN WRITING of the type of room you will get. If you want an inner-courtyard room, just make sure it's not on the first or second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way...”
Reviews.Author: Lucy77
Reviews.Content: We recently held an international business meeting at the InterContinental. Giacomo (duty manager) and his staff ensured everything was perfect and as we wished. The rooms we ready earlier than the check in time, so our customers did not have to wait. The meeting room was spacious for our group of 15 (U-shaped + breakout round tables in the back). The meeting room was also light filled (with curtains which could be closed for light control) and emptied out onto a beautiful courtyard and another room for lunch when it was rainy. Anything we asked for was greeted with a smile and was done immediately. The food was excellent; breakfast is included in the meeting delegate rate and lunches were delicious. The location cannot be beat with access to the Spanish Steps literally less than a block away. Pino, the concierge, recommended the most amazing restaurants (including 2 for group dinners) and was always willing to help find a shop nearby to do some quick shopping (olive oil, wine, children's clothes, etc.). The rooms were clean, well-appointed (flat-screen TVs), and full sized tub/showers. Mine was on the small side, but when in Rome, you aren't in your room much, so it was perfect for just me. I travel a lot for business and plan many international meetings a year for our customers- the InterContinental Rome is by far one of my favorite hotels for service, accommodation of our needs, and ambience for our meeting and customers. I have stayed in several Rome hotels for business and pleasure and the InterContinental has been the best. It should be noted that is was my 5th trip to Rome. The next time I am in Rome, whether with my family, or again for business, I will be staying at the InterContinental Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BGR3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotels in Venice, Florence and Rome and found this hotel to be the worst hotel in which we have ever stayed! They nickel and dime you on everything! The "business center" charges $5 Euros for 15 minutes on their 1 computer; $8.50 for a Coke in your mini bar and $25 Euros for coffee and rolls for breakfast. I made 2 fifteen minute phone calls from my room phone to a Rome cell phone and they charged over $100 Euros!! Avoid this hotel like the plague!!

Reviews.Title: “"The most delightful and charismatic staff I've ever met"”
Reviews.Author: mec13
Reviews.Content: Yes, de la Ville scored high on location, quality, cleanliness and value. However, what really stood out was the SERVICE. My mom and I stayed at de la Ville for 10 days, so we had plenty of time for a fair critique. The Concierge was outstanding, to say the least. Christopher Galotti and Pimo Dolce were stars. The InterContinental gives their staff customer training every 3 months, and it shows. What a wonderful experience to have not only a 5 star hotel (on American Express's Preferred hotel list), but to feel like we were part of the de la Ville family. My thanks to you, InterContinenal, (and Pimo and Christopher...)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: lmciptak
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this wonderful hotel - it was a perfect experience. The location was perfect, right next to the Spanish Steps, accessible to all of Rome. The room was lovely, the service impeccable and the front desk was helpful in every way possible. My daughter and I were almost immediately part of the De La Ville family. Would we return? Absolutely!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Excellent Staff/Service!”
Reviews.Author: kk1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel during a family trip to Italy. This hotel is located right on top of the Spanish Steps in the center of Rome right next to upscale shopping and all the attractions; very nice hotel with old European charm. Our room was a fairly decent size for a hotel in Italy and very clean. The restaurant and hotel staff was very attentive to our needs as a leisure travelers, but the concierge service was TRULY exeptional! I spent a couple of days on my own before the rest of my family arrived and I felt very comfortable staying there as alone female traveler...HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and not a true InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: Pro-Flyer
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, no doubt .... but: Room felt uncared for, glasses in minibar dirty and breakfast service abysmal. Overall a bad experience. The hotel did not deliver what one expects of an InterContinental.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful to be back”
Reviews.Author: Baltzan
Reviews.Content: We would now not stay anywhere else in Rome. In the last few years we have stayed at 3 other hotels but this is our Rome home. We had a lovely room with a little garden and used our free night coupon with no difficulty. The staff are all very friendly, in particular, Luca the bartender. The rooftop bar remains a treat but there is still a crane from construction in your view. Our breakfast was included and it's huge complete with champagne and orange juice.The garden restaurant is most attractive and used in good weather like the rooftop bar. Location is everything as long as you can climb the Spanish Steps. This property is not cheap but well worth the cost

Reviews.Title: “Giacomo Pica Duty Manager and Staff's passion and service was 5 Star!”
Reviews.Author: Carrafiello
Reviews.Content: The moment we arrived my son (14) and I were welcomed with warmth and experience. The entire experience -reservations, staff to the Duty Manager was a pleasure . I recommend this Hotel from the Heart. Intercontinental Del Roma truly made our stay a in Rome delight.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with service beyond belief”
Reviews.Author: jlmcfarlan
Reviews.Content: I am writing this in praise of the excellent De La Ville Intercontinental Roma and our stay in April 2010. Let me tell you a story. On the third day of our Rome visit, my wife fell on the cobblestone street two blocks from the hotel. She suffered significant facial lacerations and a broken left arm. Someone in the crowd informed the hotel and by the time we were starting toward the hotel, we were ment by the manager, Giacoma Pica and concierge Filippo. They provided first aid at the hotel and Giacoma took us by cab to the hospital, waited three hours with us providing translation and consolation while the doctors performed diagnostics, sutured the lesions, and cast the arm. Giaacoma then brought us back to the hotel, took me to the pharmacy for medications again providing translation and support. He put us in contact with the hotel physician (who was very supportive) as well as providing numerous additional services to assist us (such as sending staff to pick up our train tickets, coordinating our transportaion to Positano and alerting the hotel in Positano of our situation). It was like having your own father help you. All of this was provided at no charge. What was done for us was way beyond the call of duty and I cannot say enought about Giacoma Pica, a wonderful human being who we will cherish the rest of our lives. The hotel is beautiful, the location superb, the food is excellent and the service impeccable. Being a grand European hotel, it is beautifully appointed and retains unique antique qualities in the rooms and public areas. Outdoor patios off the dinning areas and a bar area on the top of the hotel (with magnificent views of Rome) offer wonderful dinning experiences should you need a break from all that the city has to offer. However, the most important point about the De La Ville Intercontinental Roma is the fact that is is staffed by some of the most wonderful people you will ever encounter. I can only hope you have the opportunity to stay and this great hotel, and should you encounter an emergency or acute condition, you can only hope that you are a guest here. We have now found a new home in Rome

Reviews.Title: “Nice, adequate, but a very busy location”
Reviews.Author: kirktsu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely appointed, but there are a few things to be aware of. The location is near the top of Spanish steps on a narrow one way street. This makes for a very busy location with lots of cars and pedestrians walking by. The street facing rooms are very noisy. Opening windows also brings in lots of the car pollution and cigarette smoke. If I could do it over again, I'd ask for a room facing the courtyard rather than the street side. Second, in spite of the fact we showed up with an infant and stroller, we were given a room that required several steps down and several steps up to get to the room. Had to carry the stroller up and down these steps the four nights we stayed there. There are rooms that have easier access without the steps on the left wing of the building. Ask for a room on the left wing if you have a wheelchair or a stroller. Third, the rooms do not have air conditioning. It was moderately warm for April, so keep this in mind if you book in the summer months. Otherwise, the location is central to many, if not all, the monuments and points of interest - most of which can be approached within 10-30 minutes walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Rome, top notch hotel staff, the hospitality was A++++!!!”
Reviews.Author: megnavin
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline, so we did not choose the InterContinental de la Ville, but set a price, neighborhood and star rating and this is the hotel we "won." We were ultimately very pleased. We paid about $300 including taxes, etc., per night, per room; we booked 2 rooms for 3 nights (4/1 - 4/4). A couple of weeks before our trip, we called and spoke to Giacomo Pica, the Hotel Manager. From that phone call, until we checked out, we only had positive experiences and we had the most luxurious stay. Mr. Pica greeted us early (1PM) when we got there and our rooms were set up and waiting for us specifically. He set us up in 2 adjoining rooms, each had a king - we flowed in and out of the 2 rooms. The staff also set up full sized cots in each room. The rooms, beds, bathrooms, etc., were perfect - down comforters, tons of pillows, clean rooms, etc. The bathrooms had everything you needed - extra kits with toothbrushes, slippers for each of us, etc. Moments after we unpacked and settled, we were also greeted with champagne. The location was perfect. We looked out onto the top of the Spanish Steps. We easily walked to the Pantheon, the Trevi Fountain, Borghese Museum, subways, etc. We never cabbed at all, just took the subway a little and did a lot of walking. My husband and I had my parents with us (both in mid and late 70's) and our children. My Dad just had a knee replacement in January (78 years old) and did all the same walking that we did and climbed the Spanish steps up and down several times =). We also had teenage girls with us and were comfortable with them moving around the lobby, etc. We even walked back to the hotel from the Vatican one night. Walking in Rome is beautiful. Keep in mind, you can walk to this hotel from several different directions, avoiding the steps easily if you desire. Our cab dropped us right at the front door the first day. We opted not to buy coffee, eat in or use the internet here but waited for our next destination and used our blackberries, etc., instead. The concierge was very helpful in pointing us toward museums, restaurants, the best routes to take - there was always more than enough help at that desk with maps, etc. They booked our Borghese Museum trip too (you need a reservation). The grounds are beautiful there by the way; if you are a runner, it feels a bit like Central Park, NY. The common areas at the hotel were beautiful. We sat at night and read, had wine, etc. Overall, we found Rome a bit expensive...do as much research as you can and I would not recommend the cafe just several doors down from this hotel (away from the Spanish Steps), but rather the one on the way to the Borghese (around the corner). We also rented a car (just a several block walk from the hotel) on the way out of Rome at the Europcar office - very convenient. Contact Giacomo Pica if you plan to visit and have specific specifications/expectations. The charm and location were spectacular and Mr. Pica was more than accommodating the entire time we were there. We look forward to visiting Rome again and would love to stay at the de la Ville again. Of our 4 destinations (Rome, Cinque Terre, Venice and Tuscany), this was our nicest hotel and the only one we did through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, so we returned and weren't disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Dog_Cove_on_the_Road
Reviews.Content: We are booking another trip to Italy for this summer and while this review will be almost a year old/late, we are returning to the de la Ville again because of our previous stays and so here is a few words to consider if you are looking. Location above the Spanish Steps was perfect for us though some friends prefer other areas. We found the property because our parents used to stay at the Hassler which is more expensive and a little better rated but the de la Ville is right next door and seems almost as boutique-y though, yes, not quite as refined but then again I saved $200+ a night which made our wines less expensive at dinner! If you can afford that Hassler do it but the de la Ville has been splendid for us. I must say that when we arrived at our 7th floor room for the first time I almost didn't go in and instead went back downstairs to request another room but that would have been our mistake, our door was right next to the elevators but surprisingly it was a suite with a long but thin terrace. I was still a little concerned about hearing the elevators but we didn't at all. From our terrace the views over Roma were breathtaking, morning, day and nigh, simply stunning and if you aren't in this area of the city it is difficult to have the elevation in order to see all of Rome. It seems that if you are on the 5th floor or below, floors we nevr stayed on, you have more obstructed views by the buildings across the street though if you have an interior facing room/view, what you might call the "lanai view" if you were on the ocean you overlook a lovely green space and the hotel's attractive and open aire restaurant so that might be pleasant and I know it was much less of a tariff to stay therer. We had breakfast in that restaurant twice, the rest of the mornings we had room service delivered to our terrace so we could sip the hotel's fabulous coffee while dining on fresh fruit and bakery items (as folks know, eggs, omeletes and bacon are hardly Italian specialties). I can't speak more highly about the feeling coupled with the visualy appealing al fresco experience one has from that terrace when enjoying the NYT's online (delivered each morning) and sipping coffee with your favorite person by your side. Sunsets kept us returning every evening with wine, cheese and salami in hand for terrace decompressions before preparing dinner, and we rarely saw other guests on the adjoining balconies. Oh, breakfast in the sunlight filled restaurant we terrific... and was included in our rate. Beautifully marbled and tiled baths make even an American Four Season's look pitiful!! And always. like large in-room safes that fit laptops and whatever else. The hotel bar is small but absolutely darling and my wife and I often return there for its serenity after dinner. The staff seems to have been there for ever, they remembered us for some reason, and Pino and that Concierge team works miracles.

Reviews.Title: “The best place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Miarabb
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to Rome and I always stay at the De La Ville. It is a fabulous place to stay, close to everything. Hospitality is an A+++. The room was spacious, the staff outstanding. If you go to Rome, stay at the De La Ville, you will not be disappointed. Giacomo went above and beyond his duties to make sure I was comfortable and well taken care of. Pino and Christian at the concierge desk are wonderful, always willing to help anyone out, as with all of the staff. Marco (bartender) is wonderful, always friendly and smiling. Bravo to the De La Ville.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: manger2
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental has a great location at the top of the Spanish Steps. The staff was excellent and very accomodating. We arrived early in the morning and they were able to give us a room before check- in time.The classic rooms are small as are many in Europe. We asked to be upgraded to a deluxe room since we were spending six nights there and they did. The first room was smaller and noisy since it faced the street. The next room was larger and quieter as we had our own balcony that faced a courtyard. The only recommendations that we have are: internet service was costly and slow. Given the cost of the hotel, internet service should be free. Also, a small continental breakfast would be nice if that was included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: jetlaggad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many IC's all over the globe , this must be at the bottom of the pile. Lobby and check in area a total mess , crowded and lousy service from the check in staff. The hotel is screaming for renovation , not good!

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service”
Reviews.Author: lonestar77
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Intercontinental in Roma. I have stayed with the Intercontinental brand before back home in the U.S. and have always had a high quality experience. For the location, I am not sure you can beat it. The hotel is directly atop the Spanish Steps and every major attraction is easily walkable. We did read the reviews about having to climb the steps to go home every night, but unless you have difficulty walking, how many chances do you get to climb the spanish steps to go to bed? Also it is a very short walk to the Borgeshe gardens which made a great place to have some down time with the children. Our room was in-line with sizes for Europe and that was with a jr. suite. Certainly not a suite by U.S. standards, but a tremendous room for Europe. Yes, the decor is not necessarily modern, the room was very clean and the bedding very comfortable. For those traveling with younger children, unfortunatley there really are no choices for television or movies in the room for them. The service here is outstanding, especially concierge with Nicola and his staff. Nicola was able to pick up tickets to Palm Sunday mass at the Vatican days before our arrival at the hotel. Having that experience was truly once in a lifetime, and I am very grateful to have gotten those tickets. The desk greeted our children each and every time we walked by and made them feel right at home. The service at the restaraunt for breakfast and lunch was also world class. My only disapointment was the cost of food at the hotel. Certainly the value for location and the room were worth it, but breakfast and dinner costs were astonishing. Normally, we would avoid frequent dining at the hotel, but it was the most conveinent option with some early morning excursions. The breakfast buffet has tremendous choice but carries a price of 35Euro ($47 US) per person. We did try the restaraunt for dinner, again the service was phenomenal, but the quality of the food certainly not worth the outrageous price. Certainly not a complete reflection on the hotel, as these kinds of things were in my control. Overall a fantastic choice to stay in Rome, outstanding service and care.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Reliability”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFast
Reviews.Content: Great location at top of Spanish steps with traditional Italian decor, located only 100 feet from the Metro (use the Metro elevator if you don't want to walk a lot of stairs.) Staff were fantastic, very friendly, and went out of their way to assist us with any need, including when our taxi driver double charged us. Due to the European airline strikes, we had to change our hotel reservations several times, and Daniele Bertaccini in Reservations was extremely nice and accommodating despite our multiple changes. As a Platinum member, we were upgraded to a deluxe room w/a Juliet balcony and view of St. Peter's in the distance--what a great view! Deluxe room was large and had a good-sized bathroom with a great shower. The heat was still on (60F outside), so we had to leave the window open our first night, which was very loud with vespas and trucks going by. We notified the front desk and they were able to turn the heat off to our room the following morning. The public internet in the lobby didn't work during our 3-day stay (10 Euros for 30 minutes). I never bring a laptop on a leisure trip, and expect that hotels of this caliber to offer a working internet or have tech support to offer an altnernative, esp. on a weekend when leisure guests. This was a big inconvenience and really the only negative experience at the hotel. The internet problem seems to exist at all of the big hotels in Italy... We did not eat at the hotel..."When in Rome", I prefer to eat a slice of pizza for breakfast (there's a small place near the bottom of Metro station where they sell it by the gram.) Overall I was very happy with my experience. Rome hotels are pricey, but you can easily pay 200 Euros per night for a bad hotel, so the InterContinental is an excellent option if you can afford it or get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the Deluxe Rooms are way too small!”
Reviews.Author: Thadorian
Reviews.Content: First thing is first, the location cannot be beat. The spanish steps and the luxury shopping in the area is second to none except maybe parts of Paris. We never once had to take a taxi, as we simply walked everywhere we wanted. I firmly believe that walking is the best way to truly see the city, and this location is perfect for that. Only down side is that you have to walk the spanish steps essentially to get anywhere you want. They are not as romantic by the end of a few days in Roma. To the specifics of the rooms. I have traveled throughout Europe, and have even lived in Europe. Never before have I felt that a room was so small that I could not even move around in it. The shower was so small across that it was impossible for me to be in the shower without touching the curtain or the wall. And I am 5'8" weighing only 160lbs! Not remotely large or overweight! I can't speak for the larger rooms, but in no way would I recommend someone stay in their lower level rooms. There are simply way better places for your dollar per square foot while still being luxury. They charge you about $30 USD for internet a day, and even a cup of tea is $15. This is all after you already are paying hundreds a night. This is common for all Intercontinental hotels, but at least the others I have been to you can walk around your room. I simply recommend staying away from this Intercontinental unless you are staying in a Villa or Penthouse. Roma is great, and there are better places to stay to see it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great stay”
Reviews.Author: TD8
Reviews.Content: Found ourselves at the top of the Spanish Steps with a great room and great personal service.

Reviews.Title: “THE EPITOME OF ROMA!!”
Reviews.Author: Amie_loves_Italy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Intercontinental for 10 days during yet another Italian holiday and found the hotel to be outstanding. The courtyard bar is the perfect place to start the evening with a gin and tonic or two and found Antonio the waiter to be the most attentive we have ever come across and have stayed in some pretty fab hotels around the globe...so good we tipped him 50 euros on the last night as he made our stay so unforgetable. Located on top of the Spanish steps we couldn't have been anywhere better to wander during the day. Only two down side...room's aren't huge (although certainly not small by any means!) and a good 15 minutes walk to Pantheon Square/Piazza Narvona for the evenings but with the balmy summer nights it was a pleasure strolling back to the hotel at dinner. Only had breakfast once and to be honest for the price you can pick up some pastries and coffee 2 minutes away for about a 10th of the price. I would definately recommend this hotel for those looking for old school Italian glamour and a great location....worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, well located hotel full of surprises!”
Reviews.Author: LeahPhiladelphia_PA
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is just above the Spanish Steps. Very few rooms are alike but all have the outstanding InterContinental appointments with regard to a plush bed, great pillows and a box overloaded with bath amenities. I had a Junior Suite with a bathroom bigger than most hotel rooms. It included an amazing double shower with a marble bench. The dining room could and would prepare anything to perfection. The bar on the 2nd floor was hard to find initially, but bar service was better than the Hassler next door. If you want a more complete meal at the bar, use the room service menu which is extensive! This is a great find with outstanding views from several floors, a caring staff and within walking distance to all of Rome! I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with Needs for Renovation”
Reviews.Author: StephanieRose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for 2 nights during our honeymoon trip in Italy. I am a platinum member with the priority club rewards and used points to stay at this hotel. With that said, we got a very basic room. Upon arrival, the staff was polite and professional. We have no complaints with the staff but will say that other hotels we stayed at had much warmer and friendlier staff presence. The location is great! Our room was pretty tiny and we could barely fit our two carry-on bags in it. We expected this due to the location of the hotel. The hotel itself is beautiful. We were a little disappointed in our room. Paint was peeling off the ceiling in the bathrooms, lots of gashes in the walls, cracks in the bathroom floor tile. This does not meet the Intercontinental standards. That aside, the room was decorated wonderfully and was very comfortable. If we stayed at this hotel again, we look to pay extra money for an upgraded room. Location was great!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenaire
Reviews.Content: Service is supposed to be transparent, not non-existent. Unfortunately, my experience at the Intercontinental Hotel de Ville in Rome presented me with non-existent service. Calling oneself a five star hotel does not make it one. As this was my first visit to both this hotel and to Rome, I do not know if my experience was part of a deficit in the Intercontinental training program, poor management at this hotel property or some facet of the Roman persona. However, it was consistent with all personnel I encountered except for a brief encounter with the housekeeping staff and a bartender. When I checked in, the staff at the reception desk seemed to examine me, deciding if I passed some kind of worthiness factor before assigning me a room. I must not have. I paid approximately $1500.00 for a seven-night stay. The hotel accepted my bid; It should not have relegated me to some kind of steerage-class treatment. There was no, “Welcome to the Intercontinental”, no other greeting. The only difference between my reception and that at a Motel 6 was there was no bulletproof glass between the staff and me. The room was clean, not particularly well appointed, a little threadbare, on the small side and facing a very noisy street. I seldom saw anyone in the hotel, either in the small lobby area or in the cocktail lounge. They might have assigned me a room with a better view, larger, whatever. This room had a listed maximum rate of 973 Euros, My son and I ordered room service our first night in the hotel. The server was only perfunctory in his service, hardly gracious or polite. In entering our room and in negotiating the tiny space between the bed and the desk, he actually kicked my shoes out of his way. The food, perhaps typical of Roman cuisine, was mediocre at best. I usually enjoy hotel food, finding it consistently better than average in the various hotel chains where I stay. I spend at least fifty nights a year in hotels. The poached salmon with spinach was the best part of our meal even though the spinach was way over salted. The salad was good too. Surprisingly, the Italian dishes were terrible. The pizza tasted as if they had used frozen dough, undercooked, with a lackluster tomato sauce but with good cheese in the proper proportions. I eat better pizza in nearly any chain restaurant in the states. It was not indicative of pizza in Rome having eaten some great pizza there. The Spaghetti was even worse, a ball of overcooked pasta with too much sauce and parmesan cheese that looked and tasted like the stuff you buy in supermarkets in the USA. Canned spaghetti came to mind. They should have changed the name of the reception desk to the rejection desk. When I checked in, the staff told me I needed to show them my son’s passport so that he could get his own key to our room. Later that day, we walked up to the desk and there was one woman behind the reception desk who was on the phone. I would have expected her to acknowledge our presence with some kind of facial expression, or even to look at us. She didn’t. She continued on the phone, purposely avoiding any type of acknowledgement to us. After almost five minutes on the phone, somewhat annoyed sounding and not hiding that emotion, she provided us with an additional key. I had another experience at the front desk, from a different person, who was completely aloof to me and acted like I was annoying him. Even the doorman and the concierge avoided us. I am used to greeting people, including the staff in hotels, and am used to them greeting me. There were never any salutations from the staff in the front of the hotel. In fact, they always looked like they were avoiding us. Besides my brief interaction with a housekeeper, the bartender, in the always-empty cocktail lounge, was the only pleasant person I dealt with. He came up to me as I was standing in the vacant room and took ownership of any problems I had. The Ritz-Carlton chain must have trained him.

Reviews.Title: “Rome = ROMANCE... BEST HOTEL IN ROME!”
Reviews.Author: queenb77
Reviews.Content: From the moment our Driver dropped us off, I thought this hotel was beautiful. The architecture of the building took my breath away! it was my first time in Rome and I was in love! The staff were friendly and spoke English. Our room was SPECTACULAR! we had a private balcony and it had an awesome view. The room was very clean and the hotel staff were always there is we needed anything. I would highly recommend this Hotel to everyone. If ever in Rome again, I will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE!!!!! This hotel basically stole $500 from me....”
Reviews.Author: willbrad35
Reviews.Content: To start off, the hotel is in a great location. It basically sits just atop the Spanish Steps and is walking distance to many of the great sites in Rome. That is pretty much the only positive thing I can say about this hotel. The first thing you will notice....the rooms are tiny. I understand by European standards this is probably an ordinary sized room. No big deal...I can handle a small, musty old room. The real problem occurred when my Amex bill arrived and it had a $500 charge for a no-show reservation! I immediately called Priority club (I am a platinum member) for an explanation. They explained to me that I had 2 separate reservations, and that I didn't show up for 1 of them. This was a shock to me, considering I made the reservation over the phone with one of their reps, I had no idea why I would have 2 reservations. The rep told me they would contact the hotel and explain what happened and get a refund for me. Mistakes happen, and I was fine with that. Well, you can imagine how disappointed I was when they called me back and said the hotel had refused to refund my money!!! I have tried everything, and the hotel has just refused all of my attempts at a refund. I know this problem originated with the Intercontinental booking agent and not this particular hotel. However, the hotel's handling of the situation once they were explained what happened has been abysmal. Up to this debacle I stayed at Priority Club properties almost every week for work, but after finding out how they treat their Platinum members, I am now solidly a Hilton man (we stayed at several Hilton properties while in Europe and had nothing short or amazing service at every one). If you like over-priced, small rooms with no view, then this is the hotel for you! If you like getting ripped-off at every chance, please stay at this hotel! If you want to stay at a decent hotel and be treated like a valued customer, stay as far away from this hotel as you can.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: NorthshorePA
Reviews.Content: Spent one week there for our honeymoon and couldn't have been happier. I had cashed in five rewards nights and used my Ambassador weekend certificate for the other two. Because of the two room rates, they kept us in the executive level room the entire time but did not upgrade it. It would have been almost impossible to upgrade, though, since we had a terrace that was almost larger than our room with four chairs, a table, and two lounge chairs. From the 7th floor, we had all of the sights of Rome in front of us without any of the street noise. It definitely paid to be on the executive floor as I could imagine there would be smaller rooms throughout the rest of the hotel. The restaurant and the bar were classy and priced appropriately compared to other hotels. We only used room service for one breakfast but were very happy with the quality. The staff were equally professional and obtained our reservations for the Borghese Gallery and a car to take us to the airport. The bottle of wine, water, and fruit were also a nice welcome gift to the hotel. The location was perfect with few sights more than a 10-15 minute walk. I can't wait to make it back there!

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH IT - is not of typical Intercontinental standard”
Reviews.Author: NicknSteph
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights here during our honeymoon. We read lots of reviews (good and bad) and decided that you really can't go wrong staying at an Intercontinental - we were wrong! Location is ok, but hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. We were there in November and the room was extremely hot, so I can imagine how uncomfortable it would be during summer! We even opened the balcony doors to let in cool air but it is incredibly loud outside! Service was ok, but the room was really disappointing (old, cramped, shabby, dark, etc.). They even "upgraded" us from a double to a triple room, and it was tiny! Please don't waste your money - totally not worth it. Take your chances and stay at some of the smaller boutique hotels...you'll get more for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Superbly located hotel, ideal for a great roman experience.”
Reviews.Author: stuosman
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and had a wonderful time. Room was clean and well appointed, and at the usual intercontinental standard. They are small but that is always going to be the case in the centre of rome due to the age of the buildings. Ideally located at the top of the spanish steps, we walked everywhere, including to the vatican city and this only took 25 mins (35-40 if you are strolling). Minibar as others have said is far too expensive but there are plenty of places to get drinks in the nearby area. II wouldn't pay full rack price for the rooms as you could get better for the same money elsewhere in the city but if you get a good deal then this is a great city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location...Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelguy63
Reviews.Content: I had the privilege to stay at the Intercontinental de la Ville in November. The hotel retains its historic charm and character with a welcoming lobby and sitting areas. Our room was spectacular with a view like none I’ve seen in Rome. The room was spotless with all the comforts of home. The location at the top of the Spanish Steps makes the exploring this great city very easy. But these features are not necessarily unique to this hotel. What sets this place apart is the staff and in particular, Marco Manni. He is welcoming and accommodating, charming and professional. All our requests were taken care of with a warm smile and without question. And being greeted at the door by Ernesto after a long day of sightseeing was like coming home to a dear friend. I work in hospitality and understand how difficult it can be to find good staff. These two gentlemen are true assets and will be the reason I shall return to the de la Ville in the future. It’s worth the splurge!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, average rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ChazEd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of Priority Club "free nights offer" so didn't expect a great room and wasn't disappointed! Although it was comfortable enough was very small and contained 1 standard (very narrow) double bed but was well soundproofed from street noise. Staff were very pleasant and efficient but hotel probably not up to the same standard as the rest of the group and well below any we have stayed in elsewhere. Hoever location was excellent and was able to walk to all the major tourist sites, with lots of options for dining within a short walk. 50 euros for the 2 days internet access seemed a bit excessive but I guess the free nights have to be paid for somehow! Overall had a good stay, but had I been paying full rate I may have looked harder at alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TezzMezz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 free nights, thanks to Priority Club's free night offer (where I stayed 6 nights in another Intercontinental Group hotel, and got 3 free nights in any other of their hotels). This was the start of a 2 week vacation through Italy and it was a good start indeed. I must admit that I had initially wanted to give a "4" rating instead of "5" because I am used to a lot more from an Intercontinental hotel. Being used to the Asian level of opulence and grandeur when it comes to 5 star hotels, De la Ville Roma was a bit of a let down when I arrived at its doorstep. That was the first impression, but after 2 weeks of expensive, low-value, hotels in Italy, I think De la Ville Roma is quite a treat and a very comfortable hotel indeed (especially when it was free!) It was my first time in Rome, so I found the location especially good as it was right next to the Spanish Steps and the Spagna subway station. Quite convenient indeed. Rome is lovely to walk around in during the month of October and I remember walking all the way back from The Vatican one day. The rooms are a bit of a squeeze but sufficient for a couple. There is also a roof-top bar which has pretty nice views of the surroundings. The concierge were very helpful as well. Being a first-timer, I had a lot of questions and the gentleman at the counter was very obliging. I would imagine that this hotel would be quite expensive (EUR300-400?) if i had to pay normal rates. Then the value would be pretty low. But it would still be a great hotel to stay at for its location, comfort and helpful staff. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “How could you stay anywhere by the de la Ville in Rome?”
Reviews.Author: JannieJan
Reviews.Content: My third trip to Rome in the past 15 months, third stay at the de la Ville; reminded anew that it is unique. Have stayed at other Intercontinental hotels but none that match this one for hospitality, warmth, personality, comfort and charm. The hotel itself is lovely, small in the European manner, very cozy, but it is the people who work there who make it a stay to remember. I have felt a part of the family since my first visit, feel looked after and taken care of during my visits, and hate to say goodbye to all these darling people. They have made each of my visits nonpareil.

Reviews.Title: “Giacomo Pica, Duty Manager”
Reviews.Author: jockimo
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Intercontinental de la Ville. My experience began when I met Giacomo Pica, Duty Manager for this hotel. Both he and the Hotel Staff were eager to please and make our visit a very comfortable one. The service we received throughout our stay was magnificent! Mr. Pica really works hard and shows his dedication by representing the Intercontinental de la Ville in a very professional manner. The staff is very knowledgeable and helpful with respects to the area and "The Secrets of Rome". In addition, if you let Mr. Pica know that you are gluten-free with a strict diet, he will make sure that the Restaurant Staff are aware and they will prepare meals exactly as you desire! Our room was very comfortable and the staff kept the room clean during the day, along with the turn-down service in the evening. The overall appearance was again, comfortable, and you can go down into the lobby area and sit down to have your complimentary morning coffee and sweet. It is a nice area to sit and read. The Intercontinental is located by the Spanish Steps and we had easy access to Rome's Metro system and taxi's readily available. Again, Mr. Giacomo Pica and his staff will do whatever they can to make your stay a most enjoyable one! Thank you Intercontinental de la Ville staff, we had a perfect trip! N. Cunningham, USA

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star experience - does not match other Intercontinental Hotels”
Reviews.Author: OldWoodster
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent spot - at the top of the Spanish Steps and close to the main tourist areas. Unfortunately - thats about all of the good news. We arived early, before first check in time and enquired if there was a room available, we let them know thatit wasnt a problem if not as we'd just leave our luggage at the hotel and go for a wander. The girl at check in said we could get a room if we would wait 20 minutes. 1 hour later we were still sitting in the lobby with our luggage - she did come back after half an hour to adise is there was a slight delay. Anyway after an hour the room still wasnt available - she told us it would be worth the wait - I assumed room upgrade, wrongly. After a total of 75 minutes we were given a key to our room on the 6th floor - the room was very small, with a tiny balcony looking out over the back of teh hotel - no view to talk of. We stayed for 4 days - on the third day there was no hot water in the morning - reception were less than interested - however the fault was fixed by the following morning. At check out we were overcharged - when I explained that I had a voucher for 1 night free I was treated like a crook - the girl on reception was very aggressive - told me I should have presented it at check in - which I assured her I had - she did not believe me and told me that this couldnt have happened - how did I still have the voucher. She said it was unbelievable that I had been given it back byt the person who checked me in. The overall ambience of the hotel, the rooms, the layout - in fact pretty much everything was of a 3-4 star hotel. At 350 euro per night it was extremely dissapointing. I would strongly advise anyone to think twice before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pun-gent
Reviews.Content: We were staying for 3 free nights at the De La Ville: 1 night using points on 1 reservation, the next 2 nights from the Priority Club Free Night promotion on a different reservation. After reading the reviews, we weren't anticipating much in the way of a room but were pleasantly surprised when the friendly girl at the desk told us she was upgrading us, and we didn't have to go through a room change from one reservation to the other. They gave us room 630, a fairly large room (by European standards), a soft bed (important to my wife :-) and with a view of the courtyard cafe and the hills behind the hotel. We always received a smile and helpful suggestions from the concierge, Nicola. He even loaned us his copy of Rome Eyewitness Guide for planning our days. Our biggest problem was finding parking near the hotel (I didn't feel like paying 35 Euro a night for the hotel garage), but usually found something within 200 meters (and our last night, within 10 meters !!!) For what we paid (free), this was an EXCELLENT value... I'm not sure if I would have thought so if I had to pay the normal $500 - $600, since this felt more like a $200 - $300 property, but I guess "location - location - location" <shrug>

Reviews.Title: “Once Again, THE BEST HOTEL IN ROMA”
Reviews.Author: RobertoKappa
Reviews.Content: Wow! I have stayed at this Hotel on at least 15 occasions and, quite frankly, it only gets better. The location is "A plus" perched right on the top of the Spanish Steps. Everything of Imperial Roma, Via Condotti and environs shopping and La Dolce Vita are all centered here. The staff is remarkably kind and the rooms are so very, very comfortable. The concierge staff is without equal, I truly believe. It is always so nice to come home to the DeLaVille . . . . . . . I know you'll agree that it would be the same as missing the Vatican as missing a stay in this charming, yet elegant, Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An unlucky stay.....”
Reviews.Author: Route6A
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews for this hotel, I hoped that we would find the stellar service some patrons experienced. Not so for us, unfortunately. During our one-night stay, the hotel was busy with cruise passengers from Oceana, so we were kept waiting nearly four hours for our room, most likely because so many Oceana passengers were checking out that morning. Admittedly, we had taken an overnight flight to Rome, but we did not expect to be kept waiting in the lobby for this length of time. No one escorted us to the lobby sitting area after we checked in as at the St. Regis Grand, and no one offered us refreshments while we were kept waiting. We were simply on our own....waiting and waiting..... The room we finally were given was extraordinarily small even by European standards. The bathroom was so tiny that the toilet paper kept falling onto the floor, because the holder was positioned right against the toilet. On the positive side, the mattresses were comfortable, the ventillation system was excellent, and the room was quiet. Linens were also of a very good quality. I had identified a restaurant we wanted to visit, so we approached the concierge to have him make a reservation for us and provide walking directions. He tried to persuade us to eat in the hotel restaurant rather than venture out. We insisted politely that we preferred our choice, and it was a good one as it turned out. Having visited Rome a number of times, I was surprised at the lack of hospitality at this hotel. Perhaps the manager was absent. On our next visit to Rome, we will return to the St. Regis Grand where outstanding service and warm hospitaliity are the norm..

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a price”
Reviews.Author: hgoldman77
Reviews.Content: Full service hotel close to the Spanish Steps; attentive staff, beautiful small rooms with great bathrooms, comfortable beds, good TV, great restaurant, roof top bar, great views, luxury genuine 4-star elegance. At 350 Euro minimum per night, not a great value, but the going rate for such hostelries. We stayed there on stored up Holiday Inn Priority Club points! The perfect place for us to end our trip and get a wake-up call and taxi to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: trippintoes
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is at the top of the Spanish Steps, and excellent location. The rooms are beautiful, spacious, and the staff is very helpful and friendly to American travelers. The hotel has a lovely rooftop bar overlooking Rome, it is a must visit for a cocktail. The duty manager recommended two wonderful local restaurants for us, and even called the restaurant to expect us. I will absolutely stay there on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: jrolls
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay here two nights pre-med cruise. However, our airline screwed us (thanks NWA!) and canceled our first flight. We ended up only staying one night. This hotel is so pretty and quaint! The service was outstanding. The bed was so comfy and the bathroom was beautiful. They supplied Frette linens and a very thick robe. Location cannot be beat. I am only sad I got just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaAustralia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for business on 27th September for one night only this time and we were very impressed as usual. We have stayed at the Intercontinental over 10 times before and gets better each time. We have stayed at other hotels in Rome and Intercontinental is the best by far. The rooms are spotless, the service is impeccable and the staff are amazing. Thank you Giacomo Pica for looking after us and your staff, Marco at reception, Pino at concierge and Nino and Mauro at breakfast. This hotel is also all about location, location, location. I will not stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Over the top on customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: MaryCoePhoto_Texas
Reviews.Content: Giacomo Pica, the Duty Manager, who has been with the hotel for over 30 yrs, is the most customer service oriented hotel employee I have ever encountered in my many travels. In fact the entire staff was very accommodating during our stay. This hotel is elegant, beautiful, and very comfortable. I would recommend to anyone visiting Roma for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have selected a better location at the top of the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: Robek00
Reviews.Content: Remember there is an elevator at the bottom of the Spanish Steps on the far left that takes you within feet of the InterContinental. The elevator was a godsend!

Reviews.Title: “very bad-ruined my vacation”
Reviews.Author: ygol
Reviews.Content: it is not 5 star hotel -deffenatly. we got our room after 2 hours waiting, we booked junior suite with terrace with rome view, but we got junior suite with court yard view.(you see windows of other rooms and a restoraunt ). the size of junior suite is like regular small double room in other hotels-very small. in our mini bar we found leftovers of cheese and salamy from the previous guests. on the terrace there were dirty glasses. there was bad smell of canalization from the bathroom.the staff was unhelpfull. we were very uppset. we will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice in Very Nice Area”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRinck
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms here here from Sept 24-27. We were able to get the rooms on the same floor and within a few rooms of each other which was nice. We booked the hotel based primarily on location and reputation and were very pleased with our choice. The rooms were smaller than we are used to in the United States but I believe that would be the case anywhere in Europe. The bed was two twins side by side and there was a desk, room safe, mini bar, and dresser. The bathroom was also a bit on the small side but the furnishings and paint were all in good condition. We went up to the rooftop bar which had a great view at sunset. The workout facility was limited but it was open 24 hours and it came in handy when I woke up at 2:45 AM the first night and could no longer sleep since I was still on CA time. We were given a check-in gift of apples and mineral water which was an unexpected surprise. We went to the concierge a few times and were given a good map and some helpful tips for exploring Rome. The location at the top of the Spanish Steps was just what we wanted. Even though after touring Rome on foot it was a little bit of a chore to climb all those steps at the end of the day, the location was safe and vibrant. We were able to walk to St. Peter's Square, the Pantheon, the Coliseum, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Novana, and basically anywhere else we wanted to go. We were very happy to be able to get anywhere we wanted on foot because it appeared from our drive to and from the airport that Rome is a pretty tough place to get around in by car. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A warm home like feeling .”
Reviews.Author: DubaiCap
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderful stay , Feel the personel care of the staff , specially the duty manager Who went out of his way to make our saty remarkabale .

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SKDavis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a month in Italy and out of 8 hotels, ranging in "stars"; 3,4, and this one 5, the InterContinental was a huge disappointment and a sorry way to end our trip. Had we not prepaid for our room through our travel agent we would have left for another hotel. Intead of being placed in a double room, as we had reserved, we were placed in a single room with an extra single bed pushed together to make a king. (room 213) There was only one headboard attached to the wall over one of the single beds which was pushed against the wall. (Try being the one next to the wall and getting in and out of bed.) The only drawers were 2 tiny ones in the closet, which was extremely small. The balcony had only one chair. The extra blanket for the bed was a single size. (It doesn't take a genius to figure out that this was a single room.) The lightbulb was burned out in the lamp on the desk and the shades were broken on both lamps. The bed linens were stained. We were 2 people with a month's worth of luggage each and no place to put even a carry on bag. We could not get into our wall safe without removing a lamp from the table because it was placed in front of the safe. We could not move in our room without stepping on or over luggage. Our balcony overlooked surrounding walls and kitchen where some sort of liquid was dumped onto the ground. There was no natural light and it felt like we were in a cave; not a very nice way to spend our last 4 days in Italy. When I complained at the front desk they said the hotel was full for the next 2 weeks and the only other rooms they had available were smaller single rooms; I can only imagine. The attitude was very non chalant and uncaring. He said he could take me around to see other rooms but it would be a waste of "his" time and mine. He also said I could call down everyday and check to see, if by chance, there was a cancellation or if someone left early. I think that is not my job. There seems to be no pride held by employess for their job or this hotel. Please check out pictures. After this experience I would never stay at another Internental hotel.

Reviews.Title: “bad service”
Reviews.Author: littleaussies
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location + is really nice to look at but from a service point of view was terrible. I wouldn't recommend anyone stay there. They more or less told us we where wrong when we complained about our clothes being thrown in the bidet during room service - even though we had a photo to prove it. After discussing our issue with the duty manager no-one came back to us. Very very very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Hotel - A Great Find In Rome - Great Management”
Reviews.Author: Amidiver
Reviews.Content: On top the Spanish Stairs, the Continental de Ville, was a great find. Management at all levels, including the General Manager were helpful and went out of their way to accommodate my wife and myself. Resturants, transportation, specialty needs, anything; They had the right recommendations. Their experience and knowledge added much to our Rome visit. The hotel reminded us of the more expensive boutique hotels of Europe, and at a lower cost. Warm, comfortable, and perfectly located in the center of the city. The roof-top bar with its magnificent view of the city was a great space to rest and cool down after a long walking day in the sun. We will stay there any time we can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: Bammer24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here free thanks to a Holiday Inn "stay two nights anywhere, get a free room anywhere" promotion ... Not too bad of a deal trading two nights at a Hotel Indigo in Atlanta for a free night in Rome ... We were staying at mid-range hotels on the rest of our trip through Europe and so were not expecting a 5-star experience here, which some others have complained about in their reviews. This hotel is located very close to the Spanish Steps Metro station, which makes traveling through the city very convenient. Also within easy walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, a bit further to the Pantheon but still not a bad walk. Of all the hotels we stayed at in Europe, this was the most "American," for better or worse. The towels were a little thicker, the bed a little more comfortable, plastic key cards rather than real keys, solid furniture, etc. Lacked a little 'charm' but certainly a solid, comfortable room, with a little balcony overlooking a courtyard. Only knock against this hotel is that once inside its doors, you could be anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “would choose another hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: colgalEnglewoodCo
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and no room was available-we had booked an advance-rate executive single bedded (king) room so we dropped our luggage and returned a few hours later. Our room was ready but when we walked in there were two beds pushed together and made up separately. We placed a call and within 5 minutes a maid was sent up with a king mattress pad and duvet. The bed looked deceptively comfy when it had its duvet on but the beds were very hard and probably need to be replaced. We were pleased with the courtyard location and small balcony-at least the room was shielded from the street noise. It was hot during our stay and the air conditioning worked very well. Somehow I question the hotel's 5 star rating- the bathroom had moldy caulking and maid service was only once per day. The hairdryer was barely functional and the internet service was sketchy. We also used the "instant service" button on the telephone and often got no answer. The rooms are decent in size but nothing special in their decor. The location at the top of the Spanish Steps was a mixed bag-lots of energy and great people-watching but exhausting to climb with a full stomach! I guess that at a rate of $500 per night (advance booking discount) I expected a bit more in the way of luxuries. It's also hard to justify a 35 euro pp charge for breakfast. My recommendation would be to try another hotel until they update the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Relay
Reviews.Content: This place needs a major overhaul and not just the bedrooms. We arrived to a very average welcome for a supposedly 5 star hotel and unfortunately "very average" just about describes everything to do with the Intercontinental de la Ville. Our room (supposedly an upgrade) had a tiny balcony overlooking the street below and a building site opposite. The decor was dated and worn. The aircon was essential as the noise outside made it impossible to leave the balcony doors open. The biggest problem we experienced however wasn't from noise outside but from inside the hotel, namely the roof terrace directly above our room. At 2 in the morning we were woken by (guests or staff ?) dragging furniture around. The noise came straight down into our room. The same happened on the second night. So a word of warning: if you are offered rooms 501, 502 or 503 DECLINE THEM IMMEDIATELY unless you want to spend the early hours of the morning wide awake. The hotel management must know of this problem and yet they do nothing to restrict access to the terrace or soundproof the bedrooms below. Service in the hotel is pretty awful. On the telephone in the bedroom there's an "Instant Service" button to press if you need anything. We pressed the button several times during our stay, firstly to ask for an iron and secondly to enquire about refreshments in our room. The phone either rang and rang with no answer or if someone did bother to answer it they made you feel like they were doing you an enormous favour. Less "Instant Service" more "Instant Attitide" I'm afraid. Totally unacceptable for a supposedly 5 star hotel. This place isn't cheap, 300 EUROS a night excluding breakfast (that's an additional 35 EUROS each) PLUS 10% tax. I'm sorry but this hotel just isn't up to scratch. If IHG expect to achieve these rates then they need to seriously overhaul the management of the place and not just its tired old rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A very expensive Pensione”
Reviews.Author: crdaus
Reviews.Content: This is another 4 star hotel masquerading as 5 star. Located in Via Sistina at the top of the Spanish steps adjacent to “The Hassler”, and no doubt bathing in the reflected glory of the latter, this is a very disappointing hotel. I was on an Amex Platinum package with supposed room upgrade, complimentary amenity, etc. Well, I wonder what ordinary customers get! For 350 euro per night, including breakfast, I expected a lot more. It is actually quite a small hotel, more like a glorified Pensione than a hotel. Yes, the courtyard café is a pleasant place to enjoy breakfast, and, yes, the breakfasts are generous (providing they are included in the tariff), but the rooms are pokey and old fashioned with noisy air-conditioning that seemed to circulate dust, a small window, and a tiny room safe in full view. The bathroom was nicely lined with travertine marble, but that is not saying much for Rome where even the footpaths (where there are any) are trimmed with travertine. But the narrow over bath shower facilities with plastic draw curtain are very last century. Also, the broken toilet paper holder remained broken for the 6 nights of my stay, indicating an indifferent attitude to maintenance. Despite this being Rome, I think the hotel needs to be completely overhauled if it wants to be a true 5 star hotel. Mind you the prices are 5 star (350 euro per day plus very pricey 23 euro per day for medium speed internet), but for the same money you could be residing on the Via Veneto, an infinitely preferable address to the narrow, noisy and dirty Via Sistina. I also found it quite annoying at checkout to find mini-bar charges and a 10% surcharge on the internet fee. These were promptly removed when I registered a protest. On the positive side, my room was overlooking the courtyard so it was quiet, and there is a tiny gym. Also, I enjoyed the amenity of a bottle of Lemoncello, but I had to skip most of the basket of inedible rock hard fruit and bottle of vinegar masquerading as red wine.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Intercontinental Ambassador Club--a sad, very sad, joke”
Reviews.Author: teatoo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Italy about twice a year--usually avoid the "chain" hotels but had sufficient points for a "free stay" through Intercontinental's Ambassador Club at the De La Ville in Rome. Prior to the trip, spent several hours ensuring that when we arrived all would run smoothly and my parents and I would not be charged for our 6 nights' stay. Final words from the Ambassador Club before departure: "trust" us, all is taken care of.... Arrived in Rome at the De La Ville--and the show (farce) commenced. ZERO awareness of any free nights and when I had the hotel call the Ambassador Club contact (who I was told prior to my leaving for Rome would be able to ensure all would run smoothly), was told she had NO recollection of any arrangements made through our contacts stateside. Mind you, we paid $300.00 for the pride and distinction of being Ambassador Club members. Finally, after several hours of phone calls, our arrangements were honored--this included my calling the Philippines (where Ambassador Club calls go after hours) to ensure emails would confirm what we were promised--all clean-up for that very special "trust us" service. Nice way to start the vacation--about 10 hours spent on the phone, worrying about what went wrong, and the all-time favorite, pacing the lobby. Finally, when I returned to the States, and asked for help with an explanation as to what happened, the finger pointing started. According to Ambassador Club, Rome didn't come through--pretty much the same logic suggested by the De La Ville about the folks stateside--at least they (especially the hotel manager) were polite about it and seemed to care. In short, I think they're both right--both parties came us short! Will say the folks at the De La Ville seemed at least interested in helping us--can't express the same sentiment about the old Club back home! Michael Massa, M.D.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never stay anywhere else in Rome”
Reviews.Author: shaytoon
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband; two girls age 4 and 6, our nanny and another family with two young children. I must first start off by saying that the location of this hotel is by far the best you can possibly have. Not only was the hotel impressively clean and well maintained, I was extremely impressed with the service and the quality of the food. But one thing that stands above all of for both of the families that went was the impeccable service we received from Mr. Pica the Hotel Manager. We had reserved four rooms and had asked for the rooms to be connecting or adjoining. Apparently out Travel agent had not put the request in and we were all spread out. Mr. Pica went over and beyond what we have seen to make our request happen. He truly made this visit to Rome and unforgettable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Excellent stafff”
Reviews.Author: MMHK
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the de la Ville. The location above the Spanish Steps is perfect for shopping and access to sites and restaurants. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable but the real appeal here is the service led by the excellent duty manager Giacomo Pica and the outstanding Concierge team.

Reviews.Title: “Location is so convenient”
Reviews.Author: Partickboy
Reviews.Content: 3 night stay here, took other posters advice and splurged on a more expensive room and was glad we did. 'Executive room with view of Rome' gives you exactly that, the terrace we had was bigger than the room itself and it was a real pleasure to sit out there enjoying breakfast, in the 30+ temperatures, with Rome set out before you. Room itself was certainly well kept but a little old and worn. Bed was comfortable but the bathroom was cramped and the bath itself would easily overflow. Service was professional but not overly friendly which is fine. Location was great, sitting pretty much atop the Spanish steps and the Spagna metro station, not that we used it much (though we did make use of the elevator up and down the steps). It was possible to walk pretty much anywhere, 20-25 mins west to the Colisseum and Forum and pretty much the same the other way to the Vatican City with plenty to see along the ways. We'd originally booked a two-night stay and only added a third late on at a cheaper rate when our travel plans changed. We were happy enough to change rooms but they let us stay in the Exec room which I thought was pretty generous. Overall great stay but then again it's in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: josdwils
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotwire for 125.00 USD a night. It was a great place to stay. We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel. I would have taken the Metro but after a transatlantic I just wanted to get to the room. I had never been to Rome before so I did the research and found the hotel is just at the top of the Spanish steps. You really walk out of the front door of the hotel and the steps are there. The metro stop is a short walk. You can catch it at the top or the bottom of the Spanish steps. The room was clean and average in size for any room in Europe. The service was great. I would stay here again and again. Feel free to email me if you have any questions at [--].

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: AlexRosell
Reviews.Content: My entire time at the De La Ville was awesome. There is not one thing I would improve. I had a huge room and a bathroom that was very big.
