I emailed the hotel to be picked up at the airport and I was greeted by the driver inside the airport. I was taken to the hotel in a brand new E class Mercedes Benz. The Concierge suggested awesome tours and great places to eat. He spoke english perfectly. The room was very nicely decorated and all the linens and such were very crisp. On my last day I asked the concierge to set up a car to take me to the airport. I asked for the driver to be at the hotel at 5 AM. The driver was there at 4:30...like everything else the service was perfect (and again it was a new Mercedes). I look at some of the other reviews and I wonder why so many people complained about the service or the size of the rooms. One thing to keep in mind is that this hotel is steps away from the Spanish steps in a very upscale area. If you are going to get the cheapest room or use rewards points...well of course you are going to get a small room with a bad view. My room was 595 euros per night...and of course I got a great room...dont expect to pay 200 euros per night and get a suite. You get what you pay for...and I feel I got the best of de la ville.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaWin_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from this hotel and are pleased to inform others of its fantastic location and its exceptional service. In particular, the duty manager Mr Giacomo Pica, went out of his way to make our stay there a wonderful experience. An example of this service was the day we were keen to see a sporting event on a foreign TV channel and he himself took us out into the streets to locate a venue. In this, he reflected the kind of service we were accustomed to in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - get ready to climb steps!”
Reviews.Author: Rye-NH-Travelers
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely, rooms well appointed, bed/pillows were very comfortable, very quiet. No complaints. At the end of a very long day walking miles around Rome, however, it was a little daunting to have to climb all those steps before crawling into bed! Loved being near the Spanish Steps! Convenient to Metro station. We used points to pay for the room so we were very happy. We wouldn't have paid the high price to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel excellent, staff indifferent”
Reviews.Author: ReadHere
Reviews.Content: Location perfect, as others have mentioned. The lobby, sitting rooms, and our room were all quite lovely. Breakfast buffet superb. Prices at the bar and at dinner are insane. 19 euro + 10% tax for a mixed drink? Dinner entres 30-40+ euro. Plenty of other bars and restaurants nearby, so you don't have to use the hotel for drinks or dinner. Air conditioning in the room was weak, even at the coldest setting. My only real complaint is that the staff completely ignore you. When I needed to ask the concierge or front desk something, they replied with the information, but nothing more. Never a 'hello' or 'good morning' from ANYONE who worked there, not even the doorman. What else does that guy in the tophat do, besides open the door and say hello, and yet I never saw him open the door or say hello to anyone. Why is everyone there such a sourpuss? I don't expect hotel staff to dance around me, but if I am standing in front of you as I walk in, and I am looking right at you, why can't you simply say 'good morning' or 'hello', in Italian or English? Internet there is very expensive (12 euro for 1 hour), and there are no internet cafes or free wifi places nearby, so you're stuck every time you need to check your e-mail. Complementary wifi, at least in the lobby, sure would have been nice. It's a nice hotel in a great location, competitively priced with the other fancy hotels up along that side of town above the Spanish Steps, but I just wish I'd have been made to feel more welcome. Maybe next time I'll try the Sofitel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: got2travel94
Reviews.Content: I'm fifteen years old and stayed here with my eighty year old grandmother this summer. The hotel was super clean and the staff was really helpful. The restaurant was okay (breakfast was really convenient), but otherwise the hotel was awesome. The location (at the top of the Spanish Steps) was perfect and the concierge was really, really helpful. All of the staff spoke Italian and English so there were no language barriers. We had a really great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Old school feel at the top of the Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: dawgfan1995
Reviews.Content: The De La Ville is well located right next to the much more expensive Hassler Hotel at the top of the Spanish Steps on Via Sistina. The hotel's location puts it reasonably close to most of the main attractions outside of the Vatican. The good: the location is excellent. For those able/willing to walk a mile or two, the entire Forum, the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore, and the Pantheon are within walking distance. The hotel has been named the same for a long time, so all the cab drivers know it and can get you there easily. The hotel restaurant had pretty good food as well in a pinch -- i.e., Christmas Day in Rome, for example. The whole staff speaks several languages, though expect to have to know Italian if you want to converse with the housekeeping staff. The mediocre: the room I had was a bit small, though my balcony and view -- see two of the photos I've attached -- were excellent. The food was horribly overpriced, especially their Christmas Eve and Christmas Day "specials." The bad: I asked for -- and paid for -- a king-sized bed. The best they could give me on the floor and with the view I paid for was what is shown -- two twin beds pushed together. TV fare was limited as well (for those times of winding down after the day's tours/walks) -- the English channels were CNN International, BBC International, and Sky News. All in all, this hotel was a very good -- though not excellent -- place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Say Enough About This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: twin123185
Reviews.Content: What can I say? This property is great. At the top of the Spanish Steps there is always something going on and the location is fabulous. Being an Ambassador member I made arrangements to have a car pick me up at the airport - only about 15 Euros more than a cab and worth evey penny being only in Rome for 3 days. Upon check in were upgraded to a courtyard view room with a balcony and large bed - the room had plenty of space, a bit of a rarity in Rome. We also received free breakfast and folks, this is the best breakfast buffet anywhere, spectacular food. The fresh mozzarella and ricotta cheeses were the best I have ever tasted. The AC worked spectacularly as it was very hot. The concierge - Christian - could not have been nicer and informative. By the way - leaving the hotel make a left and walk a bit to find the gelateria "Blue Ice" - fabulous. You are close to most tourist attractions here - nothing was more than a 15 minute cab ride and the Metro is also close by. This was my fourth Intercontinental stay in a capital city this year - this was the best property. My only complaint is that MOST of the front desk were a bit stand-offish and not personable and they want to charge you to print boarding passes. Just ask the concierge - one of them even gave the perverbial Italian salute to the front desk when I told him they wanted to charge me.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but would have rated the hotel 4-star, not 5.”
Reviews.Author: DJinNashville
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as part of a package Flight+Hotel. The main two reasons why we chose this hotel among many others in Rome were its rating and location. The hotel stands up to its rating: great location, comfortable room and welcoming staff. We had no problems with the hotel ammenities or room comfort during our stay--both met or surpassed our expectations. The only drawback that we experienced--a major one for this type of hotel, especially in a foreign country--was the Concierge staff which, on multiple occasions, were very courteous but not nearly as helpful as one might expect from a 5-star rating. The only other warning we would give to anyone thinking of staying at this hotel is a warning about the hotel bar and room service--both are very expensive, even by Rome standards. With simple cocktails like a gin and tonics costing 19 euros each (about $24) and hamburgers at around 15 euros (not including an up-charge of 10 euros for room service ordering), you may want to skip the terrace bar and in-room dining... Talking about dining, don't miss one of the restaurants where locals go: Matricianella (Via del Leone, 3, 00186 Roma‎ - [--]). About 10min walking from the hotel, think of booking a table before going!

Reviews.Title: “Ruined my trip”
Reviews.Author: RU21
Reviews.Content: The experience at this hotel was not a good one. We traveled for over 10 hrs and our rooms were not ready when we arrived. We had to wait another 2 hours to get a room. The beds were extremely uncomfortable. Bathrooms had bad odor. Tub was clogged and sink leaked water. Very old fashion, so it depends what you are into (modern or old fashion). The service was ok at times but the staff did not try to accomodate any of our needs. Too expensive for what they charged. Definitely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico, Great Location, Fabulous Customer Service, Luxurious Room”
Reviews.Author: FanofRome
Reviews.Content: As you venture to Rome, Italy, a chic city with fabulous history, architecture, fashion and people, I must recommend the Intercontinental De La Ville Roma. I return every year to Italy and finish my trip at this hotel. Why? The location, the price, the exquisite room and most importantly an amazing team of professionals who demonstrate kindness, knowledge of the area and charisma. After spending many nights in European hotels, this location offers a more luxurious room for the price and outstanding customer service. The price of the room is fabulous compared to the competition in the area. Other hotels can be double or triple the price. When you arrive, you see the magnificent view atop the Spanish steps ( the elite area of Rome). You will be greeted by a fabulous team (Ernesto, Nicola, Christian) who will recommend their favorite restaurants or plan your day. The duty manager, Giacoma Pica (my favorite), takes amazing pride in ensuring all of his guests are happy. He will work his magic ensuring you enjoy your stay. When you arrive in your room, you will be presented with classy Italian decor. Research the 11 different room types to meet your specific needs. Make sure you have breakfast on the terrace with the fountains and statues and I always finish my evening with a glass of wine listening to music on the rooftop overlooking the city of Rome. Need I say more, my favorite hotel in Europe. It always makes me sad to leave but I know I will always return to this hotel next year. Thank you Giacoma for making my stay a dream come true once again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: MelroseMA
Reviews.Content: After spending 3 weeks in a Villa in Le Marche it was nice to get to a hotel with air conditioning, and a king sized bed. The concierge was very helpful upon our arrival and suggested that we drop our Hertz car rental at a nearby location rather than trek to the airport. Very good advice, he easily saved us 4 hours on our first evening in Rome. I had later heard that the traffic toward the airport was a mess, and we'd have been right in the middle of it. The room was a bit small, but in Rome, hey, it was fine. The bathroom was nice. The breakfast buffet was very good, and I do also recommend that you get it included in your rate. The rooftop terrace was a nice place for drinks before dinner - good view, spoiled a little bit by a large crane.

Reviews.Title: “The most accommodating hotel i've been in while in europel!”
Reviews.Author: toomuchkash
Reviews.Content: When i checked in there was a mistake made by my AMERICAN EXPRESS Centurian travel counselor regarding my rooms here.The hotel manager(MR. PICA) over heard me getting frustrated with the lady checking me in and took the initiative to take me to the side calm me down. Then he worked out everything to accommadate us all!!.He is responsible for making our last 3 days in italy a great experience, wrapping up a 15 day trip throughout europe with my wife christine and 3 daughters.hayley17,alexa15,nicolette12!!thanks again MR PICA..I WILL RECOMEND YOUR LOVELY HOTEL TO EVERY I KNOW TRAVELING TO ROME.IF U ARE PLANNING ON VISITING ROME THIS IS THE PLACE TO STAY..WALKING DISTANCE TO EVERYTHING.U WONT BE LET DOWN STAYING HERE!!view from the penthouse is breathtaking!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Happy Traveling TODD BLATT

Reviews.Title: “classy and sophistocated... perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: travels356
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable experiance. First class all the way! A bit pricey but well worth it. Its located at the top of the Spanish Steps and a short walk away from some of the best shopping in the world! Will definitley return to this hotel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Rome ... great location, great service, great rooms ...”
Reviews.Author: roomservice123
Reviews.Content: I have been putting this review off because I have so much to say about how wonderful the InterContinental de la Ville was for me and my family. Lets starts with the location. The De La Ville is at the top of the Spanish Steps. It is in the heart of the city and staying here will make your life so much easier in Rome. Via Condotti with the world reknown shopping is a minute away, you can walk to Trevi Fountain or dine at any number of great restaurants that are yours for the choosing. And if you don not feel like going out to eat or miss the shops the hotel restaurant is delicious and the boutique downstairs has it all and does it all ... Femme Sistina the boutique has one-of-kind gifts, clothes, accessories and a signature perfume that I feel in love with immediately! (Love at first whiff) Plus Femme Sistina has a full service salon where you can wax, get a great blow dry or pedi-manicure that you didn´t have time to do before leaving on your vacation. The salon also boasts whos who clientele dating back from when Audry Hepburn to Nicole Kidman! They have stayed very current and are experts. But you will not find attitude here. The owner is so gracious and her staff lovely. The service for InterContinental de la Ville is superior to other hotels. I have stayed at many 5 and 4 star hotels, but they cannot compete with InterContinental de la Ville´s service. My family felt like royalty. The staff knows your name and waiters remember the little things you like about your meals. No request or problem goes unsolved. The staff is always happy to direct you and fulfill every need. Warm and generous. Reception and staff are also fluent in multiple languages so there is never a difficulty there. Good sevice is often hard to find across the board at one hotel ... yet from the maid service to reception and I can easily say this is the best service I have had in a hotel in the US or abroad. The rooms are very comfortable and have a first class decor and style. The bed and sheets are extremely comfortable and luxurious which after a long day of sight seeing and walking on cobblestoned Roman streets is a welcomed relief! Spacious and quiet. I love the window blinds the electronically operate on the exterior of your window being certain to block out any unwanted light in the morning. The Italian decor and furniture is rich too, but muted and practical too to make your stay relaxing. One of the highlights is the fantastically delicious brunch they have available every morning. The selection is very diverse, delicious and provides abundant health conscious options. Numerous fruits, egg prepartion options, breads, cereals, juices, and beverages (lattes prepared to order -- I had my decaf latte witrh no problem) cakes, crepes, meats, cheese, even champagne! And many healty substitues such as rice milk ... the only one I have found offered at breakfast and I have been to three European countries this summer. My list of the men simple does not do it justice. The common areas of the hotel, lobby, dining room, sitting areas, business center and rooftop longe with an incredible view of the city are all gorgeous and comfortable. A combination that had me looking forward to returning back to our hotel each night. As for the cost. Your euros stretch very far for the accomodations themselves, unbeatable location, they-thought-of-everything-amenities and excellent service. I will not be staying anywhere else in Rome ... ever!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed results here”
Reviews.Author: DaveDTheWoodlands_TX
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through price line. We got a decent value. The service was spotty. The doorman at our arrival could not have been more helpful (we drove in from Tuscany). The first concierge was helpful, but there were other concierges that were downright crabby and not helpful. We did tip them several times for their services, but it didn't seem to matter. Again, some were very nice and helpful and others not. It's kind of a management issue they should be aware of. The hotel is in a superior location at the top of the Spanish steps (although at times, like the end of the day, I wish it were at the BOTTOM of the 132 steps! :) ). Our rooms were comfortable, but not large. The upkeep of the hotel ws a little below our standards (the paint was peeling in our bathroom, the shower head/handle didn't match the "holder" and it actually fell off and bopped me in the head (and they are heavy!). The soap was about the smallest bar soap I've seen in a hotel just an example of kind of scant ammenities). Somebody in the elevator actually was complaining to his wife that the ammenities were really poor). No breakfast included and the restaurant we found to be expensive even by hotel standards. I was neutral on the hotel until the doorman yelled at our teenage daughter about moving our car while we were checking out. He was downright rude. So I'd suggest looking elswhere. There was enough wrong here that you could probably find a better value elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: aztravelsnob
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is top notch. Upon arrival we received a room on the 6th floor which was a little small bit very pretty. This floor is the one you want to be on. There is an amazing terrace overlooking rome that you can have some drinks and just look at the view! My husband enjpoyed the terrace all alone in the monings doing some early morning work on his laptop which he loved. The location is amazing right by the spanish steps cant get any better. The hotel staff was fantastic, always recommended a great restaurant and always ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: a5ecretagenda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few weeks ago, expecting a great deal as it's a 5 star hotel. Unfortunately it totally failed to live up to the hype. Our room (standard) was fairly small, and was no nicer than say a Travel Inn/Travel Lodge etc in the UK. The only 'wow' factor was a (VERY) small balcony out of the front where you could look out on the (VERY) busy street with a reasonable view of the Spanish Steps further along. There were no tea or coffee facilities or anything. We couldn't afford to enjoy the rooftop terrace (approx 20 Euros for a cocktail), nor the breakfast (A frankly outrageous 7 Euros for cornflakes!). The hotel itself was clean, and reasonably nice, and some of the staff were very helpful, while others were fairly unfriendly. In summary, the hotel is in a great location but if, like us, you are travelling on a budget and got a room through discounts/promotions etc, it is a real waste of time as the only luxuries (bar terrace/biggest rooms/meals) that the hotel provides come at a heavy price.

Reviews.Title: “Overrate hotel-definitely not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: tripman77
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at de la Ville from May 28 -June 2nd. We paid about $250.00/night for the hotel room (employee f&f discount applied). This hotel claims to be a five star unfortunately it has fallen short of being one. The location is ok being AT THE TOP of the spanish steps. Very ideal if you like to climb about 230 steps after dinner every night. The lobby and reception area is acceptable. It resembles more like a 3 star small sheraton lobby. The most disappointing aspect are the rooms itself. We stayed in a double room. The queen bed was extremely small. There were cracks on the walls. The room itself was tiny. We felt like we were sleeping in side a small cell. The bathroom was decent size but again we noticed a lot of wear and tear on the walls.I would have been extremely disappointed if we had to pay more than 400/night for this type of room.Concierge was nice and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff, Great location if you are physically fit...”
Reviews.Author: Lvv2trvl
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed so warmly at this place by the hotel bellman and staff. The hotel manager on duty gave me his business card, and took the time to recommend a fabulous restaurant just down the street (not down the steps) called Ciampini's (pronounced Champeenees). Which is a quaint, open air, beautiful restaurant, that overlooks Rome. Highly recommend a wonderful meal here. The hotel lobby decor at first impression comes across very gawdy. Old deep red drapes along the windows, antique furniture throughout. Was not overly impressed at first sight. But once we got to our room, we found it comfortable, stylish, and the bathroom was beautiful with different colored marbles, very clean, and was very satisfied with it all. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the very small courtyard. It was relaxing to sit out there with the complimentary champagne that they had delivered to the room. Then you go to the 2nd level to the lovely, but very pricey bar and restaurant. On the top floor (6th), they have an open air balcony with views of all of Rome. Went up there on the Sat. evening and they had live entertainment, linens on all the small round tables, and waiters waiting to pour you a glass of wine. It was so utterly romantic, took my breath away. The service at this place is just wonderful, hands down. The only criticisms are that there is not a lot of cafes immediately around the hotel. All the action and dining is down below at the base of the Spanish steps. And after the 4th or 5th time climbing up and down those steps to get to the hotel, I am sure some people would start complaining. For us, we are relatively fit, so if it was tough for us, I know it would be tough for others, maybe the elderly especially. We did hear there was an elevator, but never found it. Top attractions for us were the Roman Forum and Colloseum. Palatine Hills is so huge and extensive, wear good walking shoes if you decide to cover it all. To save money and aggravation, be sure to go to Ricksteves.com before you leave for your trip and download for free on your MP3 his audioguide of the Colloseum and Forum. Also avoid the massive long lines to get in to the Colloseum and prebook your tix on line. Get the Rick Steves book on Rome for invaluable information on how to prebook the Colloseum, Borghese Galleria (must be prebooked ahead of time), and definitely book a tour for the Vatican, expect to do a lot of walking. Make sure to get to the Forum, it was even the highlight over the Colloseum for us. To see the ancient Roman Pagan temples still standing with their huge pillars 3 thousand years old, totally awe inspiring. Make sure you research and learn about the history before you go to these places to really appreciate what you are looking at. Another must see is the St. Peter's Basilica in the Vatican City. Blew me away the enormity of this place. The Sistine Chapel actually didn't meet expectation. There is so much hype, but it is very dark in there so it was actually difficult to see the ceiling, and what you see leading up to it are much more stunning. Rome in general exceeded all expectation at how very clean, safe and beautiful it is. I have been to about 8 European countries, and this one so far is the most American-friendly I've found, has the best food hands down, cleanest, safest, and the history here is so overwhelming. This is where Western civilization started. The concept of our U.S. houses of congress is mirrored after the ancient republic of Rome, the architecture of the White House in D.C. was inspired by the Roman Pantheon. We owe a lot to Rome, just overall an incredible destination.

Reviews.Title: “Romance in Rome”
Reviews.Author: loukim
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was the best part of our trip to Italy. Great staff,, room and service. The hotel proved a beautiful bottle of wine and a fruit tray that was oustanding. The breakfast was the highlight with everything one could wish for from eggs to fine Italian meats and much, much more. Worth every dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay-”
Reviews.Author: winelover1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Intercontinental de la Ville with my mom for 3-nights in Rome. This was a fabulous place. From the moment we stepped out of our car. We were immediately welcomed and assisted with our luggage. Check in was easy and they upgraded us to a Terrace room along with allowing us immediate access to our room at 10am. This was my first trip to Europe and I had tried to lower my expectation of the 5-star hotel. However to my surprise the room and bath were nice size and well maintained. We opted for the included breakfast which was a great value. This included full breakfast in the dining area or on the patio adjacent to the dining room. Included juices, fruit, breads, waffles, yogurt, granola, cereal, cheeses, eggs, meats and drink of your choice including champagne. Service was excellent- Concierge was always very helpful- map and directions to several locations, also helped us check in and print boarding passes for flight home. Lady who cleaned our room was great and supper friendly. We did leave her a couple EU each day :-) They also have a bar upstairs which overlooks Rome. We enjoyed a late cocktail one evening here and it was a beautiful view of the city and nice way to wrap up our evening. I would highly recommend this hotel and look forward to staying here again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but NOT five stars”
Reviews.Author: beans802
Reviews.Content: Just to preface: I'm not someone who loves to complain when coming home from a trip about how my carpet didn't get vacuumed twice a day. I'm generally pretty happy with the places I stay and have learned what to expect from hotels in general. That said, I was particularly excited about staying at this hotel because it seemed like it was going to be a really posh experience. Not so. In fact, our two-person room was one of the smallest I've ever stayed in. It had virtually no frills, no particularly good view of anything, and a shower so narrow that the curtain would cling to you as you bathed. Yes, it is true, the service was fantastic. Everyone was nice and wonderful. But there is just nothing 'swank' about this hotel at all. The common areas seem like they could be fun and enjoyable, but I never once saw another guest lounging in the piano room and I don't think they even had a bartender available to serve drinks. Overall, I have nothing to say about moldy sheets, or leaking roofs, or how the maids stole everything we own. Nothing like that at all. The place was just a big, big let down for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... Should be 2-3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: josprego
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights in April. Having checked out of the Westin in Florence, this hotel was a big disappointment. The staff was not as helpful. The front desk initially upgraded us to a larger room facing Via Sistina; however, the room was smelly, the mattress was old and uncomfortable, and not what we expected. The room was quite noisy since it was facing Via Sistina. The location is right above the Spanish steps and the Metro, which made it convenient to get to and from the Termini and Vatican. If you like shopping, this is an ideal location for you; however, I would rather me closer to Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. One more positive is that everything is within walking distance from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Comfort and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HudsoBurrito
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located 20 yards from the top of the Spanish Steps. The Metro stop is right there too so it is great for getting all over the city fast. Even has elevator to get down the steps with luggage. The hotel rooms are (Rm 123) are comfortable and nicely furnished by EU standards. The bed and bedding were AWESOME and my wife loved the bigger the normal bathroom we had. The windows were also double paned so that cut down on a lot of noise. The room wasn't the biggest, but out of all three hotels we stayed at in Rome this was the BEST by far. The is a great inner courtyard too with Bar and Dining that you should try.

Reviews.Title: “This is the BEST hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Cleopatra561
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel, in a historic palace, at the top of the Spanish Steps, is without a doubt one of the true gems of Rome. Having stayed there many years, it is such a comfort to return to the wonderful staff and ambience of this magnificent hotel. For value, location, and luxury, this should be your choice. We will ALWAYS return to the InterContinental de la Ville!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but hotel desperately needs to be renovated”
Reviews.Author: SB777WashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of InterContinental hotels, with some being better than others. The De La Ville was somewhat disappointing. I was aware that five star hotels in Rome do not compare to five star hotels in London and New York, but this hotel badly needs some renovations. While the hotel was not bad, it was not great either. The room and bathroom were decent sizes and very clean, but the room needed a fresh coat of paint and some new furnishings (including a more comfortable bed). The whole hotel seemed a little run down – especially for a five star hotel. To be fair, we did have a balcony with our room and it was very quiet at night. Also, the location was great. We were right at the top of the Spanish steps and we could walk to everything – even the Colosseum and Trastevere (although it was a bit of a hike). But beware - although it was great being at the top of the Spanish Steps, we had to walk up those 136 steps every time we went back to our hotel (apparently there is an elevator that can take you to the top, but I found that out after the trip was over!). Overall, the hotel was not bad, but I feel like there has to be something better in Rome, especially for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location and service”
Reviews.Author: hfl982
Reviews.Content: I echo many of the reviews - Mr. Pica especially, along with the rest of his staff, goes above and beyond to guarantee the best possible stay. The little touches go a long way! Location is unbeatable at top of Spanish Steps. Definitely a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Bad luck of the draw?”
Reviews.Author: James2506
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second leg of our honeymoon from 10-14 April 2009. We were given a complimentary room upgrade, bottle of Spumante and Easter cake - which got the stay off to a great start! Have stayed at an Intercontinental before (Tokyo in 2003) so was pleased to see the nice little touches remained (robe, slippers, great bathroom toiletries for free of charge). Perhaps the best addition about the Rome hotel was the concierge who was able to get us tickets to the Easter service at the Vatican with only 12 hours notice. Room 619 was comfortable enough and had a balcony overlooking the central courtyard. It was cramped though for walking around (less than 1 foot of space on two sides of the bed, and 2 feet on the third side). It was also very dusty, running fingers along surfaces produced big clumps of white dust. The dust was not taken care of by the daily room cleaning and we had to complain. The air conditioning unit was embedded into the wall and had no effect at either heating or cooling the room. It only increased the dust issue, pumping out dust from the dirty vent and shaft behind the vent. The sink in the bathroom was cracked and the glue used to reseal it was peeling off. The bathroom door was chipped and dented at the bottom, not what you would expect from a supposedly top 5* hotel. After complaining we were offered a new similar room. We had requested a double bed but it was actually two singles held together by the sheets. I know this is increasingly common in hotels now but not what you want on your honeymoon or at such a top and expensive hotel. Our two biggest problems were the pricing of breakfast and amenities and the courtyard music. A simple continental breakfast, inlcuding juice, coffee a croissant, some bread and jam for one person was €24. A movie in the room was €18. Ridiculous! The courtyard was charming, plenty of plants, a fountain, elegant talbes, chairs and umbrellas for the sun, but come 12 noon they put on the music. OK, I am a bit of a music nut, but surely no one can want to listen to Stevie Wonder's "I just called" or the Bond theme "Live and Let die" played out on wind pipes 20 times in one day! It was one of those CD compilations which is covers of well known songs, it consisted of only 12 songs and was put on repeat EVERY SINGLE DAY ALL DAY. When I called the concierge on the third day he actually laughed when I told him because the music drove all the staff crazy too! They switched if off and we had silence for the rest of the stay. How a hotel brand as international and prestigious as the intercontinental can think that this is appropriate music for their central Rome hotel is beyond me. The hotel is also being refurbished so the lounge passed through to the lifts for the rooms is boarded up and you have to walk through a small make shift corridor. Ignore the photos of this lobby lounge on any website at the moment (April 2009) as this is not what you currently get! This was not such a big deal (we never use the lobbies anyway) and the hotel were very apologetic. However this is not mentioned on their or Hotwire's (we used them to book) website and the hotel were unable to give any indication of a finish date. Also be aware that the hotel across the road is being completely refurbished and is covered in scaffolding and has three cranes outside. I would avoid a room on that side of the hotel if possible and the view from the roof terrace bar is compromised. We paid over £700 for four nights here using Hotwire (a discount of almost £300 on the current rates) but even this is overpriced for what we consider no more than an average stay. You are paying for the brand and the location but are better off elseshere in our view.

Reviews.Title: “above and beyond any expectaions”
Reviews.Author: revit
Reviews.Content: Surely you’ve heard many stories about Rome and it’s fine hotels. But InterContinental De La Ville Hotel is a totally new story. The hotel is great and as world travelers we experienced one of the finest, professional and friendliest stuff we ever met. Unfortunately we encountered a problem on this trip to Italy, but the stuff immediately came to aid us in their best way, guided by the Duty Manager Mr. Giacomo Pica. Mr. Pica personally helped us to feel home in distressing health situation and turned our vacation to one of the finest we had. If you’re in for terrific stay in Rome look no further, this is the only place to be. We want to thank you again Mr. Giacomo and to the wonderful staff at your lead in the De la Ville! The Shachars

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Slight Faded Glory”
Reviews.Author: HoveGraham
Reviews.Content: Booked this through Lastminute.com as a ‘Top Secret Hotel’ so probably got what we paid for (35% discount!) which was a single room converted to a double. However it was clean, the bathroom was big and the bed was comfortable. But then who spends time in their hotel room in this city? The hotel is only 30 yards from the top of the Spanish Steps and is so convenient for all things. The restaurant was good and the bar on the second floor was manned by the funniest and friendliest barman I have ever met. Generally all the staff were nice. The rooftop bar was not open yet, despite the warm weather, which was a bit of a shame as it has fantastic views. Although it is not a cheap hotel and the bar prices were set accordingly – we found it no more expensive than many of the other places we drank in. (Beware Rome is the most expensive city I have ever been to – especially with the pound weak against the Euro!) £18 for a large glass of wine and £16 for a Belini! All round it was an excellent venue for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “BEST OF THE BEST! !”
Reviews.Author: Mau090
Reviews.Content: Absolute best service ever experienced! ! Got food poisoning from a local bar and had to go to the hospital. Concierge stayed with us at the hospital to make us feel at ease. Hotel Manager Giacomo super helpful.. Visited us every day and made arrangements for extended stay. We felt the hotel staff went above and beyond any expectaions to help in this situation. (Not to mention this hotel in in a great location.) We were very lucky to have stayed in this hotel. Dont bother looking anywhere else, this is definitely THE place to stay in Rome. Thank you to Giacomo and the wonderful staff at the De la Ville! !

Reviews.Title: “Great personal attention”
Reviews.Author: gourmetrockland
Reviews.Content: The intercontinental is small, but clean. The personal attention and attention to details were terrific. The hotel, while small, was plush. Service couldn't have been better. Good value and AWESOME location at the top of the Spanish Steps. Very romantic, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but very bad attitude from some of the staff”
Reviews.Author: Rossi47
Reviews.Content: A great location for anyone wishing to visit Rome especially on a leisure trip. I have stayed at several InterContinental Hotels but this definetely does not come up to the typical IC expectations. The room (Executive Room with Balcony) was very small for 400 EUR/night plus it was not perfectly clean. Small details that make the difference. Dont imagine that this is a dirty hotel. Its just old and not completely clean by the houskeeping. The breakfast room was very very good & the staff there very kind. All the other staff, especially when it came to the concierge & reception were not helpful at all. The Instant Service, Room Service, Reception & Concierge lines were not answering most of the times plus the Room service was taking ages to deliver to the room. Overall: Great location, safe place, unhelpful staff at concierge & reception, small rooms, not so clean & definetely not 5-star Intercontinental standard.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: where2nxtmac
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at the Intercontinental de la ville last week. The stay was great! Gilles was the most amazing going out of his was to make sure we could stay on the same floor and near each other! He also recommended a great restaurant and Rome points of interest that we shouldn't miss. He made our stay wonderful. The buffet breakfast was amazing, included with our room. We were all very pleased with the selection, variety, and wonderful flavors of the buffet. The service was also very nice and gracious. The hotel was in an excellent location, service was fantastic and our room and breakfast was a wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: “Incedible experience”
Reviews.Author: eduglion
Reviews.Content: We were about 70 people of the family staying in this wonderful property located in the centrum of the city and the staff took a great care about us. As student in hotel management I can say that this hotel is very well managed and the cusomer satisfaction is perfectly achieved. I would definetly go back to the intercontinental hotel de la ville. My congratulations to the staff! Eduardo Van Gucht

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: WoodieBelfast
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights and found this to be a good base for a city break. The hotel is very central and easy to return to during the day for a short break from sight seeing etc. Anyone with difficulties on steps should beware as the most convenient route to the hotel from the main tourist areas is to climb the Spainish Steps. We had breakfast every morning either outside in the courtyard or in the restaurant and found it to be excellent and good value when compared with other prices in the area. Our room over looked a small courtyard which meant that the room was very quiet at night and we found the beds to be very comfortable. Our room was a reasonable size as was the bathroom. We would certainly stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend it to others. The only reason we would not give this a five star rating is that the hotel was a little too traditional in style and in the services it provides and lacked that special something which makes a hotel stay an event in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jeswick
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a wonderful trip to Rome and could not be more pleased with the InterContinental de la Ville Hotel. The location was fabulous, as other travelers have mentioned. Our room was very comfortable and relatively roomy for a European Hotel. The beds were also very comfortable and we had no complaints with the bathroom facilites. The staff could not have been more helpful - the concierge desk, particularly Christian and Nicola were fantastic - both were warm, friendly, and extremely helpful with directions and recommendations! The hotel manager was very visable and made it a point to chat with us and offer his assistance. We would both highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with disappointing view on construction site”
Reviews.Author: BigSky91
Reviews.Content: Personnel and service was first class, but the room was not so great and the view was disappointing. Considering that the hotel was far from full and we are ICH members, we felt that they could have done better. We paid 95 euros more for a third bed for our son (breakfast excluded). Of the three hotels during out trip, this was the worst extra bed, small enough that his feet hung over the end. He is 5'9", not a giant. When I asked, they said that if you want more, get another room. Why were they longer in other hotels, some at a lower level? Also, beware of high-speed internet at 23 euros/day!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: youngturk77
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is its location however, everything within a 10-20 minute walk is not real Rome and the area is incredibly expensive. The hotel lacks in everything from ambience to facilities, almost as if it were about to go bust. Breakfast wasn'ty included in our package and we soon found out why. We had to rush one morning for a tour and decided to eat in the hotel. After two slices of toast and tea each, we were charged 48 euros for breakfast. I wouldn't mind if it was something special, at least you get what you pay for in Dubai but this place is a complete rip off for an average standard hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jaq121897
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our Roman Honeymoon. After a week-long stay at de la Ville, we only have good things to say. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, the staff was very friendly, welcoming and helpful. The staff at the Front Desk was very attentive and was always very friendly and accommodating. The Concierge staff was very knowledgeable about Rome as well as its neighboring cities. They assisted us with recommendations and reservations for museums and restaurants in Rome as well as for our day trips to Florence and Naples. The Duty Manager was also very friendly and pleasant to speak with. We often saw him at the front desk or in the lobby interacting with the guests. He went above and beyond his duties to be sure our stay was pleasant and enjoyable. Something we don’t often see from those in management positions. The location was great, just a few minutes walk to the metro station and right at the top of the Spanish steps. We would recommend this hotel to all our friends and family traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but disappointing overall”
Reviews.Author: HockeyFan6
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location at the top of the Spanish Steps is fantastic, and is convenient to walking around Rome (not for the easily winded, though). However, we found the staff to be the least accomodating of all of our hotels during our Italian vacation - a bit stuffy and put out when requests were made. The roofop lounge had plenty of potential, but was boring and extremely expensive - and again, no feeling of personal welcome...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, few niggles”
Reviews.Author: Megamoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and couldnt believe how well placed this location is. The hotel overall is good, though there are a few anomalies (but isnt there always!) which as a previous a reviewer stated left us feeling a bit underwhelmed. Would recommend, though minimize your time in the hotel and get out and enjoy Rome. The reception staff were cold in their service and we felt the concierge wasnt particularly helpful (one example - recommended a restaurant which was difficult to find and required a reservation in advance (this was a Monday in low season!) - would of been nice if he had arranged this or warned us). The rooms are pleasant and functional, however the bathroom is tiny on the point of being uncomfortable (the previous reviewers point about the shower curtain is spot on!). The safe is in an interesting position and requires moving furniture in order to access. Finally, dont eat at the hotel bar unless you like cold, badly cooked and overpriced food served by a grumpy waiter (if you can find him!). Overall, minor issues and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: 2aspen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights 14th Feb 2009. Reception staff very polite and helpful. Room nice, not big but didnt expect so for italy. Small balcony, good size bathroom. Very expensive mini bar e.g. travel plug £6! Dont expect to pay for the use of this. Cocktails £16 each, breakfast £29. Location is excellent - literally at the top of the spanish steps. 3 mins walk from the metro which is easy to use. 1 euro takes you anywhere. Used taxi to restaurant near colesseum 15 euros - 15 min drive. Concierge very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lesm1
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasant hotel. The staff was friendly and responsive. We had an issue with our safe (we couldn't get it open), and the front desk attendant was up in our room within 10 minutes to help us fix the problem. Rooms were spacious for Rome standards. The bath was nicely appointed. I think the courtyard view that we had made a big difference. It might be a bit noisy if you were instead facing Via Sistina. The hotel is very centrally located. THe only reason I gave location a 4 is because you basically have to climb the spanish steps every time you return to the hotel. There are a few ways around this, but the steps are by far the most convient way to return to the hotel. The breakfast buffet, although a bit pricy, was very nice. And the restaurant staff was very pleasant. The concierge staff was great for making reservations, helping with directions, and booking our train tickets. Overall, a very good stay. If in Rome again, I would stay at the hotel again, and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: corky_c
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 6 nights at this hotel during a trip to Rome in December. I have mixed feelings about this hotel. First, the good things: The hotel is located at the top of the Spanish Steps, so it's an excellent location as you pretty much walk to most areas of Rome from here. The concierge was friendly and helpful and helped us book tours. Housekeeping was very nice and friendly with our requests (ie. electric kettle). The buffet breakfast was great. The room we stayed in was on the small side but very clean. Things I wasn't happy about: Ridiculously expensive internet fees - in this day and age, internet should come free with rooms, as it was with other hotels we stayed at. In some parts of the hotel (hallways, lobby downstairs), the decor is quite old. I know it's supposed to look old fashioned, but paint was peeling in some places and carpet coming undone. As one of the reviews below mentioned, the toilet is set up really weird whereby the toilet paper holder sticks out near the toilet so that your leg gets squashed to the toilet paper holder. Also, as another reviewer mentioned, the shower curtain sticks to you when you're using the shower. The shower curtains were very clean, but still it's annoying! Overall I think this hotel is good. I just don't think it's worth the money we paid, especially compared to other 4 and 5 star hotels we stayed at in other cities (Barcelona, Venice and Florence) during this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Bella Roma delaVille”
Reviews.Author: NY1114
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a shopping trip in Italy and stayed at the Intercontinental delaVille Hotel in Rome. The hotel is located at the top of the Spanish Steps so it couldn't be a better location.The hotel was absolutely beautiful and the service provided by the staff was beyond anything I had ever experienced. The Front desk staff offered to show us rooms to make sure they would be to our liking and the Concierge services were outstanding. They obtained our train tickets to Florence and made all of our dinner reservations with pleasure!! Every one of their suggestions was perfect and when we asked about visiting the outlets they even went so far as to get us the bus schedule. All of the concierges: Nicola, Pino Filipe and Christian were fabulous. Our rooms were on the interior of the hotel overlooking the courtyard and one of our party had a huge terrace (4th floor) and they were so comfortable. Although the cost was over 200 euros it was worth it because of the location. We were able to walk everywhere or take the Metro which was at the bottom of the Spanish Steps. This was the best hotel ever and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Rome”
Reviews.Author: msweeks
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at the Intercontinental for a week over the Christmas period. Although we had an upgraded room (with access to garden), we did view a smaller room and it was quite sufficient for anyone. The staff was exceptionally helpful, accomodating, kind and professional. I travel extensively for business and pleasure, and have Ambassador status with Intercontinental, and this was definately one of the hotels with better overall service and location.The management team also went out of their way to make our vacation more pleasant. The property is nice and is in an excellent location. We walked everywhere, as it is reasonable to do so from here...everything is basically within 20 mins. I think we took a taxi 3 x's over the week. Hotel is located right by the Spanish Steps and the "Rodeo Drive" equivalent in Rome. There are many other boutiques and shopping in the area that are also more affordable, if you are not looking for your next Gucci purse. Train station is within 10-12 mins of the hotel. We did not dine at the hotel except for the Christmas buffet (which was really outstanding....many choices, fresh food and stocked), so can't comment on the hotel restaurants food. My only suggestion is that I would not place too much weight on the concierge advice on restaurants. You'd probably do just as well, if not better, to do your own research and selection for restaurants. They were extremely helpful in all other respects, and did make a few good recommendations for restaurants. Salon and massages were available as well (attached to the hotel). Salon (hair) service was great but the massage was mediocre for the price. There are several other "spas" in the area as well, but we did not visit them. A couple of doors down (opposite direction of the Spanish Steps, left outside of the hotel) is a little bar that is great for grabbing esspressos and pastries. Internet: typical of the Interncontinental properties and most European properties, they charge quite a bit (I believe we paid around 20 Euros for a day). Gym: awesome little gym on the premises. You won't need to go elsewhere. I would definately return to this hotel on my next trip to Rome. Although it is more expensive than others in the area, for business or vacation, it is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Robert-J01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a short trip (4 days) to Rome for a friend’s wedding. We had stayed at the De La Ville once before and felt very happy with our choice to return. We have also stayed at a lot of Intercontinental branded hotels around the world and have more often than not found them first rate. I suspect part of why we stayed at the Intercontinental de la Ville is the brand and an implied level of reliability and accountability if something goes wrong. I would be delighted to be able to put my foot on the nice little once off boutique hotels but that is often a bit hard when in a rush. Mind you this site helps. We think the best thing about the hotel is the service of the staff. They try very hard on all fronts – directions, suggestions, shops, services etc etc. We arrived on a very early flight from Sydney and they provided us a temporary room to get some much needed rest while we were waiting for our room to become available. They did not charge us for this and that was greatly appreciated. We don’t expect too much in terms of the physical property as, like most places in Rome, it is old and the layout of the whole hotel may not be quite what you would expect for a five star hotel (ie a few nooks and crannies). But the main point is that the rooms are comfortable, well maintained and clean and fresh and just what you need. Not too small either. We had one on the 4th floor looking at an internal courtyard with a nice balcony. Pretty but nothing spectacular. last time we had a room without a balcony looking out over via Sistina and that was a bit more exciting. Breakfast was a buffet (included in room rate) and the service was always good and the food was also delightful. We didn’t want to do too much other than a bit of sightseeing, off to the wedding and a few nice dinners. In terms of sightseeing the concierge offered a few great suggestions for different places to see. Not really off the beaten path but things we had not seen. The restaurant suggestions were delightful, nothing over the top, just nice experiences. We wanted to rent a scooter and the concierge suggested a place just around the corner. The scooter was great, a great way to see Rome very easily, getting lost and going up streets the wrong way is pretty safe and virtually all of the time the traffic is so slow it is not intimidating or hard. The location is quite superb, particularly if you want to do a bit of shopping. Downsides, last time we got nailed with an incredible phone bill, which I complained about and they fixed to a point that whilst still over the top it was fair, given it really was our fault for not paying attention to the cost. So not really that much of a downside. Whilst we have not stayed elsewhere in Rome, it seemed reasonably good value Nice to feel welcome at the hotel. Will we stay again - probably - if we didn't it wouldn't be about not liking the hotel but rather a change to try somewhere new.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: formiga66
Reviews.Content: The hotel could look better but the location, food from the hotel restaurant and the view from our room was absolutely fantastic. they also sended water and champagne to our room. money well spended.

Reviews.Title: “Stepping back in time”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi75
Reviews.Content: Going to the Intercontinental Rome is like stepping back in time. The décor is of a century gone by. The location is good – near the top of the Spanish steps. We had a lovely room with a huge terrace overlooking the central courtyard. The rooms are not large and the bathrooms need upgrading. The lunch service was incredibly slow but we had an enjoyable dinner in the main restaurant. The room service breakfast, which we had hoped to enjoy on our terrace, was atrocious.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the de la Ville”
Reviews.Author: giftnurse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the de la Ville following a cruise this month. I was somewhat concerned, after reading some of the reviews, but we were not disappointed. We were upgraded to a lovely room, 471, with a small balcony overlooking the terrace. It was wonderful sleeping with the terrace doors open, and we weren't disturbed by noise. The room was quite large for Rome standards, and the bathroom was much more than I expected. The bathtub didn't really seem to be meant for showering, as it was slightly narrow, with the bottom curved. Many amenties, including robes and slippers, clothesline, and safe in room. In fact, we forgot to lock the safe once, and found a message from management that they had found it open, and had secured and inventoried the contents. The house manager brought the contents to the room and verified with us it was accurate. What service! The desk personnel were prompt, even though we checked in at noon, and the concierge staff was excellent. They gave us great advice and directions, called cabs, called the Borghese for us the morning we wanted to visit and obtained reservations, and held our luggage that day until 2 or 3. We didn't eat in the dining room due to the high prices. I wish I'd thought of asking for a coffee pot, but part of the fun in Rome is experiencing it, so I'm glad we went to the coffee bars for capucchinos and "cornettes". A very lovely hotel, with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarenSfromNJ
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, join the intercontinental club (for free) and you'll get an upgrade. Saw the mixed reviews and contacted the hotel prior to our visit. They were extremely helpful in obtaining tickets for a tour for the Vatican, only a few days before our arrival. The concierge, Christian was very friendly and helpful every time we needed anything. One of the other concierges, Nicola, was surly. Not at all friendly, not sure why. The rooms were beautiful as they upgraded us to a room with a terrace overlooking the courtyard where the restaurant was. It was quiet at night and beautiful. The room was spacious by european standards. You could hear people talking in the next room, though. The location was great, right at the top of the spanish steps. Breakfast was not included, and was so expensive we didn't even get coffee in our rooms in the morning, a definite negative point. They held our bags when we arrived early and always provided excellent recommendations for restaurants in whatever part of Rome we asked. Overall, a great experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fall in Rome”
Reviews.Author: montrealer1110
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent location. Rooms are small and claustrophobic for an intercon. Great terrace on the top floor overlooking room. Good for a few days stay but not more.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel; exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: blondiesrq
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel in an ideal location. It is next to the five star deluxe Hassler, at the top of the Spanish Steps. The Borghese Villa/Gardens is a block down from the hotel. The fashion district Via Condotti is a ten minute walk from the hotel down the Spanish Steps. We arrived by train at the station Termini and took a taxi to the hotel. The doormen/bellhops are very kind and helpful with your bags or helping you get a taxi. The people who work the desk all speak excellent english. The concierge staff and doormen speak english, too. There were many Americans staying at this hotel. The staff working the desk want to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. My room wasn't ready when I got there at 9am, so they gave me another room to relax in till my room was ready. We crashed for a while and then went out exploring. When we got back our room was ready, our bags had been moved and we had a bottle of Asti Spumanti on ice waiting for us in the room! I had booked the room through Priceline and after reading a few reviews here, I was a little nervous. I asked them if they could upgrade the room and they accomodated my request. I was given a very large room. My mother was with me, and they gave us a suite with two full size beds and a sitting area with sofa/chairs. The room faced the street below, Via Sistina, but it was very quiet. We were on the fourth floor, next to the elevators, but heard no noise. The housekeepers come by at least two times a day to make sure you are happy or need anything. They always made one last stop by in the evening before they went home. You are given a small area in the fridge in which to put your own food. We found a grocery store on Via Condotti and bought groceries (coffee/tea/bread/jam/cheese) and had breakfast in the room every morning to save money. The desk staff were kind enough to find us a kettle and bring us cups/spoons to the room so we could have coffee or tea whenever we wanted in the room. The bathroom was a good size as was the bathtub. The shower was great. Nice slippers and robe provided in the bathroom. They give you lots of towels. The bed linens were very soft and pretty. The airconditioner worked great, too. It is my impression that if you book your hotel room through a discount broker or site like priceline, you are booking the cheapest room the hotel offers. When you get to the hotel, if they can accomodate an upgrade to a nicer room, they are more than happy to do this for you. This hotel is all about customer service and wanting to make your stay in Rome a wonderful experience. So at busy times of the year, you may be stuck with the room you paid for. If you are lucky and the hotel is not full, they will give you a better room. You just have to ask and keep your fingers crossed. When you buy through Priceline or a discount broker, you are never paying for the deluxe/upgrade room. You are paying for the cheapest/no frills room. So don't be mad at them when you get there and this is what you end up with. The manager Giacomo Picca is very attentive, friendly and likes to help whenever he can. Marco at the front desk is also very helpful and gracious. The restaurant and outdoor terrace is absolutely BEAUTIFUL. We had coffee and a snack there and it was heavenly. I would highly recommend a meal or a drink outside on the terrace by the restaurant. If you want to se the Borghese Museum, you have to make reservations before hand, at least 2 days prior. Something else we did was take several tours with enjoyrome.com. They have very educated guides, usually small groups and they are reasonably priced. Take the Jewish Ghetto/Trastevere tour. The tour companies, there are like 2-3 that take you on the bus, were not very good. It may be the only way to get out the catacombs, Tivoli, and D'Este. Otherwise, I would recommend the enjoyrome.com company for your tours. You really can walk everywhere around town once you figure out the lay of the land. Make sure you go to Campo D'Fiori, too. Would be a fantatistic place for dinner...very romantic. Eat at restaurants that are recommended on the web or by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Intercontinental de la Ville experience”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTraveller2000
Reviews.Content: I travelled from Australia to Rome and was quite exhausted when I arrived at the Hotel de la Ville. The check-in procedure was quick and easy and even though I had booked my room on the internet I was treated like royalty. The porters took my bags to my room immediately and a staff member accompanied me separately to show me how to use the air-con, etc. If this was indicative of the level of service, I loved it already. I have visited Rome many times and was expecting a tiny room but my room was a pleasant surprise...not huge but certainly generous by Roman standards, especially in such a central position. The hotel is within walking distance of everything, and I mean everything, in Rome. It is just above The Spanish Steps and I was able to walk to all the main tourist attractions..Trevi Fountain, Forum, Colosseum, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, and I even walked home one evening after dinner in Trastevere. It is close to the Metro station (3 mins walk) and it is only 10 mins to The Vatican by train. It is also close to the best shopping street in the world, Via Condotti, as well as great restaurants and coffee bars. Every day the concierge and staff greeted me and they were able to help me with restaurant recommendations as well as information about the train service and time table to Florence. Honestly, nothing was too much trouble and I loved the big umbrella they gave me to use on the one rainy day I had on my trip there. This hotel is not for those who are roughing it, but the prices are very competitive for Rome and the standard of service is far ahed of the others. It can't be beaten for position and the bar is a friendly place to relax with a drink. My whole experience at this hotel was excellent...believe me, it must be good for me to spend time doing this evaluation. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Rome after staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: tanya4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location...right at the top of the Spanish Steps...easy walking to many of Rome's tourist spots and restaurants. Easy access to the Metro. But for us, that is where the good benefits end. We are members of the Intercontinental's rewards program. So, we didn't pay for our room, we did use points. We were assigned room 436. The room literally was the size of a closet. You could not open the bathroom door all the way, as the bed prevented us from doing so. I am thankful we had only a small suitcase...not sure what we would have done. The bathroom was nicely appointed, and the room itself was OK - but in my opinion, not Intercontinental standards. The bathroom had 5 large mold spots from previously leaks , the wall paper was ripping off the wall next to the bed. On the good side, we did have some great wine, with a lovely view at the Terrace Bar. However, BUYER BEWARE!!!! They do not provide you with drink menus. So, when you order - ask how much in advance. We had 4 glasses and it was 44Euros. Not bad - compared to the lovely couple next to us, who had 2 glasses of red wine. When the bill came, the gentleman asked "what the hell did we drink for 55 Euros? " So, just beware. The hotel definitely tries to steer their clients away from the Metro, which I think is a shame. It is so easy to navigate and way safer than risking your life and being overcharged by a Roman Taxi! Overall, great location - needs some work to bring it up to Intercontinental standards. Not sure it is worth what they are charging.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, extra supplement for kids beds with Priceline”
Reviews.Author: TorontoLLB
Reviews.Content: So I booked this through priceline thinking that a standard hotel would have two beds in it and it could squeeze four people into the room. After checking with the hotel directly, I found that this was not the case. It would have been a small room, and they 'upgraded' us to accommodate two pullaway beds in the larger room. Cost was an extra 90 Euro a night - so much for the bargain. But again, this is Rome. Upon arrival we noted the tremendous location and amazing terrace with cool view. It was a very nice hotel and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room had a strong perfume smell when we arrived and they assured us that it would dissipate. It did. The cleaners dd not spray again duing our 3 days visit. We walked every where and the sites were tremendous. We ha d a wealth of restaurants in the area as well and we enjoyed seeing the sites. Rome is much like Paris to me in that you really only scratch the surface in a couple days. With a 3yo along, you can't cover as many spots either, espcially with hot temperatures. I would recommend this hotel and go back again. Note that there was a guide book on the book shelves in the lobby area near where the telephone is on the main floor that was helpful. Note too that it is easier getting to this hotel from the subway/tube than the bus. For the subway, you want the station for the Spanish Steps and then go to the top level where the church is. There is the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: havanese1
Reviews.Content: Our family recently went on a two week vacation to Italy. We stayerd at an absolutely beautiful hotel called the Intercontinental De La Ville Roma in central Rome near the spanish Steps. It was not only near everything possible but the service and the help was outstanding! Our accomodations were upgraded on both our stays here at the hotel. We arrived into Rome and stayed there one night and returned for 4 more nights on our return trip back after travelling to Montepulciano! The concierges were extremely helpful in every way possible. They were friendly and explained where all sights were in the area that we needed.The rooms were immaculate and simply stunning and the maids who cleaned the room worked hard and the results showed everytime we came back to our room at the end of a day. It was lovely and air conditioned and the staff could not do enough for us! I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a place in Downtown Rome that is lovely and clean in every way. The sights are magnificent, and the view magnificent (our room overlooked the patio with stautes and had a balcony and table and chairs ot was heaven)and the guest relations managers , Marco Manni in particular was more than accomodating in upgrading us to bigger and more beautiful suites and adjoingng rooms with our kids. Marco also helped us with our rental vehicle when we were not clear of lovcation and times to get the car...he made the phone calls for us. I have no hestation in recommending this hotel to anyone. It was truly like a dream for us! The best people in the world and the most delightful, helpful staff I have ever dealt with.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: aTraveller67
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental Hotel in Rome is a very good hotel in a fantastic location. We are a family of two adults and one child who stayed for 3 nights in August 2008. First impressions of the hotel as you enter the lobby are good, however, the hotel doesn’t have that big capital city international hotel feel. It has a more traditional feel. Check in staff were very efficient and spoke excellent English. Every time I visited the front desk there was never a queue. If someone was waiting, a member of staff would quickly appear and deal with them. We had a triple room on the second floor at the front of the hotel. The room was spacious, and classically decorated, like the rest of the hotel. All furniture and soft furnishings were in excellent condition and everything worked perfectly. Air conditioning was quiet and efficient and kept the room cool throughout our stay. I think the bathroom had been recently refit; it was immaculate and stocked with masses of white fluffy towels and high quality toiletries. The room had a mini bar but it was very expensive. My tip would be to walk twenty yards to the mobile cafeteria and stock up on drinks and snacks. You can get beer, wine, soft drinks water etc and they are cheap and chilled. There was one at the top of Spanish Steps just across from the hotel. The buffet breakfast is excellent with an extensive choice, but again quite expensive. I think it was 33 euros for adults but only 6 for children. On its website the hotel claims to have a roof terrace and bar and shows picture of people enjoying a drink or meals on the terrace. However, we found that it was not in use and there were a few tables and chairs dotted around but no staff. Location was a major factor in my decision to choose this hotel. You can walk to most of the major sights, although you may need the metro to get to the Vatican and the Coloseum. There are loads of restaurants within easy walking distance from high-end restaurants on Via Veneto to traditional Pizzerias and pavement cafés on the streets off Piazza Spagna and around Trevi Fountain. In summary, a comfortable base in an excellent location for exploring the historic city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Finest Hotel I Have Stayed In!”
Reviews.Author: dubhorse
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel as part of a work conference which I helped organise. The standard of accomodation was extremely high. Cleanliness was superb. The rooms were what you expect of a five star hotel with the exception that sound proofing was poor. I heard neighbours have an argument and was woken by the vacuum cleaning each morning. My room had a charming little balcony. The real highpoint of the hotel, for me, was that the staff were incredibly pleasant and polite. You felt like you were a prince. Its true that this hotel is expensive relative to most - but in my experience you got the service. The food was superb as well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and indeed the 40 people who stayed there as part of the conference were all agreed on the quality of service and luxury of the hotel. If you have the money stay here! And of course Rome is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “turned out good”
Reviews.Author: JESUSFOLLOWERS
Reviews.Content: I want to start out and say I was a little nervous about the hotel based on reviews on this site and after winning the room on Price line. My wife & I spent 3 nights at the Intercontinental De La Ville and found it to be a fairly nice place to stay. First it is an excellent location Just a few feet from the Spanish Steps in one Direction and a short walk to several other sites you must see. We were able to walk almost everywhere and just two short blocks away are the Double Decker tour buses -we highly recommend ROMA TOURS the green bus. Both day and then in the evening too. The room we were given was # 515 and it was small like most indicate here - however I had the hotel in Florence call ahead and ask I be given a nice room upgrade & we ended up with a nice little balcony attached. The rooms were very clean and the bath's were small too but real nice. A/C worked great ! and plenty of hot water for shower. The best part of the room is the bedding - it was very nice and comfortable after all day sight seeing and both of us enjoyed that a bunch --As I started to get around the hotel and after the having Continental breakfast that was nice and included . I really started to like the hotel a little more. I wished it included the full breakfast but the cont. was pretty nice. What I am trying to say is the place was pretty nice and has some good features . The staff was a little hard to figure out but I think they were willing to help out when I ask --Breakfast staff was Great. and Breakfast Patio a pleasure to start the day. There is a nice deck patio on six floor --must see & safe in the room -- I ask and was given an iron and board with in minutes ... good service there!, The Area around the hotel has all the nice expensive shops - Kind of the Rodeo Drive of Rome and all right there if you like that kind of stuff. My wife and I turned out enjoying our stay there and would recommend particularly at the Priceline price. We found that both in Rome and in Florence everyone to be very nice and friendly when being treated friendly first & willing to help if ask politely. The only thing I would change about my stay there is the Humidity in July - Full breakfast included and for the hotel to do a little paint touch-up in the rooms nothing major just trim it out a little better. - Include free Internet- and treat all your guest like they have the big money ---- even if they don't. I will say it again God blessed us through out our entire trip to Florence, Tuscany, Cinque Terre and Rome, And made it that all of our hotels and tours and food were all over the top great and we had a wonderful time. The only bad thing I had happen was near the end of trip with a Rip Off Cab driver that took us to airport pulled a quick change of Euros on me and said I only gave him 20 euros when I gave him a 50 and 20 he was easily pleased by giving him my last 5 Euros but it left me money at airport for coffee and that is Bad at 5 am in the morning ! Other than that all was great and we hope you have a great time on your trip to Italy>

Reviews.Title: “great location,great staff”
Reviews.Author: sheila1020
Reviews.Content: we recently spent 2 days at this hotel and found our experience to be most enjoyable.it is in a very prime location at the top of the famous spanish steps.staff and manager giacomo pica was very helpful.if you try this hotel give our regards to mr.pica. the sherman's from st louis,mo. usa

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and breakfest”
Reviews.Author: AbouElNar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 5 days at the Intercontinental hotel Rome. The hotel is extremely well located and the breakfest was excellent!! the only bad point is that the rooms are very very smal.

Reviews.Title: “Beware if your buy through Priceline”
Reviews.Author: kellycares
Reviews.Content: Like the reviewer who paid for his room with Amex points and was given a poor room, I paid well below rack rate through Priceline and was given one of the worst rooms in the hotel. My room was next to the breakfast room and looked out onto a solid wall with machinery below. It was the smallest room I have ever stayed in. Thank goodness I was a single because the room would have been too small for two people. On the positive, it is excellently situated and the bed was comfortable. The room was clean with all of the necessities (including a safe) except a clock. I would stay here through Priceline again, but I would insist on a decent room upon check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: bhawknine
Reviews.Content: Loved the Intercontinental, great location next to the Hassler Hotel at the top of the Spanish Steps. Helpful and pleasant staff who spoke fluent english. Excellent recommendations for dining and for travel around Rome. Nice room, very quiet. Traveled there via the Airport Train to the Termini station and then transferred to the Metro A line for three stops. Very close to the Metro Station. One side note, at the Metro station there is an elevator that can be taken up to the street the Hotel is on.
