We found out the hard way walking up the Spanish Steps with luggage, oh well, needed the exercise! But the elevator is definitely the way to go. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hospitality from Giacomo Pica”
Reviews.Author: Randelle
Reviews.Content: I received great personal attention from Hotel manager Giacomo Pica. He was gracious, attentive and very welcoming. Giacomo made my stay very pleasurable and I would recommend the Intercontinental to all of my colleagues and friends. My room was lovely, the service was friendly, and I'm looking forward to my next stay. Grazie Giacomo!

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 Location”
Reviews.Author: hvacgar
Reviews.Content: Gr8 location - we had a two day stay in the lovely museum called Roma. Staff was very helpful, although room service was always in a hurry to barge in after the first knock. We were upgraded to a terrace room which was fantastic for evening tea and breakfast....would definitely be a return visitor !

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, location, service, room, restaurants, bars etc etc”
Reviews.Author: Strouddy
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Rome you could not be staying in a better place that this hotel! It is situated at the top of the Spanish Steps (Piazza di Spagna), with easy access to everything and everywhere in the city. Our executive room with a small balcony overlooking an internal courtyard, where breakfast and dinner is served, was large, clean and very comfortable. The whole hotel is tastefully decorated and well maintained. All of the staff that we encountered were friendly, helpful and seemed to enjoy their job and were relaxed and courteous all of the time! We will definately be going back there soon. Check out their own website for good deals, but be warned, July & August are very very hot, it was 35 degrees all weekend from 4th - 6th July!!! They have a roof top bar that is not to be missed, even if a little pricey (Euros 19.00 per cocktail!).

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Recommend”
Reviews.Author: docjennings
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel using my American Express awards points and I have to wonder if that has something to do with the terrible rooms that we were given? We checked in and when I asked if there were any upgrades they told me absolutely not, that the hotel was full. On the way to the room, the bellman kept telling us how small our room was and he wasnt kidding. I went back to the front desk and after slipping 20 euro suddenly there is another room available. Room 414. Exhausted we took it even though it was filthy dirty for a 5 star hotel. Also at check in I was told that my reservations did not included breakfast and that would be 33 euro pp per day. Ouch! I asked if we could just order a la carte and was told no. The only was around it was to join Intercontinental club and get a cheaper breakfast, whatever. We go to breakfast the next morning and of course, you can order a la carte. For a first breakfast the eggs came out and were freezing cold that I had to tell the hostess and there was another person that couldnt get a waffle. It was obvious they were very short staffed. I was so frustrated with the dirty room, (pics attached), the conning of buying a membership, cold breakfast and being nickled and dimed for everything (internet, movie.....) that I went back to the front desk and told them I was to check out and get a refund for the last night. I will tell you they were wonderful in handling the situation. The General Manager called me, etc and they put us in a lovely jr. suite to keep me quiet. (after I told him I would post my experience on this site) I would not have posted this had one last thing happened. When we checked out I asked to use the internet to get a number in Amalfi. He took me to the business office and said he would charge me a minimim of $18 euro to use it (for one phone number?) In my two week trip to Italy I mostly stayed at Italian hotels and expected the american hotel to be better. I was very, very wrong. Attached are pics of room 414. A Five Star hotel room? I dont think so.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Choice”
Reviews.Author: jcolesw2
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at the Intercontinental in late June. I thoroughly enjoyed my time there and every aspect of the hotel. I have visited Rome many times before and this is head and shoulders above anywhere else I have stayed. The style of the hotel is very traditional. The public areas and marble staircase help create an almost palatial feeling. I was please to be upgraded to a Junior Suite, the room was very large with two (very comfortable) double beds and a separate seating area with a sofa and two arm chairs. The room was immaculate and beautifully appointed with two “Juliet” balconies. Most importantly, being 36 degrees outside, the air conditioning was silent and efficient making the room a very comfortable haven from the heat. From arrival to departure, the staff, without exception, were courteous, friendly and very helpful; as good as I have ever encountered particularly the check in staff and the team working the bar. We ate at the restaurant one evening and the food was very good and I thought pretty good value. The location of the hotel is hard to beat. It is situated at the top of the Spanish Steps and the views from the Terrace Bar on the sixth floor are amazing. This makes for a superb spot to sit with a drink in the evening and escape the heat of the City. This is an excellent hotel and made a trip to an amazing City truly special.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: BethMiriam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Intercontinental quite a few times over the years and even though the prices have gone up we still feel that it is the best place, in terms of location and service, that we can find. I did note the problem with the room spray that some of the other members mentioned and indeed the first room we were given was not only a shabby but someone had been smoking in it even though it was on a non-smoking floor. In this case the spray was uses to mask the odor. We were given another room which had a lovely terrace and a much brighter look to it, though as with all the rooms in the hotel it was small. The mattress and pillows are among the most comfortable we have ever found anywhere. The room and the bathroom were spotless and I like the fact that they are following the trend and no longer have bedspreads. Breakfast is now included and it is so sumptuous that it is a sight to behold. I found the breakfast room staff to be helpful and friendly, but as you would expect in Italy, formal. I want to particularly mention the helpfulness of Christian, Nicola and Pino at the concierge desk. We have seen the important sites over the years so they recommended some off the beaten path places that were terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: danidb518
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, and looking at several hotel websites, I chose this hotel mostly due to the location, and even though it was abit out of our price range, I wanted a nice, top quality hotel for the three nights that my husband & I would be in Rome- our first visit to Italy, and first overseas trip at that. I wanted to stay at the Westin, but it was booked. (We stayed at the Westin in Venice a week before arriving in Rome, and it was great.) Upon arrival, the concierge gentlemen were much nicer than the front desk clerks. Even when we checked out, the front desk didn't say thanks or anything, in fact, they guy took the room key (card) and that was it, and a few days after arriving back home, we received our receipt in the mail. And to top it off, they charged the first night, then voided it out and put it in again- who knows why- and I wasn't going to call since we were home and it was all over with, but, in doing so, of course it changed the euro currency charge each time, and we ended up paying an extra $25.00 due to someone's carelessness. Also, I wanted some change for tips, and the front desk would only give me five one euro coins and no more, saying they couldn't! The room was very overpriced; was plain-reminded us of some hotels in the US. There was a convention of insurance sales people from the US there while we were there, and they were treated better, in my opinion. No one seemed overly friendly to us. Breakfast was very good with a large array of food to choose from, and it was included in the price of our room, but the waiters weren't friendly. The unthinkable happened on our last night in Rome: somehow I left my rather expensive camera in the front seat of a taxi- in tears, I asked the concierge if they could help, and the guy seemed hesitant, but wrote some information down, and said he would call the different taxi companies and I gave him a small tip. Within the hour, I went back to tell him a few more details, and the note that he had written was still just sitting on the desk where anyone could have removed it, and he had not called anyone as of yet. As we were leaving the next morning, there was another guy at the desk who showed me the original note, and it had check marks on it as if the taxi companies were called but no luck. If we ever get to visit Rome again, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bella”
Reviews.Author: Sully38
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. The air conditioning was strong, the room was big, Giacomo and Christian and the rest of the concierge staff were helpful in finding authentic local restaurants, the location is convenient to the Forum, Spanish Steps, Trevi, Pantheon. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Low price performance..”
Reviews.Author: carolineDenmark
Reviews.Content: 3 star experience Prior to our resent 5 day trip to Rome we had some trouble finding a nice 4-5 star hotel as most hotels were sold out on May 1st. Our main priority were location as we planned to walk everywhere. We also wanted a room larger than the standard hotel room as we were travelling with our two year old boy who needs a bit of space to play. My husband and I chose the Intercontinental with some hesitation after reading the different reviews on this site. It seems that you have to choose the top end suites at this hotel in order to get even a reasonable price performance. We went for a junior suite but did not get much quality for the piles of euros we paid. We did get quite a few square meters but the layout of the room was very strange and neither convenient nor cosy. The room was shaped like a very long corridor with the sleeping area bulging out at the end. A lot of space wasted. The room (106) was on the first floor and facing a very dark inner courtyard. The TV cupboard blocked one of the two windows entirely and the room was very dark. The bathroom was small and not luxurious. We asked the reception whether this actually was the best room they could offer us and they insisted that this junior suite was among their best. Pros -Location. Perfect for shopping and fine for sightseeing. We walked everywhere but as Rome is pretty small many other hotels could have given us the same possibilities. - The general manager and some of the staff were very nice and welcoming. To bad that this is not the general code of conduct at this hotel - The room service food was very expensive - but excellent and generous. - The hotel facilitated a late check out when our little boy became ill. Cons Apart from the room being dark and generally disappointing. - The air conditioner was very noisy but not very efficient - we dread to think about how hot our room had been had it been July or August. - Additional prices for wireless, movies, room service charge etc. were outrageous and higher than what we have experienced in true 5-star hotels. - Décor wise The Intercontinental relies heavily on chintz and heavy gold frames but its not really grand or elegant there are simply too many shabby details. - Movies could only be seen in the not very cosy hallway part of the room which had a flat screen. The older TV in the cupboard could not offer this functionality. - Breakfast buffet was unorganised. Service at breakfast was very inconsistent. There was a 50/50 split in our opinion of the waiters, Some of them were hardworking and service minded and you could see that they were pulling the load - other waiters were disorganised and not mentally present . Some mornings we really had to struggle to get our coffee. - The heavy perfumed spray of air freshener house keeping used in our room. In conclusion we will not return to The Intercontinental. It is not a bad hotel but price performance is simply too low and the overall impression is not even near 5 star..

Reviews.Title: “quite nice, beautifully located”
Reviews.Author: awdub
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one evening at the end of a trip to Italy for a friend's wedding. The hotel's location was the most important factor for us because we had such a limited time in Rome, and this hotel had a better rate than most of the other nearby good hotels (e.g., the Hassler). The location just couldn't be beat (at the top of the Spanish Steps, very close to the subway), and the hotel was quite nice. The room was on the small side, but that wasn't too surprising, considering we were in an older urban hotel. We were on the 6th floor facing the steps, and had a lovely small balcony with a view over the rooftops and of the steps themselves. The bed, linens, bathrobe, etc., were quite nice. The room was well-furnished; it certainly was not "modern," but it wasn't tired or worn, either. We didn't have too much experience with the service, but what we saw was good. The staff parked our rental car for us; we asked for it to be brought back to the front of the hotel the next morning at 7am, and it was brought back promptly at that time. When I asked at the check-in desk for the fastest way to get to the Vatican, the clerk provided a map and good directions to the subway. Bottom line - as long as their rates stay competitive, we'll absolutely be back the next time we're in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “InterContinental not so Internet friendly.”
Reviews.Author: mlee168
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean. It's also nicely situated by the Spanish steps so it was easy to find in the maze of streets called Rome. There were a few issues that did bother me though. There was no breakfast which wouldn't have been a big deal if they just had coffee and tea laid out for us. But alas, they didn't even have that. The other thing that bothered me was the extremely high cost for internet access at this place. There were a few villas, hotels, resorts that we stayed at where the internet was only a nominal fee if not free, you'd think such a high class place like this would at least throw they're guest some sort of bone. But other than that, the hotel was nice. I guess I'm just too attached to technology. I like to keep up with the world during my down time when traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelgal928
Reviews.Content: Since this hotel has small rooms and baths that need updating, I don't think it qualifies for a 4/5 star rating. The pros include a wonderful breakfast buffet in an elegant setting even though it is quite expensive. We also enjoyed the 6th floor outdoor cocktail area plus the location of the hotel is A-1! Howver, the Concierge was not very helpful and we had to constantly get the doorman's attention to hail a cab. He was too busy talking to the porter's and not attentive to guests. This hotel just doesn't live up to the pictures on the website.

Reviews.Title: “do not waste your money in this place”
Reviews.Author: MSAUsa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst of my Italy tour and the most expensive. Location was good, however the beds were very, really very uncomfortable (do not ask for a king size bed by the way); When I mentioned this to the manager the response I got was " this is a historic hotel in Europe, things are different than in USA", after a long discussion he offered to change my room and he offered a downgraded room. The conceirge(s) were also minimally helpful in making reservations or assistance. I am really amazed this hotel is listed as 5 stars in some websites also, it barely gets 3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Mr. Giacomo Pica”
Reviews.Author: MissSorriso
Reviews.Content: About 2 weeks ago I came to the beautiful city Rome and the marvelous hotel De La Ville Intercontinental. All have started in a perfect way. The hotel was great the city was magical untill the moment that I've got robbed. In a second all was gone. My passport, my credit cards, all.. When I got back to the hotel I was devastated and shocked. I didn't know what to do. A moment ago I had all but a second after I was penniless.. With the embarrassment I went to the reception and explained what happened. Besides the major problem of loosing my passport my second big problem was how to pay extras to the hotel. At that moment I've met Mr. Giacomo Pica who is the Duty Manager of the hotel.. Mr Pica with his kindness listened to what happened to me and then helped me to make the Passport process much more easier. He let me barrowing money from the hotel and then companied me to find a photo shoot studio and the waited with me. He told me that if my family fax the hotel a valid credit card copy that would work it out perfectly. Thanks to him I felt confident and in secure. When I came to my room I found a big bottle of Prosecco and fruits. What a lovely surprise after that terrible day! Thanks to him in the morning I had have easily my documents and money from my family. During the stay he helped me in every kind of necessity. For example with my wallet I lost also the key of my luggage’s locker. The day when I was leaving Rome was Sunday. All the shops were closed. But he searched all over Rome and at the end he found it!! He helped me in every second of this terrible experience and thanks to him what have started as a horrible nightmare has ended like a beautiful dream. You are a great person Mr. Pica. You are my Hero. Certainly I will come back to Rome and definitely I will stay again at the De La Ville Intercontinental Hotel! Miss Sorriso

Reviews.Title: “Might Have Been Fabulous 50 Years Ago”
Reviews.Author: MDJDenver
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days in Venice, Florence and Rome. The De La Ville was the most expensive lodging and the lowlight of our trip. While the location was excellent, at the top of the Spanish Steps, the hotel has seen much better days. We booked a triple executive suite with terrace. The room rate was $677 Euro plus tax, no breakfast included. The only saving grace of the stay was the free night I received being an Ambassador Club member which averaged the nightly rate to be tolerable. Check in was fast and efficient so no problems there. Porters were available to assist with luggage and offered to show us the room amenities (how to open the terrace door) so no problem there either. The single largest disappointment was the “city view” terrace which looked straight on to a large construction crane at the building across the small street. While there were views, they were mostly obstructed by the crane. The terrace was absolutely filthy and there were no cushions for the terrace chairs. Not a single plant or greenery which could have helped the dismal terrace. I realize the hotel is very old and I didn’t expect modern fittings and furnishings but I did expect that the room would have been renovated or at least updated in the last 50 years. Chipped and very stained furniture. The carpet could very well be original. The small sitting couch was so bad that I draped towels over it to sit. The room smelled horrible and the overly floral room spray they used to mask the smell made it worse. We had the windows open the entire stay to air the room out. After two days, the smell was as strong as when we entered. The smell lingered up and down the halls and on the terrace when other rooms had their doors or windows open. Luckily, we chased the maid out of the room the second morning before she could spray any more of that horrible stuff. Bedding was OK but lumpy however the pillows were wonderful (welcome after the hard pillows in the other locations) and the comforter was soft and fluffy. A small roll-away bed was available for my niece but was so short that her feet hung over the end (she is very petite). I can’t imagine an older or larger child sleeping on the cot. The mattress pad on the cot was a bath towel. Bathroom was small and cramped and had we wanted to use the bidet, it would have been a trick in acrobatics as the door completely blocked it. The tub was very narrow and was fitted with the standard handheld shower. The water was adjustable, hot and good water pressure. Toiletries were above average. Service by the concierge was snotty at best. We didn’t ask for much assistance other than the location of the Ferragamo store which was such a nuisance that we just gave up and wandered Via Condotti still we found it. We did not eat at the hotel and only had drinks our last evening on the 6th floor terrace. Service was average if not a bit slow. It took 20 minutes to be acknowledged and there were only three other tables occupied. Prices were as expected and no different than any other hotel in a large city – US or Europe. I had such high expectations for this hotel and our last two nights in Italy and sadly, they were not met. Yes, the location is fabulous but there are other hotels in the area that I would try before ever staying at the De La Ville again. We very much enjoyed Rome (I have been multiple times, first visit for my niece)…we had fabulous meals (off the tourist tracks with the exception of Imago at The Hassler which was horrible), we wandered for hours enjoying the sites and had wonderful service from very warm people (exception was the hotel). It was an overall great visit to Rome…..I just wish that I had selected a different hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: colorado67
Reviews.Content: De la ville Intercontinental was a very outstanding Hotel. We arrived at 11 am before they were ready for us to check-in. Giacomo Pica is the Duty Manager who stepped in and had our room ready to go in very little time. Our son was traveling in Europe and surprised us by arriving very early in the am. Giacomo did not have room and referred him to a hotel just a few doors away. The following day Giacomo made certain a room was available at the De la ville. The 6th floor views are spectacular. The view looking over Roma is breathtaking, you can see the Vatican the Forum etc. The Bell men are very friendly and allow you to do nothing but enjoy. The location is central to all of Rome especially the Spanish Steps, Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. I live near the Broadmoor in Colorado Springs, USA and this Hotel is just as elegant. We took several tours and discussed Hotels with many people. Most did not have air conditioning, poor locations and poor service. De la ville really has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Pass its sell by date”
Reviews.Author: devesci
Reviews.Content: Very very disappointing for a four/five star hotel. There are only four rooms in this hotel that are worth the staying in. The honeymoon suit €€€ or one of the three rooms with terraces, the remainder are extremely ordinary and not worth it. Regarding the service, we met staff members on the first day but never again, e.g. gave the porter €20 tip for looking after bags on arrival, asked for bags to be bought to lobby on check-out and were completely ignored, we had to carry bags down six floors! The hotel has lots of ways of extracting extra money from you, if you're not checking every transaction - you must ask for a special breakfast rate and if you don't they charge you €33 for breakfast instead of €22! I needed to open a single email and print it off at reception, they charged €23! The location is not terrific at all. You may be beside the famous Spanish Steps, but when you have to climb them everytime you want to go anywhere the steps loose their appeal completely. This hotel may have been worthy of a four/five star award a decade ago but its certainly not worth even a three star award at present. DO NOT STAY HERE ROME HAS BETTER HOTELS TO OFFER.

Reviews.Title: “Rome with the luxuries of home with European flair.”
Reviews.Author: IslanderGirl
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Intercontinental de la Ville. It had been ten years since I visited the city so I was relying heavily on trip advisor to help pick the right hotel given the fact that many hotels are given similar star ratings but prices vary. We stayed the first week of May. Many of the top ten hotels on trip advisor were already booked. We went with the Intercontinental based on its ratings & reviews. We were not disappointed. I would say to any travelers considering this hotel, do not hesitate--this is a fabulous experience. you are right next door to the Hassler, the two buildings touch on a private little road with some high end shopping and then the spanish steps right across the street. We stayed in room 103 on the first floor. The room had a window seat and the windows opened up to the street--this was a plus for us, I like having the option for natural air if the day is nice. The building across the street was under construction but there was no noise or workers around while we were there. The deluxe double room is european style with two single beds side by side, a king would have been better, but we didn't fret. The room had internet/television/minibar and the bathroom came complete with a great shower and bath with great water pressure and temperature controle. The room also came with two housecoats & 2 sets of slippers. The room has a safe and plenty of closet space. The decor is elegant and comfortable. Good sheets/good pillows/good temperature controle. We ordered breakfast to the room each morning and had lunch at the restaurant and a late night drink on the roof deck--all were excellent. no complaints, the staff were exceptional, full of energy and very pleasant. We would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Becky33
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 12:00pm on April 18, for a 2 night stay. The lobby is beautiful and the location at the top of the Spanish Steps is so convenient. We were able to check in and go right up to our room. We had booked the Executive Suite and I believe there are only two in the hotel. One on the 7th and one on the 8th . We were in room 727 and it did not disappoint. There was an entry way with a desk and closets then the bathroom off of that. Then into the bedroom area which had a queen bed along with a couch, table and 2 chairs. The best part was the terrace. There are three sets of doors (all open) out into the terrace… It is very large with 2 lounge chairs, table and chairs, and about 5 lemon trees… The views were as spectacular as promised… There are other Jr. Executive Suites with a slightly smaller terrace and room, but with the same views and less money of course. We had great service. We did not have anyone who did not smile and do whatever they could to make us happy. Two hours after we checked in the front desk manager called to ensure we were happy with our room. We were. It was very clean and comfortable… We had room service 3 times and each time it was great though very expensive. Other reviewers commented on the prices and it is true. You are paying a huge margin to eat or drink at this hotel. Our breakfast was really great quality as well. The service was impeccable and the selection was immense. We really enjoyed our time here and if you are booked into this hotel I am sure you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Perfect Location - Close to Metro/Subway”
Reviews.Author: Tylerprod
Reviews.Content: Deciding to take a spontaneous trip, my friend and I logged onto the American Express - Last Minute Deals website. Thinking of the Napa Wine Country or Mazatlan, we noticed a trip to Rome. There were hotel upgrade options, so we chose the InterContinental de la Ville! We booked the trip on a Tuesday night and were on a flight the next morning. The 600 year old building and hotel is in a perfect location atop the Spanish Steps. At the base of the Steps, the Rodeo Drive of Rome! Gucci, Prada and other the others! Arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by a doorman who led us to the front desk. The staff at the front desk were pleasant and the check in process was very quick. I had read a review about the small rooms on the 3rd floor, and sure enough, we were on the 3rd floor. When we entered the room, it was very small, yet from what I have read and been told by other travelers to Rome, most rooms are small. Overlooking the minor detail of size, we were VERY happy about the location. The room and bathroom were very clean, the bed was comfortable with big pillows, and the robes and slippers were a nice touch. The hotel has a bar and restaurant in addition to a rooftop patio. We were unable to see the rooftop patio as it rained most of the time we were there. We didn't eat at the restaurant, yet we stopped in the bar on a few nights. The prices at the bar were ridiculous, so if you're a budget traveler, visit the local eateries, pubs or markets. We had dinner the first night, and many nights after at a local place called L'Enoteca on Via Della Croce 76/B. This is an absolute must as the food, wine and desserts are phenomenal! It is walking distance from the hotel and two blocks from the Spanish Steps. The hotel is also close to the metro or subway which gives you access to most of the city. The metro is at the base of the Steps, however there is also an elevator leading to the metro from the top of the Spanish Steps. Taking the metro makes hitting all the tourist spots very easy, especially if you are in the city for a limited time. Overall we were very pleased with the accommodations at the hotel, and look forward to returning. J~

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: lut5556
Reviews.Content: The location by the Spanish Steps is ideal. It is within reach of all major sites. Trevi fountain and the Pantheon are only short walks away. The subway is down the Steps which makes travel to the Vatican and Forum easy. The base of the steps is full of great restaurants and wonderful shopping. The hotel itself is not all that is advertised. The staff was very good and extremely helpful with all of our needs. Top-notch. However, the room was tiny and the overall decor was less than impressive. The in-room entertainment was again not as advertised. Movies were said to be available but were nowhere to be found. Lack of iron made things a little difficult. This is not a hotel for younger singles or couples. Mid-thirties and up. If you do not mind paying top dollar for location, then this is the place for you. It is absolutely not five star, however. I recommend staying at a three star and saving a few bucks. Thanks, I hope this helps. Rome is a great place and worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Maryanne1144
Reviews.Content: A note to anyone interested in visiting Rome. My mother in Law and I have just returned from a wonderful trip to Italy. We were in parts of Tuscany for two weeks and then had a week in Rome. Initially we were booked in another hotel, which I won’t mention, and absolutely hated the look of it! At check in, I decided not to stay and quickly made a call to the Intercontinental De La Ville Roma and asked to speak to management as I had stayed there before. At that point, Giacomo Pica, the Duty Manager, spoke with me and I explained my dilemma of not having a room and wanting to stay at the Intercontinental, however I was concerned with the price. May I say, that we negotiated a very fair price and I then went to the Hotel to verify our stay. I had left our bags at the other Hotel and Giacomo Pica personally escorted me by taxi, to the other Hotel to collect our luggage. My mother in law remained at the Intercontinental and rested in a lovely lounge area and was offered complimentary drinks – how lovely of them!! We were penalized by the other hotel for one night, but we thought it was worth it after we were given so much attention by the Intercontinental. This is a huge thank you to Giacomo Pica who was not only a gentleman, but an inspiration to all his staff who only spoke kind respectful words about it. It is so refreshing and lovely as a traveler to come across such wonderful management who have positions of importance and who use it to benefit people like ourselves. After all, the hotel industry is a service industry and that hotel encompassed its meaning. Thank you also to Marco Manni, the Guest Relations person, who couldn’t help us enough with our trip planned for September. Our stay at the Intercontinental De La Ville Roma was first class, soft comfortable beds with lovely linen, great cleanliness, great attention from all staff including the very happy bar staff and it’s restaurant had amazingly delicious food. In all, I’ve stayed at some of the very best 5 star hotels, but this has become the top of my list because of all of the above. So thanks again to the Intercontinental and especially Giacomo Pica whom I will always appreciate. Maryanne and Barbara, Australia*

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Spanish Steps location”
Reviews.Author: kridot
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here after being in the Hilton Cavaleri for 3 nights. The rooms are pretty small, but we were looking for something closer to town and this hit the spot. It is a 1 minute walk to the Spanish steps and a metro, so any part of Rome is easily accessible. We had a street side room which was surprisingly quiet. Breakfast was very expensive but the outdoor space for breakfast and cocktails (on the upstairs terrace) was beautiful. If you aren't planning on spending much time in your room, this is a great location in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great atmosphere & perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CornwallS
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, classic old hotel, with more character than you expect to see these days. The location could not possibly be better - literally 20 seconds from the Spanish Steps and all the wonders that entails. We arrived early but they were super helpful and allowed us to check in early - everyone was polite, friendly, courteous and, above all, happy. Check-in was some of the fastest I have ever experienced, and we were then led through the sumptuous downstairs area to the lifts, and on to our room. The room was superb for the price, including a fabulous balcony which I wasn't expecting, but was a welcome addition, and the bed was huge and very comfy. The Rain Shower was luxurious and contained all the amenities you would expect. Overall it was a great experience - we didn't stay for long but it was a wonderful, romantic experience, and we will definitely be using the hotel again. I have stayed in the úber-expensive Westin Excelsior nearby, but will use the Intercontinental every time in the future, mostly down to the fantastic staff and perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “hotel Intercontinental de la ville”
Reviews.Author: mgarn33
Reviews.Content: I was nervous staying at this hotel. There have been several bad reviews and comments about rooms, reception and concierge. Well...................... Previously I have stayed at the Hassler, Minerva, Eden and Russie. I had booked a deal through Last Minute over Valentines night. I expected the worst - but got the best. My initial room was too small. I was moved to a superb room by the creativity of Gilles at reception. Hint.....join the loyalty club and there are great rewards. Thanks Gilles. Then there is Cristian on the Concierge desk. The nicest, funniest and most helpful concierge I have ever met. It is a great place, with great staff in a great location. I will happily return. Believe me..............I am picky and difficult to impress!!!

Reviews.Title: “Praise & Caution”
Reviews.Author: Mr. Matt
Reviews.Content: This IC Hotel is a beautifully renovated, historical building in an excellent location.. ..almost at the top of the Spanish Steps. . Booked a Club Level Room thru my Travel Agent (full rack-rate with no discounts or group rates) and confirmed this CLUB room request via phone before departing U.S. When checking -in was advised that CLUB Level rooms at this facility do NOT exist !! After being shown three different rooms (some very small ) finally selected one on the fifth floor which I found compatible to other European IC Hotels utilized on past trips. After finally finding a suitable room, my stay indeed was quite enjoyable . All the staff were most pleasant, but must single out the exceptional Concierge personnel = OUTSTANDING.. Now the "Caution". With business completed, checked out four days earlier than planned and was charged an "Early Departure Fee" of 255 Euros. Was explained that this was because I "booked thru a Travel Agent" and that I should "have read the small print "!! Bottom line.. use caution if you depart earlier than booked.. Despite the above problems I do reccomend this Hotel .y

Reviews.Title: “Heartbeat of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Go4Travel
Reviews.Content: I was a little anxious about a quick business trip to Rome in the middle of the holiday season. All my worries melted away the moment I arrived to warm welcome at the de la Ville InterContinental in Rome. Every time I returned to the hotel after a meeting, I was greeted with the same smile and attention. Being at the top of the Spanish Steps, you are close to the historic district, monuments, excellent shopping, and restaurants. Giacomo Pica and his staff went out of their way to make my visit enjoyable and productive. Even though I travelled alone, I always felt safe. The room was very comfortable and the pillows were awesome -- Ask them about their pillow menu!! If you do not stay at this hotel, consider coming by for an espresso or cocktail with Antonio the bartender, the happiest Roman in town! I can not wait to return and stay at the de la Ville InterContinental where you can really feel the "Heartbeat of Rome".

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: karanowski78
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. We got in late due to some delays and missing luggage, but there were still staff members available to help us. The man checking us in was a bit stuffy, but everyone else was very nice and the concierge checked on our missing luggage for us many times. We booked a "grand deluxe with balcony" through Orbitz. The room was not large, but that is expected in Europe. The bathroom was a nice size though and the view from our balcony was very nice. I fretted a lot over this hotel before leaving because of the mixed reviews and found it to be a lot of worrying for nothing. Breakfast was not included with our room and so I don't know what the restaurant or breakfast was like, but the courtyard surrounding the dining area was beautiful and the views from the second floor terrace were great! I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “At the very TOP of the Spanish Steps!”
Reviews.Author: JChua
Reviews.Content: Yes, literally, since we were allocated suite 839, which is on the highest floor of the hotel. There were only two suites on this floor, 839 and 840, the Penthouse Presidential suite which we were lucky enough to have taken a peek into - not overly huge but loverly with a fire place and a piano in the sitting area. Thus, with only one neighbour, suite 839 was a relatively quiet place to stay (that is, other than the occasional elevator noises, quite loud in the bathroom but not so in the bedroom). This suite was also directly next door to a terraced suite of the Hotel Hassler, since we could even see their chairs and tables on the terrace but we were propably paying a third of the Hassler's rates, for the same location and the same great views of old Rome. The views of Rome from the front terrace was simply magical as you could see as far as the St Peter's, Pantheon, Vittoria Emmanuel etc. Walk a few steps in the opposite direction, there is yet another terrace offering the view of the Borghese Gardens and of the Hotel De la Ville's beautiful internal courtyard. Simply wonderful!!! Like someone had said earlier about this hotel, the special features of the Hotel De la Ville are its great location and terraces' views. If you miss the suites with terrace, it would really be such a waste when you are in Rome, well, at least in my humble opinion. The canopied bed in the suite was simply a good King sized one, with an oh-so comfy mattress. We had a good two nights sleep here (22-24 Dec). Surprisingly, the bedroom area was not that huge for an Executive suite with terrace but good enough for a short stay. A big Philips TV and Kenwood Hi-fi system completes the picture. Breakfast was superb, since this is a big hotel, both choices and food quality were very good, they even had made-to-order pancakes, which I rarely see in hotels in Europe. Coffee was like plain water though, ask for an Expresso instead! Though the hotels' entrance and reception area are nothing to write home about, don't be fooled. Take a lift up to its second floor and you would soon realise its beauty lies very much within the hotel and not outside the hotel. The Restaurant La Piazzetta, the adjoining Bar area and the two courtyards (rare in Rome) are simply very mind calming in hectic Rome. Both foilage and fountain in the Courtyard are really beautiful, too. Now, about the small negatives. Even in an Executive suite, there was only one toilet with one sink, with no showers. This could easily waste some good 15-20 minutes every morning since only one person could use the toilet at any one time. And between the bedroom and the closet area and the toilet, there is a ''submerged portion'', which could act as a trap to unwitting guests. Be very careful, esp. going to the toilet late at night. In fact, we were only at this hotel for its terrace's views. The location is not one of the best in all of Rome. It is great for shopping though, if you are really into it. But prices on luxury items are not cheap by European standards and contrary to what was written in tour guide books, there was no Christmas sales ....sales only starts from January 6th, we were told! Facing the Spanish Steps could also mean its not the quiestest place to sleep. But fortunately, we were on a very high floor and the beds were very comfortable, that is why we had slept a good solid 8 hours before our 13 hour flight back to Singapore. If I were to stay at this hotel again, I wouldn't mind opting for an Executive Junior suite with terrace to courtyard views, hopefully , for more peace and quiet. About restaurants, we asked where we could have an oven baked pizza and the conceirge had pointed us to a Le Grotta nearby. Pizzas there were great, but its 10 euros per plate of antipasto, and its beautiful decor are what really makes this restaurant a cut above the rest. Overall, the Intercontinental De La Ville is a really good value, good quality hotel in a central shopping area. If you book one of its bigger rooms (the complaints here seems to be from those who book their cheapest/smallest room category), you are unlikely to be disappointed. I felt that by choosing this hotel, we really got our money's worth, though not always the case in expensive Rome. Last but not the least, our special thanks to Maura from the Reservation Dept. He has given us a good ending to our wedding anniversary celebrations on this 8 days Grand tour of Italy (Florence, Venice, Siena and Rome). Enjoy ....

Reviews.Title: “Viva Rome!”
Reviews.Author: antonella1
Reviews.Content: My son who is 11 years old and I stayed here this summer. What I loveed most was that it felt very safe. We were situated right on top of the Spanish steps and could walk to all the sights. Great shopping all around. If you go make sure you get your breakfast included otherwise its big bucks!! Breakfast was amazing, it seemed more like a lunch buffet and not breakfast. The staff was so helpful. Lots of english speaking people stay here so you feel very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Wedding Experience at the De La Ville”
Reviews.Author: TheHatts
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the wonderful Intercontinental De La Ville in July 2006. We stayed in one of the rooms which had a magnificent 180° view of Rome (Room 726). Where from the amazing balcony, which is full with flowers, table & chairs and sunloungers you have the perfect views of the Vatican and most of the other important monuments Rome has to offer. The balcony is such a lovely place, especially at night, that my girlfriend and I got engaged (it was planned but I couldn’t have hoped for a better setting). The hotel is in the perfect location at the top of the Spanish Steps and within walking distance or a metro ride away from everything. We loved Rome and the hotel so much that this September we got married in Rome and held our Wedding Reception at the hotel. This is where the hotel went above and beyond their duties. They did everything they possibly could to make our wedding day the best day ever. They arranged all the tables and seating plan and even gave us the same room (726). One member of the party was pregnant and was given a comfy lounger to sit on for the meal and throughout the night. The entire staff worked miracles but two people stood out for us and will always be remembered for all their hard work and attention they gave us and these were Domenico (Food & Beverage Manager) and Giacomo (Duty Manager). They both made it seem that my Wife and I were the only two people staying at the hotel. They were always on call for us. The morning after the wedding they arranged to say goodbye to us as we departed on our honeymoon. You really couldn’t stay in a better hotel or have better members of staff looking after you. Dominco and Giacomo if you read this - thanks again for everything. Hotel Intercontinental De La Ville we will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: bakfar
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right next to the Hassler at half the price but with exceptional staff friendliness and helpfulness. Superb concierge, especially a young man named Christian who recognized our likes and headed us in the perfect direction. The staff is general is very attentive and very considerate. Had the Dollar been in better shape the hotel would have been a bargain. I heartily recommend it for service and civility

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in Rome--Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: 206kjg
Reviews.Content: We spent more than a week at this well located hotel in Rome. My wife and I travelled with our 2 year old and 3 month old baby and were very concerned about the accomodations. We need not have been. From the front desk to the conceirge to the doormen and the rest of the staff, we were treated like family. They catered to our every needs and made us feel truly welcomed to an overwhelming city where we could not speak the language. The rooms were spacious, especially for Europe, clean and comfortable. Lest you think they cater just to families, take note that we had several other family members at the hotel who shared our experience. The hotel is well located near the Spanish Steps and an easy walk to Via Veneto, Trevi Fountain and several other attractions. When we return to Italy, we will definitely stay at this fantastic hotel again. We can't say enough about how great this hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the De La Ville”
Reviews.Author: Lawman113
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Rome and to the Intercontinental De La Ville Hotel. The hotel has an old world charm that surrounds you as soon as you check in. Although we had only been there once before, we were greeted like old friends. The staff is super friendly and extremely helpful. Everyone, from doorman to Concierge and Manager are only too happy to accomodate each guest's special requests and make their stay as pleasant as possible. The rooms are beautifully appointed and have all the modern conveniences. Room rates are very reasonable for a hotel of this quality, an important consideration given the ever increasing value of the Euro in relation to the Dollar. The location of the hotel is wonderful, being less than half a block from the Spanish Steps. All in all the De La Ville was a wonderful experience and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: BNGrays
Reviews.Content: I was a it nervous about this hotel because of some of the reviews on Tripadvisor.com. I booked a hotel on priceline and the Intercontinental De La Ville is what I got. This is a wonderful hotel. The location is great. The hotel sits at the top of the Spanish Steps. The rooms were small but that is to be expected of hotels in Europe. We did have a full bath in our room, a closet and a dresser and a french doors that opened to a view (called a balcony). More than all of that was thes staff. I was traveling with a group of women, 2 infants, and a 4 year old. The staff at the hotel was more than accomodating. There was always someone willing to help us. We never had to wait outside for a taxi. The staff arranged a tour for us as well as transportation. On our dparture from Rome, one employee in paticular (and I didnt get his name) was absolutely wonderful. He arranged our transportation to the airport. He really made sure that we were taken care of and that there was enough room for all of us. I read many of the bad complaints about this hotel before I went. None of them came to fruition on my trip. I have nothing but rave reviews about this hotel. I will say that it is quite expensive if not booked on priceline. If I wind up in Rome again, I will absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: LAURENTHParis
Reviews.Content: If you’re about to spend one day, one week end or one week in Rome in one of the most romantic and beautiful hotel of the eternal city, consider going to the Intercontinental. We are returning guests of this hotel for more than three years, and we love it as much that we have organised our weddings there last September (although we are French !!). Of course, in this hotel you are in the right to expect all the Intercontinental standards of quality. But you will find much much more : - An absolutely fabulous location:near Piazzia di Spagna in the very heart of the city and in walking distance to the major monuments of Rome (and shops). - The hotel has a breathtaking view of the city : you have an amazing 180° view of Rome and many of rooms have wonderful terraces. Terraces are the very plus of the hotel. - Restaurants and bar are reasonable with a fantastic cuisine. - All the staff of the hotel work hard to make your stay the memorable (I’am travelling a lot and I have never been as welcomed than this hotel. So do not hesitate, stay at this hotel, especially for a romantic occasion. Once you have been there, you will inevitably come back.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Dream”
Reviews.Author: jmiers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinenal De La Ville for 5 nights starting October 14, 2007. We were in Italy for our Honeymoon. The hotel was wonderful. A lot of people put negative reviews about the hotel because they probably stayed in the standard rooms. Of course in Italy a standard room will be small and relatively simple. We booked the Executive Junior Suite with a court yard view and when we arrived they upgraded us to the Executive Suite (Room 839). The room was wonderful, the bed was comfortable, had a full size walk in closet, spacious bathroom with all the amenities. The best treat of the room was the balcony. The balcony was enormous with beautiful flowers and plants on the perimiter. Since the hotel is near the top of the Spanish Steps the street the hotel is located on is much higher than the surrounding city so we had sweeping views of the entire city. From our balcony we could see the pantheon and St. Peters. It was a special treat. The hotel also had a bottle of Champagne waiting on us when we arrived to our room. As everyone says the location is great. From the front of the hotel the Spanish Steps are about a 45 second walk. We also walked to the Colloseum, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, etc. It is also about a 5 minute walk from the Metro. We would definately stay there when we return to rome. The staff was all friendly with the exception of one of the older concierges. We did not try the hotel restaurant. Wonderful stay if you can can upgrade from the standard rooms. Internet access 9 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Needs service-minded staff and major refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: baburshah
Reviews.Content: Stayed there as I had a two-for one-night voucher from Inter.Continental to use. Staff does not care about the guests, guestrooms are old and small and would be in a need of a major refurbishment as would the common parts of the hotel. The location, however, is amazing, just a few steps from the Spanish Steps. Go somewhere else if you want service and luxury accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again, A Fantastic Experience.”
Reviews.Author: caligirls
Reviews.Content: my fall trip to italy began with a stay at the de la ville..to the point, this hotel continues to meet all of my needs... the hotel is centrally located at the top of the spanish steps, which provides picture-perfect views and easy access to all that rome has to offer ...service is on the spot...my room is always ready and waiting (thank you giacomo and marco!), the concierge staffed with multi-lingual, knowledgeable and efficient, pleasant people...really, i haven't come across an employee who isn't polite and ready to give me great service...with the dollar as weak as it is right now, i appreciate the value of this hotel...until i'm proved wrong, i can honestly say that this is the best hotel for service and value in all of rome..

Reviews.Title: “Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: JAZ425
Reviews.Content: After staying at another large hotel chain in Florence and Venice, I was really disappointed in the Intercontinental. Our room was a deluxe room and although small it was a nice room. However it was directly below the roof top lounge, which when it closed they moved the wrought iron furniture constantly across the floor. Making our room very noisy from about 11 p.m til 1 a.m. Complaining did no good. I found the front desk staff and concierge not as helpful as the other large hotel chain. Seemed disinterested, possibly because we used points to book this hotel. Probably would not return to this hotel if in Rome again

Reviews.Title: “Very quite and relaxing courtyard”
Reviews.Author: beachman77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Deluxe room with a large patio for a couple of nights. The lobby manager was helpful, but I didn't see much of the concierge while we were there. As other reviewers have noted, everything comes with a price at this hotel. The room was small but the courtyard patio was a nice place to relax in the early morning. As an Ambassador member, I didn't see much value in staying at the InterContinental De La Ville. I will probably stay someplace else the next time I come to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel fab location”
Reviews.Author: Haworths
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel, ideal location at the top the Spanish steps, we used our priority points to stay, and again we were upgraded on arrival everyone was friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and quite large for Italy nice decor. Great views from the roof top bar and from our room which had a balcony over looking Rome. We stayed for our Wedding Anniversary and I would highly recommend this hotel, yes it is not cheap but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fine with some quibbles”
Reviews.Author: admnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed just over a week at the De La Ville in August, at the height of the heat and tourist onslaught. It was a generally good stay, but few things in this life are perfect. The room I had was small, but fine, and the rate, through Priceline, was good. I had requested a nonsmoking room with a king bed, and it was ready when I arrived in the late morning. That was great! The bathroom was large and well appointed. The room was smallish, but for a single person it was fine, with a good desk and reading chair. Linens and towels were wonderful. And the air conditioning was great -- easily adjustable, and a life saver in the hot Roman August afternoon. A few quibbles. 1) Location. Many reviewers love the location. I didn't. If you are primarily interested in the archaeology and museum aspect of Rome, as distinct perhaps from the shopping aspect, this is a fairly out of the way location. I was very happy that there is an elevator most of the way to the top at the entrance to the Spagna Metro station. There is nothing the hotel can do about this, but next time I will look for something a little more central. 2) Everything they can charge costs extra: No coffee maker, and expensive water, colas, etc. in the mini-bar. Breakfast buffet, bar and restaurant are likewise in the upper upper price range. Wifi is 23 Euros per day for unlimited access, 13 Euros for an hour (9 if you use the computer in the elevator lobby). 3) Housekeeping: Bed making and bathroom cleaning were efficient and well done, but I noticed that the same pieces of lint remained on the carpet throughout my stay, and that socks got very dirty walking on the carpet. I do not believe that it was vacuumed once while I was there. The carpets badly need professional deep cleaning. I can only imagine what they must be like on the smoking floors! 4) Room furnishing: The room had a closet with hangers, but no drawers or shelves to put clothes on, so one was forced to live out of one's suitcase. 5) Concierge: The concierge staff was almost always helpful, especially the older and more experienced ones, who gave good restaurant recommendations. However, I came down with a mild one-day-disabling food-induced stomach problem, identical to many that have been easily resolved with Pepto Bismol in the past. Of course, I had forgotten to bring it. So I, in some evident distress, asked the young concierge on duty where an open pharmacy might be. He described the location of one in detail. I went there, but did not find it. I had to backtrack and search through the Spagna area to find one. It was evident that this younger concierge either did not have detailed knowledge of the area, or could not communicate it to me. The pharmacy I eventually found did not have Pepto Bismol, did not speak English, and my Italian was not adequate to the task. That was not the hotel's fault, of course. It was a very unpleasant day. Make a note: Bring your Pepto or Zantac or whatever with you!

Reviews.Title: “T & E New York, New York 10022”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkRoma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at this hotel and to say we were treated like royalty is an UNDERSTATEMENT. The staff ,especially the duty manager, Giacomo Pica, could not do enough for us. Their guest relations manager, Marco, answered all of our questions and was extremely helpful making all of our reservations. We intend to return to Rome this December and would not think of staying anywhere else. The rooms were beautifully appointed and the food was exceptional. We had cocktails every night before dinner on the top floor bar over looking the city....(try the watermelon cocktail). If you have the opportunity to visit this wonderful city, I can't recemmend this hotel strongly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: janesk
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location just steps away from the spanish steps and a metro stop. The room had a decent size and it was very clean and neat. Service was good, except with one bad experience we had with a concierge were he was rude and not helpful. I am not sure if I would stay here again as it is quite expensive and I'm not sure if it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: NY01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for two days in August. We did a quick trip to Rome and this hotel was perfect. The location is ideal, right at the top of the Spanish steps which is great for sightseeing and in the evening to wander into restaurants nearby. The hotel service was great. We arrived at 9am after flying through the night and they actually had a room ready for us, which was fantastic. The room was spacious, we were on the 5th floor. We enjoyed breakfast in the courtyard every morning, just a tip, eat the continental breakfast, it is a reasonable price and they have everything you could want... the concierge was very helpful with directions and recommendations. You must have a drink on the 6th floor terrace, even though the drinks are expensive, the view is worth it. All in all, we would definitely return to the hotel-- great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Eladnova
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental de la Ville for three nights. A family of four, we requested two adjoining rooms. We were given 515 and 516, not only adjoining, but contained within an alcove at the end of the corridor, with a private outer door. Both rooms were spacious, spotless and comfortable. A wonderful surprise was that one room had a tiny balcony with a wrought iron table and two chairs; the other had a larger enclosed patio overlooking the courtyard, with table and chairs and a chaise lounger. These were great places to cool off, relax and rest before dinner. The beds were firm but comfortable, with luxury sheets and snowy white duvets, leaving little doubt about cleanliness. Marble bathrooms were large, modern and clean, and the terry robes new and soft. There was internet availability, but at a cost, which I still think is cheap, but universal. There was no coffee maker - a disappointment. The breakfast buffet was extensive, and good, although not exceptional. The Intercontinental excels in two areas: the rooftop terrace, with its unparralleled view of Rome, and its location at the top of the Spanish steps. It is right next door to the Hassler, which costs twice as much. Its location meant most destinations could be reached on foot, and a host of wonderful restaurants were steps from the door. We will definitely stay here again, next time for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Professional Service, Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: opabillCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This hotel, staff, service and food all receive our highest rating and recommendation. And you can’t beat the location at the top of the Spanish Steps for ease of access to the major attractions, nightlife and the best of Rome shopping. My family of 5 stayed two nights in two rooms at this excellent hotel July 26-28, 2007. We arranged an early pre-cruise stay with 10 pieces of luggage, and I was concerned that due to our early 10AM arrival after a long flight from California, we would be too early and tired to enjoy the first day even though we had requested early check-ins and upgrades for adjoining rooms. The reception and concierge personnel could not be more professional, accommodating and friendly. We were treated like royalty. After seeing the upgrade available to us, my wife preferred the original beautiful courtyard view, while my son and his family elected for upgraded expansive city view on the 6th floor. They expedited the cleaning so we could freshen up and nap. And their excellent service to us extended to the week after our stay. When the concierge could not arrange to get Vatican City passes for us at the exact time on the following week when our ship would be back in the Rome port, he arranged for an outstanding discounted private tour of St. Peter’s and the Vatican for that day. Our guide met us at the train station and we had an excellent tour. This is a hotel and staff that understands professional service. We plan a return trip to Rome in 2009 and we plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: JSL98
Reviews.Content: I travel to Italy often for business and pleasure and always look forward to my arrival at this hotel. The staff is warm and welcoming and the concierge desk can arrange small miracles. Thr breakfast buffet is outstanding. The guest relations desk almost always sees that I get my favorite room and they know my preferences since I am there often. The location is fabulous at the top of the Spanish Steps. The rooms with terraces that face the city or the inner courtyard are a special treat. It is worthwhile to become an Ambassador member for the benefits of late check out, room upgrades, welcome fruit & water and a free weekend night certificate. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: day1
Reviews.Content: Like others here, I had mixed expectations of this hotel and especially of its staff. From our experience, we had a nice room on the 4th floor with a small balcony overlooking the lovely terrace below. Beautiful window boxes of geraniums everywhere. The room was very small, but adequate. Quiet. Could use a few fabric updates. Bath was small. The staff was very nice and attentive. I never felt out of place or that I was being "made fun of". Quite the opposite in all cases. The concierge desk made every effort to be helpful and addressed us by name each time. The breakfast buffet was fine. We were in Rome during extreme heat, and our room was always comfortable. Enjoyed the terrace upstairs for pre-dinner cocktails. The view is nice...the DJ music too loud and too American pop/disco. The only reason I would not stay here next time is because I'd like to be in a different area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kakalina10
Reviews.Content: Overall the De La Ville was a nice hotel in a good location. The rooms were cramped but we had a lovely patio overlooking the restaraunt. The staff was a bit disappointing. They seemed to be laughing behind the guests back whenever someone had a question. I witnessed this several times. I got the impression they were making fun of the Americans. The rooms are overpriced for what you get and they could use a little updating with paint and a thorough cleaning. There is a great restaraunt across the street with great food and even greater help and reasonably priced. Sit outside on the patio and take in the ambience. The hotel is located atop the Spanish Steps and very near the shopping area and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Another impeccable stay at the de la Ville”
Reviews.Author: johnnie_r
Reviews.Content: I sometimes wonder if I stay at the same hotel as some other reviewers as I have never had anything other than exceptional service from this hotel. I will state that I have Ambassador status and that I always book at least a Junior Suite but we have always been treated like Royalty be the staff. I should also add that we are regular visitors to the hotel staying five times last year. Thishotel enjoys LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION - at the top of the Spanish Steps with amazing city views from the higher floors - and that is why it can command a premium price. And just so readers now in the past month I have stayed in a suite on the Club Floor at the Ritz Carlton San Francisco and in a Bellagio Suite in Vegas so I can judge top end hotels based on American experience. The decor is exactly what you expect from a quality Roman hotel, bathrooms are marble with plenty of towels and toiletries, rooms are light and airy with Roman motifs in the paitings. The bed has always been super comfortable and turndown service has been available (unless we were in the room with a Do Not Disturb sign on) when Housekeeping could be contacted directly to do so as we left. We love this hotel and want the world to know it!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing 5 Stars about this place”
Reviews.Author: lsjhk
Reviews.Content: So, we all know that traveling in Europe we need to knock off at least a star compared to their North American counterparts. Well, this hotel is no different. A three star failing hotel, way past its heyday is the best way to describe this place. The first room on the 7th floor was so tiny I demanded a new room, which was finally granted after hours arguing with their less than polite manager, Pico. My new room was also tiny, but had a nice outdoor area. The staff was cold and unhelpful, other than one nice young man at the concierge desk and one lovely young woman who delivered items from housekeeping. You can do way better than the overpriced Intercontinental in Rome if you look hard enough. The place also had a strange smell to it which eventually I became accostomed to. The location was quite good although the entrance to the hotel is rather bizarre as there is barely any room to exit the taxi on a little strip of sidewalk. Overall, I felt ripped off at this overpriced, unfriendly hotel with tiny rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: nan-TRIP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the InterContinental in Rome during the last week of June 2007. We were familiar with the InterContinental brand from the property in NYC and therefore had high expectations. These were fueled by the price of the rooms in Rome. Unfortunately, the InterContinental in Rome did not meet our expectations and proved a poor value for what we paid. Our check-in involved a long wait, ostensibly because of a new electronic system. The lobby seemed chaotic with many guests checking in at once and too few (very conscientious and hard-working) bellmen to help. The room (a superior double) was comfortably spacious for 2 adults but seemed "tired" and in need of a refurbishment. The marble bathroom was quite large, up to date, well appointed with top-shelf amenities, and plentifully supplied with towels. The room was serviced only once a day, a drawback considering that an evening shower is essential before dinner at the end of a full day of sightseeing in the Roman summer heat. However, the bathroom and bedroom were kept spotless by the cleaning staff. The bed was a real back-breaker. My husband and I both had considerable back pain in the morning, and we are in reasonably good physical shape. Our room faced the interior courtyard. One night there was a dinner event in the courtyard that went on until after 1:00 am and kept us awake. The dinner guests were extremely loud. A call to the desk had no effect. I was amazed that the hotel booked a large, noisy party for that hour in a public area. I agree with other reviewers that the music on the roof terrace is a terrible distraction from the glorious view of Rome at night--including St. Peter's all aglow in the distance. We also agree with reviewers who found the desk staff unfriendly and unhelpful. Two caveats: first, the hotel was overrun with rude and demanding Americans accompanied by their teenagers-with-attitude, so one can understand why the desk personnel might be a bit cold against such an onslaught. Second, the bellmen, doormen, and jr concierge staff were very friendly and helpful, despite being obviously overworked. One wonders whether the imposition of US management practices (eg, lean staffing) is a factor in the shortcomings of this property, since an Italian-owned hotel in the 4-5 star range where we stayed in Florence had none of these drawbacks. On the plus side: the location is excellent. On the minus side: the breakfast buffet is exactly the same every day, so there's no variety for guests staying for a week (as we did) with the breakfast-inclusive rate. Also, this hotel hosts cruise ship passengers, so at times it resembles a ferry terminal. If I were to visit Rome again, I would look for a smaller hotel closer either to the Via Venetto or the ancient part of the city. The InterContinental was OK, but not a good value for the euro.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location but high in price”
Reviews.Author: hondast1100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early June of 2007. First trip to Rome and found this to be an ideal location. Hotel was very clean and the staff were more than happy to help or serve. Concierge was very helpful with baggage and a minor emerency we encountered. When we arrived our room was not yet ready and the hotel desk clerk gave us a credit for drinks on the patio. Once again, staff was excellent. My only complaint was I thought for the money one could probably do better, then again, this is Rome and it seemed everything was expensive. Overall it was a nice place to stay but next trip to Rome I'll try and find something nearby that isn't so pricey. Thumbs Up - Rooms were decent size, clean and important for us, quiet. - Appearance, and just the hotel itself (courtyard) was very historical and pleasing to the eye. - Close to Spanish steps and many must see Roman attractions (Trevi Fountain). Beware of rose giving non-italians at the Spanish steps, they just want your money, tell them to take their rose and get lost and eventually they will stop pestering you and your significant other. - Hike up the hill past the Spanish Steps and continue up the hill to the Villa Borgesi for an outstanding view of the Vatican and a relaxing park. - View from hotel roof restaurant/cafe is also worth a look. - Close to all kinds of shopping. Thumbs Down - Our breakfast experience at the hotel restaurant was unpleasant. Wait staff took forever to serve us and the food left little to be desired. Then add to that being way over priced for what you got. My advice, there are plenty of other places nearby. - Pricey and expensive room. - Would have been nice to have coffee in the room or in the hotel lobby in the early mornings.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay”
Reviews.Author: 050710d
Reviews.Content: We used Priority Club points to book our 2 connecting rooms for our family. The rooms were on the small side but that is generally what I would expect in a city like Rome. The bathrooms were nice & the air conditioning worked well so we were comfortable. The decor was definitely tired & the view to the street looked directly at a building covered in scaffolding & was a bit dark. There is a lovely large marble staircase going up thru the hotel (as well as elevators). We were content since we were able to stay for free but I think it seems pricey for what it is. Service was friendly. Location good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but they charge for everything”
Reviews.Author: spydergs1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. The rooms were very small and they charge you for everything. They charge 23 euros a day for internet access in your room and 3.50 euro to make a toll free call. The room rate was very high in comparison to what you get out of this hotel. I would much rather stay at the Marriott Grand Flora next. It is a much better hotel and value.

Reviews.Title: “thanks to pamela at the above hotel she made our stay”
Reviews.Author: icamillo
Reviews.Content: recently i booked a 6 night stay at the hotel de la ville in rome italy and was promised a room with a balcony and breakfast included in the price, i booked this through intercontinental hotels and resorts and was not smart enough to make them confirm what they promised in the email confirmation, consequently when i got to the hotel you can imagine my disappointment when i was not given what i was expecting. thanks to pamela the guest hostess, she gave me an upgrade on the room and went out of her way to make sure that our stay was the best it could be under the circumstances. thanks pamela

Reviews.Title: “Very tired hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: partyplannerLondon
Reviews.Content: Very tired hotel but in a superb location. It is in dire need of refurbishment throughout. The rooms are small and the ones facing the street are very dark and extremely noisy despite the double glazing! You could not swing a cat in the bathroom - very awkward design and mould on the walls. No room to put your toiletries. The staff were unbeleivably stuck up and very unhelpful unless you keep tipping them. If you dont tip - then dont expect service! Arrogant faces and not a single member of staff smiled!! Definitely would not recommend and not worth the money. Watch the breakfast tariff - if you have fruit, you will be charged 12 euros per person!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: city_ambler
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel and had an excellent time, could not fault the attention and service from the staff. We used our ambassador free night and got a room upgrade to a suite with an excellent view - the night we paid for was pricey but balanced over the 2 nights we stayed gave good value. All in all an excellent choice ideally located at the top of the Spanish steps with a metro station close by and all major sites within walking distance. Our second day had poor weather but this did not spoil our trip we just borrowed an umberella from the concierge and ventured out in the rain We hope to return and would not hesitate to use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Far better hotels in price range than this”
Reviews.Author: AVeryPickyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Upon checking into the Intercontinental Hotel in Rome on the top of the Spanish steps, I was not wowed the way I was with some other proprties I stayed in on my trip to Italy. I used my rewards nights points to stay at this hotel, so I cannot complain about the price of my stay. However, seeing the rates the hotel charges ... had I paid even half of the rates that were listed on even the discount websites I would have been angry as this hotel is nothing really special. I believe the rates for May were around 400 Euro per night ... maybe down into the 300 Euro ranges for some of the smaller rooms. I of course, got a small room because although I am a platinum member ... they had no upgrades for me ... probably because I didn't pay $125 to join their Intercontinental Hotels Ambassador program ... which guarentees an upgrade. (another traveler told me that this 'upgrade' is sometimes just a higher floor and is not worth the money. The room was small ... expected for Rome ... had nice furnishings and a window, which looked out on the small patio area. If you get a room which looks over the patio area ... switch rooms (if you can)!!! There is a bar out there that is open until 2 a.m. and you can clearly hear loud talking and then the loud noises of the staff dragging the heavy metal furniture around at closing. They said the hotel was full and they could not move me. There is a BEAUTIFUL terrace on the 6th floor which overlooks the entire city of Rome. They call this the 'Emperor's Terrace' This would be an ideal place to have a cigar or cigarette or just relax and read a book. The catch is that they lock the terrace anytime that there is not a bartender outside who charges you 10 Euros to make you a weak drink. You cannot go outside on this terrace to look at the view unless you buy a drink ... which means it is only open from late afternoon to early evening. What a shame as this would be such a beautiful area to enjoy a view without paying 10 Euro per drink and listening to a bad guitarist. There is no club lounge at this hotel ... many Intercontinental hotels have club lounges where you can relax, get a free newspaper and evening h'orderves.
