It is clear that this hotel is all about getting your money (even after you overpay for the quality of the room) and gives you nothing other than the mass produced slippers in the bathroom (where you literally can bearly sit on the toilet because it is wedged in between the sink and the wall ... it is literally comical.) All in all, this was not a bad hotel. It was not a good hotel. There are several 'non-name' brand hotels within a few miles which would offer similar service and decor at half the price. If you want much better accomodations, they are there for the same price. The location of being at the top of the Spanish steps and right next to Via Veneto is great ... however I was dissapointed that the Spanish steps is full of drunken 14 year olds and counterfeit bag salesmen past 10 o'clock at night. Also ... WATCH OUT FOR THE CAB DRIVERS WHO HANG OUT BY THIS HOTEL! Mine pretended to be lost in order to bump the ride up by 5 Euros and then magically remembered the way. This is a good hotel to use your rewards points to stay at ... but if you are paying for the stay, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Marianne444
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3-night stay at the Intercontinental de la Ville. We booked through Priceline and paid $345 US (not 345 euros!) per night. Considering the prices in Rome, this is a fair price for this hotel. We definitely wouldn't consider this to be a good value if we had paid the usual rate. Our room was quite small (as expected), and had two twins pushed together. It was weary looking as other reviewers have stated. The bathroom was very nice, although again quite small. The beds were extremely comfortable though. We had drinks on the rooftop restaurant. Very expensive, although not anymore than the little cafes in any of the piazzas. The staff was quite nice, although we didn't ask for much (other than directions). If we travel to Rome again, we'd definitely consider staying in an area with a little more night life like Trastevere or Campo di Fiori. We spent an evening in each and enjoyed ourselves immensely. Didn't eat in the restaurant so cannot comment on the food. Great little cafe called Pepys American Bar two blocks down for morning cappuccino, right on Piazza Barberini.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing! Overpriced and average service!”
Reviews.Author: Globbie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay at this hotel because he has recently joined its Priority Club. Personally I prefer modern and chic boutique hotels but I agreed to stay here because of all the privileges that we are supposed to get for being a member e.g. free movie each night and free newspaper in the mornings. However when we checked in, the manager at the reception was quite cold towards us, even though we were staying there for 6 nights and paying 365 euro per night. When we entered the room, it stank of cigarettes and there were 2 single beds instead of a double. We called the reception to see if there was another double-bed room available, they said they would check and get back to us, but they never did!! The next day there was no newspaper (we had to remind them later), and there was no mention of the free movies either. The concierge service was not great either because they were forever on the phone, so it was almost impossible to catch their attention. And when they are free, they would rather serve middle-aged men with big gold rings first than a younger and not-so-rich looking couple like us. However, there was a young and inexperienced concierge/bell boy who would always smile and help us whenever he saw us. The hotel itself has a very convenient and central location, but the rooms are quite small and tired looking. We were lucky to get a room with a balcony facing the courtyard, so it was nice to open the doors and let the sun in sometimes. The bar downstairs was quite nice but unfortunately the restaurant was not up to standard, which was quite a shame esp. when there are so many good restaurants in Rome. My wine was off and my husband's starter was semi-frozen, fortunately the manager was very professional and he apologised sincerely for all the faults. It was a very disappointing meal and we really regretted staying in that evening! On the whole, we think the hotel is overrated, the rooms are in need for renovation and the service was quite poor for the price you pay. This is not what we would expect from The Intercontinent chain. I think if you are over 50 and look rich, then you might get better service than we did, since we are not 50 yet, I doubt I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!!! agnele101@yahoo.com”
Reviews.Author: GAAtlanta
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment!!! My husband and I stayed there 3 nights in August 2006 for our honeymoon. The service was horrible. First, I e-mailed the hotel concierge numerous times before our trip asking certain questions and asking for a nicer room since it was our honeymoon. My inquiries were flatly ignored, never got a single response. Mind you, I e-mailed them in English AND Italian. Second, once we arrived, we were stuffed into what looked like a prison cell. So much for the honeymoon romance . Keep in my, my husband is a Platinum Member with the priority club, so we really expected a good treatment. Literally, there was no space to even turn around. I understand that the building is old and yada yada yada. I am myself originally from Europe and was not expecting a room with the “American proportions.” However, this room was super tiny and definitely something completely opposite from a honeymoon dream room. Finally, after numerous inquiries we were moved to a larger room, which still was not great. Third, the staff was snobbish and unprofessional. There are NO alarm clocks in the rooms, so we had to place a wake up call every day. One time they failed to call us, and because of that we were running late to a guided tour in Vatican. After much argument, the staff finally called us a cab and paid for it so we could make it to the tour. Moreover, my husband needed an internet access for one day. The concierge quoted him one price, but when there was time to pay, we go a bill for of course a much larger amount. Granted, the location is good if this is your first visit to Rome and you are staying only 3-4 nights in Rome. I do not think it is worth though shedding over $500 per night for a prison cell, especially since you are out sight-seeing all day. Our honeymoon was saved because we stayed the other 2 nights at Hilton Cavallieri Hotel in Rome. The Cavallieri is a heaven on earth and this is where we will stay next time when in Rome. I would advise anyone to stay away from the De La Ville. It was very very disappointing experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Honu_Ohana
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our trip, to allow a little time to see the historic areas and catch a morning flight home. I chose the InterContinental for its location, because we had enjoyed the Madrid property, and because of TA reviews/forum comments. It served its purpose admirably, but I'd say the quality and value were not quite equal to the Madrid property. Rome can be a very expensive place--more so than Hawaii (site of many sticker shock comments in other TA forums I frequent). We booked and prepaid several monthis in advance, via the InterContinental website. I'd noticed that this property did not guarantee "nonsmoking" rooms, so after I made the reservation I called InterContinental's reservations number and inquired...they put in a "medical request" for a nonsmoking room with special cleaning (asthma). When we arrived, the desk clerk said our room was not quite ready because it was undergoing 'deep cleaning for the medical request' and suggested we have a complimentary drink and come back in 40 minutes. The rooftop bar was not open (it was about 2 PM), so we went to the nice 2nd-floor terrace area and had our drinks. The room was ready when promised...smallish but acceptable for 2 people, with a tiny balcony overlooking a not-very-scenic inner courtyard. The main "flaw" in the room is common to the InterContinental chain's furniture--too few drawers for clothing. The room was exceptionally clean and fresh smelling (carpets had been shampooed) and the housekeeping was immaculate during our stay. The hotel was quiet, felt very safe, and had good service. The concierge had taken a while (with apology) to get back to us on our emails for restaurant reservation requests but we did get our first choices and the reservations were in good order. The second floor restaurant breakfast was 33 euros for the buffet, or about 20 euros for the "continental." However, it was good variety and quality, if not a super value. The morning we left we had very early room service (add 10 euros for delivery) and ate on our terrace; service was timely and the food was good. If we had stayed longer or had only wanted a light breakfast (we skip lunch, so the expensive buffet was a decent expenditure compromise) we would have explored the nearby cafes. The weak point from our perspective (did not bring laptop on this trip) was that the "business services" had only one computer for use (oversubscribed) and you had to pay for and use access time in 30-minute blocks (no saving time to use later). I think the time block system may be an artifact of Italian Internet laws, because the clerk here mentioned they had to record our passport number and time of use... The hotel is close to the elite shopping district down at the foot of the Spanish Steps (looked, did not buy) and a nice walk via the Trevi Fountain to the Forum, etc. We were happy to find out that it was still "free week" for the monuments (we had gone to Pompeii and Herculaneum on "free week" earlier in the trip). It is a short walk to the Borghese Gardens, for strolling or running. Overall, was pleased with the hotel but might try a different location on another trip to Rome. Would definitely recommend it to someone looking for a clean, comfortable, quality place with good service near the Steps and the Borghese Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrity status has not gone to their head”
Reviews.Author: URBANPAINTMAN
Reviews.Content: Having hosted most of the accomodations for the guests of Tom and Kate's wedding extravaganza I know why this hotel was chosen for this high profile crowd. First it has a location unsurpassed in all of Roma including the Hassler which doesn't have the terrace suites that the De La Ville has. This is the kind of room my wife and I have enjoyed during our recent stay this year and also 2 years ago. Lounging on our terrace overlooking all of Rome is a memorable experience. Also what makes any stay at any place are the people and the staff at this hotel are exceptional from the door men to the front desk, to the concierge and special cudos to the guest relation desk with Pamela and Marco who are there to see that your every need is taken care of. We are truely looking forward to returning to the De La Ville next time with our whole family.

Reviews.Title: “As you would expect for an Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: nwtraveller2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a (very) extended long weekend, partly paid through Priority Club points and the rest with real money! As Ambassador Platinum Elite members, there was the usual separate check-in facilities and room upgrade - all done with very little fuss which made us feel quite at home immediately. The concierge staff were very good although they had not responded to an email I sent them a few days before the trip. Filippo helped us with a number of restaurant reservations and bookings for the Galleria Borghese. The hotel is very well located with well-kept rooms. We had an interesting problem with our bathroom, in that the water pressure from the in-built shower was very poor but that was the opposite with the shower head attached to the bath taps! Also note that the walls (and floors) can be a little thin. On a number of mornings, I was convinced my fellow guests from the next room was having a shower in my bathroom! Air-conditioning worked fine in our room and we didn't hear much of the street noise from the 4th floor with the windows shut. It was my birthday during our stay there and the hotel provided a cake, which we took up to the terrace on the 6th floor and indulged in a couple of glasses of champagne! A few tips if you are staying here - if you get tired of having to clamber up the Spanish Steps, there is a lift that is not very visible you could use. As you enter Spagna metro station from the bottom of the Spanish Steps, it located to the right. The best way to find it is to use the metro entrance at the top of the Spanish Steps, which is essentially only for access to the lift. Second tip is if, like us, your package does not include breakfast, do NOT eat at the Trinita cafe bar which is just down the road (Via Sistina) from the hotel. Twenty two Euros for two croissants, two coffees and a glass of orange juice. It's fine for a coffee at the counter but the moment you sit down at a table, the prices go through the roof. Instead, head down Via Sistina towards the Tritone Fountain. There is cafe bar there called Pepys with the most visually stunning display of sandwiches in the windows. Plus coffee at the counter for 1.50 euros! We opted for brioches and coffees from McDonalds - meant we had space for massive lunches and dinners ;-)

Reviews.Title: “The home I wish I had in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tawanda50
Reviews.Content: If it is your first time in Rome or returning , the Intercontinental is what I consider a perfect home away from home. It is convenient to everything ( close to the Spanish steps). The property is historic but impeccably clean .When you stay there you feel like you are really in Rome . Size wise, it was small enough to be cozy but big enough to have everything you want under one roof. This is no chain. I imagine this is what it is like to be a guest in a priveleged Italian's home. Special You don't even need to go off the property to eat and drink because the hotel has such fantastic food. Why leave ? Have a cocktail overlooking Rome from the upstairs terrace bar. The courtyard restaurant was comfortable and elegant at breakfast , lunch or dinner. The food - the service- magnifico !!! Most importantly, the staff paid very close attention to every detail to ensure our comfort and safety. I totally appreciate ,Giacomo Pica, for personally seeing us into our cabs to make sure we were in good hands. It just doesn't get any better than this. My whole trip to Rome was especailly wonderful because the Intercontinental De La Ville Roma was home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BlakeNyc
Reviews.Content: We spent many hours researching the best place to stay in Rome for our one week Spring holiday with my family of five. Our children (ages 8, 13, 16) have traveled with us before to London and Paris quite successfully due in large part to the fact that we were able to find the right hotel. We have found that the best hotel for us should have the following characteristics: 1. Great location for walking to many of the sites we want to visit. 2. Great location for walking to nice, but less expensive restaurants. 3. Clean rooms and clean public areas of hotel. 4. Good room service for quiet breakfasts. 5. Helpful Concierge for making reservations/recommendations. 6. A feeling that children are welcome at the hotel, but the hotel isn't overrun by unsupervised children. 7. Huge tour groups do not take over the hotel. The Hotel de la Ville Intercontinental nicely met all of our criteria. The hotel is in a wonderful location at the top of the Spanish Steps and close to the park. The Steps get noisy and crowded with local teens at night, but the Hotel is not affected by the noise or crowds since it is set back a bit from the Steps. (These teens are well-behaved for the most part - this is just a place they seem to use a meeting place). There are many restaurants (and most importantly for kids, gelato stores) to choose from in walking distance and if you like to shop (we don't) there are many high-end shops at the base of the Steps. If you need a taxi from time to time there is a taxi stand nearby that normally has many taxis waiting for riders. You can have the Hotel grab one or go get one yourself. Since we have five people we needed a cab capable of taking five people (most cabs only take 4) and being close to a taxi stand was helpful in quickly finding a suitable cab. Arriving at the Hotel you will pehaps be surprised that there is no grand entrance - the Hotel is on a narrow street that requires the cab to pull up on the sidewalk to let you out. The lobby is also small and understated. If you are looking for a big, glitzy hotel you are at the wrong spot. The Hotel is instead intimate and quiet (the way we like it). The rooms are small (as most are in Rome), but clean and attractive. The bathrooms are small but upscale in fixtures and finishes. The public areas are clean and well-maintained. The main restaurant for breakfast and lunch is very nice, with room outside in a courtyard when the weather is warm. The Terrace was not available for use in March, so I cannot comment on it. The morning breakfast buffet is fantastic (although expensive if not already included in your room rate), and the room service is fast and nicely presented. The Concierge desk is a mix of personalities and levels of expertise. All of the Concierges were polite with good English skills. They arranged a tour guide for the Vatican (I called several days in advance of our arrival to arrange) and helped with dinner recommendations and reservations each night (only one suggestion was poor - a touristy spot with not much ambience). The overall feeling at the hotel was quite comfortable for a family- relaxed, no noise and commotion, and well-behaved young guests. Upon returning home I found out that a good friend had also recently stayed at this hotel with his family of four and they had also had am excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: travelfan199
Reviews.Content: Only stayed at the hotel one night. From check-in to check-out, the staff could not have been better. As a priority club member, I got upgraded to a suite which was fantastic, with a comfortable bed and large and spacious bathroom. The restaurant was superb for both Lunch and Breakfast (missed dinner because of large lunch!), although it was pricey as you would expect of a five-star chain hotel. The terrace on the sixth floor is also excellent, it is relaxing to have a drink on the terrace in the evening. The location is good too, the Spanish Steps are only about twenty seconds walk away. There were no negatives at this hotel at all that I could find!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great staff. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: spnslc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six night stay at the Intercontinental Rome. Our traveling party consisted of two couples. Each couple had a junior suite for the week and each of our suites were located on separate floors. I have stayed in many 5-star European hotels and this one was one of my favorites. The hotel location was not only great, but the rooms were clean and well-cared for, and this was despite the fact that the building (originally a convent) was 400 years old. Every five-star hotel I have stayed at in Europe has been “an antique," but this one was the cleanest and had the most friendly and helpful staff, by far. Staff members spoke perfect English (which wasn't the case with a five-star hotel we stayed at on a previous trip to Venice), which helped us a lot when asking for restaurant recommendations and directions, which we did multiple times a day. None of us could say enough about the concierge. Kudos to the hotel management for such a fine staff. Our room price included breakfast in the garden restaurant which was very good. We ate breakfast there every morning. The breakfast food selections included just about everything you could possibly think of to eat for breakfast. We had two "minor" problems during our stay at the Intercontinental. Our room was on the seventh floor, just under the executive suite. The executive suite has a grand piano in it, which when played, can be heard quite well in the junior suite below. Thankfully, we only had that "noise" problem one night and whomever played the piano stopped playing by 10:00 p.m. Other than that, both of our suites were very quiet. Also, on two mornings we awoke early (5:45 and 6:15 a.m.) to catch some early tours. Unfortunately, the hot water tank for our room wasn't quite awake, yet, and I ended up taking very quick, cold showers both mornings. A front desk staff member told me, "demand for hot water is a problem," but I don't know if it is just for that room, floor, or what. The other couple traveling with us stayed in a junior suite on the third floor and didn't experience a hot water demand problem at all. Other than that, we thought this was a great hotel and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JG_16
Reviews.Content: Following a few negative points in recent reviews, I was a littble bit concerned about our stay at his hotel. However I should not have been worried! We had an excellent 3 night stay. When we arrived our suite was not quite ready, however we were given a decent sized bedroom to change in, which had a small balcony. On our return to the hotel later we had a good sized suite (622) with a long balcony overlooking the whole ctiy. Very good! (We got the suite with a package that included breakfast for about the same price as a standard room, and used points for our final night). The only negative point, which has been mentioned on other reviews, was the lack of decent air con. It didn't really trouble our stay though! We only had breakfast once in the hotel, which was pretty good but not as amazing as at some other Intercontinental I have stayed in. I don't think i would have paid the €30. The terrace bar was very nice on the 6th floor for a drink in the sun after a hard day's sightseeing. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The location at the top of the Spanish Steps is near perfect, and we walked to the Vatican, Colleseum, Pantheon, Forum etc. The stairs were a bit of a challenge after a few glasses of Amarone, but nothing too major! All in all I would definitly recomend this hotel, and will be staying there myself again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, absolutely superb customer service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tshark
Reviews.Content: Short answer: Very good hotel, absolutely superb customer service, excellent location. We stayed there in April 2007, for Easter week, two adults and a 10 year old child. For our Italy trip, with stops in various cities, I priced hotels through various means, including consolidators like Expedia and Travelocity, certain smaller booking websites, and correspondence with the hotels directly (either by e-mail or telephone). In this particular case I found the best deal at the Intercontinental de la Ville Roma by booking directly with the hotel. Actually, when I telephoned the hotel, they told me that I could get an even better rate my making the reservation online at the hotel’s web site. I much appreciated that tip. The hotel is in a great location at the top of the Spanish Steps, and thus the metro stop is just a couple of minutes walk away. I had e-mailed the hotel that this was a special trip for my 10 year old daughter’s birthday, and requested that they assign us a nice room. For my daughter’s birthday, the hotel had upgraded us to an executive suite at no extra charge. The rooms bedroom and living room were a little small, but actually quite large by Rome standards. We also had a large balcony overlooking the city. Also, after we registered and went up to the room, we had not even been in the room for 20 minutes when a waiter appeared with a birthday cake for my daughter and a bottle of champagne on ice for us, sent by the hotel manager. Then the manager telephoned a bit later to wish my daughter happy birthday, and to offer his personal services for anything else we might need. The next day the manager sent us another bottle of champagne on ice with his best wishes for an enjoyable visit. A couple of evenings later, when we happened to run across the manager, and thanked him for his consideration, he invited us up for a drink at a quiet hotel bar. Also, on our first evening, we asked the manager if it was possible to get tickets for Easter services in the Vatican (barely 12 hours later). He thought it was impossible but was then able to secure them for us! The hotel has an extremely nice restaurant, with a great menu. The breakfast service is quite extensive. There is an interior shaded courtyard which is a great place for a drink or afternoon tea. There is also a rooftop terrace restaurant and bar with a great view over the city. On a final personal note, we arrived by rental car. I have driven in large cities all over the world and usually enjoy the challenge. Rome is, by far, the most difficult city for driving that I have ever experienced. Quite stressful!

Reviews.Title: “Take Care!”
Reviews.Author: mcvm
Reviews.Content: Regular hotel, good service, nice but small rooms.Take care: it's a noisy street , a hot city and dispite its web site advise that the rooms are provided of "Indiviadually controlled air condicioned" they don't have air condioner in the rooms at all but only heating.

Reviews.Title: “overrated”
Reviews.Author: stdominic
Reviews.Content: Hotel has great potential unfortuantely we did not get to experience this. Our dingy small room was in need of renovating or at least painting! Hotel rooms in the courtyard looked fantastic. As we are ambassador members we felt slighted. I would suggest to anyone booking this hotel to call the hotel directly and speak with the guest relations advisor to ensure you are pleased with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pjatravel
Reviews.Content: The staff were wonderful and accomodating. A portion of the trip was booked as business and the weekend was personal. No worries with sorting out the charges at the end of the trip. Naturally, the location is wonderful. But, try getting around with an infant as well! The staff were helpful for tips on the side roads for the pram. The entire restaurant staff was incredibly helpful with breakfast and dinner with our little man. We couldn't have asked for more. It was almost sad to say Ciao and Arrivederci to our new found part-time nannies. Afternoons in the American bar with the baby crawling all over the place and just the 3 of us having drinks (of course, the baby was having a milk) was so much fun. Rome is charming and the staff at this hotel were even more so.

Reviews.Title: “Caring staff & sensational Penthouse Suite”
Reviews.Author: Divertirsi
Reviews.Content: I generally don't like to focus on issues, but it is important for people to be aware. We booked, confirmed and reconfirmed an Executive Suite with lounge/bedroom areas separated by a door. Given that our 1 year old baby was travelling with us on this trip I made sure I reconfirmed our requirements a number of times. When we arrived at the hotel we were told that we had standard suite on the 3rd floor, as they said their executive suites didn't have doors. Prior to arriving we were told by the Intercontinental Central Reservations that they had an executive floor on level 7 and that would be the location of our room. We also had an email from Guest Relations confirming an Executive suite with one bedroom and a separate sitting room with door. We were a little disappointed that this was not going to be the case, but thought that the room would be lovely nonetheless. When we did get to access to our room, we were again disappointed. While it was a relatively spacious room, it was rather dark and unimpressive, but the most disappointing aspect was that there was no door separating the lounge and bedroom areas. I explained the situation to Guest Relations and was told that no other suite with a door separating the lounge and bedroom areas was available at the moment, except for the Penthouse Suite. We discussed the very limited options within the hotel and were told that if anything suitable did come up during our stay, then we could move. I was just about to call Amex Concierge to book another hotel when we received a call from Guest Relations to say that we had been upgraded to the Penthouse Suite which had a door separating the lounge/bedroom areas. This situation was unnecessary given that we reconfirmed our booking and requirements a number of times. In saying this, however, the outcome was very positive. The Penthouse Suite was truely sensational and was really, very beautiful, with incredible views over Rome from the large terrace, a grand piano and chandelier in the lounge room, a gorgeous bathroom with spa bath and a very comfortable bedroom. On our first afternoon our baby had a fall and had to be rushed to hospital. I do have to say that the care and professionalism of the hotel during and following this incident was outstanding and we could not be more thankful. The upgrade to the Penthouse Suite and the assistance from the hotel concierge definitely helped to make our overall experience with the hotel very positive. All concierge and front desk staff were helpful and courteous throughout our stay, in particular, Pamela from Guest Relations and Roberto from the concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jason2375
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel towards the end of Feb 2007. The hotel enjoys an excellent location, and the staff were very helpful, guiding us to many sites and restaurants in the city. Be prepared to hike up the Spanish Steps each day however! Only gripe would be that the lobby and bar did not appear open until early evening. We tried to get a drink after a hard days walking and could only find the bar area occupied by a business group. Overall an excellent choice, and would certainly stay again if in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant well-sited hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davidius
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here to use Priority Club Reward Points for the first three nights. We were allocated a Classic room-which means a run of the house according to availability. We had been upgraded to a larger room in this category, as a platinum member. This is the good thing about Priority Club--it actually works without blackout dates! The room was on the first floor and so we had to keep the double glazed windows closed to avoid street noise. However, the air con worked perfectly and quietly. The room was well-equipped with a good-size bathroom and all the extras. We had also booked and paid for a luxury package, including breakfast for the final two nights. Reception tried to allocate us the de luxe room intended for the last two days, for the whole week but the hotel was full and this proved impossible. Nevertheless, they tried hard. Reception and concierge staff were friendly and helpful throughout the stay. Can't understand the previous comment about tired carpets etc--the public areas and bedrooms are fine. This is not a modern Shangri-la but it is a very pleasant place to stay, provided you are on a package or other reduced price stay. I wouldn't pay the rack rates. Restaurant, bar and room service prices are extravagant. Also, avoid using the minibar with its crazy prices. For dinner, and breakfast on-the-run, there are many places near the foot of the Spanish Steps. We tried somewhere different each night and were always satisfied. Breakfast in the hotel is good, with a wide choice, but it will set you back over 30 euros per person, unless you are on a package. For peace and quiet, ask for a room on the 5th or 6th floor looking into the calm and peaceful courtyard. Don't bother about the views--you can get the views of Rome from the top of the Spanish Steps, less than 1 minute from the front door of the hotel. So, a friendly, 5-star in the old way and very well situated. It is not dripping in luxury but we could not fault the ambience or facilities or the attitude of the helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Made In Heaven”
Reviews.Author: nerdybuckeye
Reviews.Content: I will make my review short and painless. If you can get this hotel for a good price...GET IT. Dont think, dont look, dont even look for more reviews, just get it. Everything about this hotel is amazing. Location - It is right at the top of the Infamous Spanish Steps aka Piaza de Spagna. There is a metro train stop right there which can get to you the Vatican or the Colessum in no time. Shopping - Dont even have to ask. ..the Spanish Steps are the Rodeo Drive of Rome. To Eat - There are PLENTY of small Cafes, and restaurantes around. We were there in Jan for our Honeymoon, and it this hotel made our trip worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: twinkles
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the Rome Intercontinental. We spent 9 days there in 2007. It is harder to write a positive review, because what do you say. If you have a criticism you describe what went wrong and defend your point of view. But when everything goes well, what do you comment on? I will try. We checked in on January 26, 2007 at about 9:30 in the morning. We had booked the standard room. My wife asked hopefully whether they had any rooms with a view. The agent said all the rooms with views were on the 5th and 6th floor and most were suites. So we were not expecting any view at all. Well not only did the agent find us a room we could immediately take—at 9:30 in the morning, we were given a room with a little balcony on Via Sistina on the 5th floor. Yes there was some construction across the street. But heck we were thrilled with the room and the view—especially for the price. All of the staff was friendly and helpful. It is hard to pick anyone out. The concierge made our reservations, the doorman greeted us with a smile, the front desk was efficient, the maid had our room made up when we came back from siteseeing and again when we got back from dinner. Ok, what can I criticize? Well the bathroom was small, but the room as a whole was significantly larger than the equivalent room at the Intercontinental in Paris. Actually there is another point there to be expanded upon. The Intercontinental in Paris is much more of a big chain hotel with wide hallways and large elevators. The Intercontinental in Rome feels much more like a local hotel. The elevator is one of those tiny European ones, the lobby is small and intimate, and the hallways are narrow and broken by turns and stairs. What else? This was our first trip to Rome. We were told the top of the Spanish Steps was “the” place to stay. I do not think I agree. If I had it to do over, I might have preferred to be near the Pantheon. It seemed to me like that might have been more central for sightseeing, and we frequently seemed to end up in that area for dinner. But my wife felt like the Spanish steps area was perfect. She thought the Pantheon area was too touristy and crowded. So it is a close call.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay-Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Zelphiakat
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jan. 21-Jan. 24 2007. OK- First let me say, that I got a really good deal on this hotel. I got this hotel reservation via Priceline for $186 a night. The same day I booked the room, the lowest price on the website was 220 Euro. So as you can see, this was a considerable saving- about $100 less per night. The location is a few strides away from the top of the Spanish steps. Really very close. The Hassler is at the top and this is about 3 doors down. Note: If you are taking the Metro here.. the Spagna metro has an elevator to the top of the steps. Check in was easy. No problems with the reservation. Room: Nice size room for a large city. Same size as say NYC or Paris. Enough room to move around, a desk, little table for odds & ends, TV, a suitcase stand. Large beautiful wooden closet with wooden hangers. You'll probably need more hangers than they give you to hang your clothes. TV comes in a number of different languages. There were about 5 channels in English, but only news. The Bed: The linens were lovely. The bed came with 4 pillows. 2 firm and 2 soft. Although as someone mentioned before, the large bed is actually 2 singles pushed together. We were so tired from sightseeing all day.. this was not a problem. Windows... We were on the 4th floor. The view across the street was of a building swaddled in construction work, but you could see a lot of the sky. The windows are 2 parts. Inside and outside,which kept the room was fairly quiet. Bathroom: Very nice. Big deep tub for taking baths. Toilet & Bidet. Came with 2 bathrobes & 2 pairs of slippers. Also the bathroom had a scale, shoe mitt, big container of cotton balls, a 2 sided mirror arm for shaving or makeup application & hairdryer. The bathroom was all marble and the mirror was treated to not fog when you take you shower. Very Nice. Service: We didn't ask for much help, so we can't attest to this. Sometimes there was a smartly dressed doorman to open the door, but most times we came in out, we were able to push the revolving door for ourselves. If you get a good deal, or for free via some point system... this is an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tigerlane
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for three days in the middle of November 2006. We stayed at the Intercontinental De La Ville for 2 of those days and loved every minute of it. The hotel was in immaculate condition. We booked the stay through the Priority Club website and I used points to reserve the room but I opted to pay an additional fee and upgrade from the standard room. I communicated with the hotel staff through email months before our trip and when we arrived everything was just as I had arranged. So I can't really speak to the price because I used points to pay for the stay. Our room was amazing and had a beautful view of the inside courtyard area. The room was bigger than a lot of American hotels that I have stayed in. The bathroom was very large and had all of the amenities that I needed. The only real complaint I had about the room was that we reserved a king size bed and they had just pushed together two twin beds. This was not that big of a deal because we weren't in the room for a large amount of time. This was a very special trip for us as I proposed to my girlfriend on this trip. I made the conceirge aware of this because I had some questions about confirming dinner reservations and they treated us even better. We returned to the room one evening and there was a bottle of chapagne waiting in the room from the hotel general manager. On the night of the proposal, I had the conceirge send up some flowers to be in the room after we returned from dinner. These flowers were better than I expected and my fiance' was astounded. We were actually in Rome at the time that Katie Holmes and Tom Cruise were getting married and they were staying at the Hotel Hassler next door. I thought that the hotel staff would be distracted the whole time dealing with all of this but this was the complete opposite. They took better care of us because of the big distractions. Overall, this was a memorable trip and it was made that much better by the Intercontinental De La Ville.

Reviews.Title: “I'm picky and this was near perfect”
Reviews.Author: TaraBB
Reviews.Content: Spent the last week of October in Italy, 3 nights at this hotel. Excellent location, staff , and room. We were looking at the Hassler and the D'ingleterra Hotel and realized that we had enough Priority Club/Ambassador Club points to cover our hotel in Rome so opted to stay here using our points. I do not like to stay in so-called "chain hotels" while in Europe, but when the stay is essentially "free", I was willing to to give it a go...esp. after reading all of the positive reviews on tripadvisor.com. We had a standard room on the 5th floor...very spacious in my opinion for a standard room, good soundproofing, high ceilings, comfortable bed, nice little balcony facing the Spanish Steps, clean and spacious bathroom. Hotel brought us up complimentary champagne and fruit and water. We ate at hotel one time for dinner...tasty, but not totally to die for...reasonably priced. We did breakfast through room service and they were accurate and punctual. Really, I can find itsy bitsy things to complain about even on the best trips but this hotel was outstanding. The staff has mastered knowing when to leave you alone and when to take care of you and the concierge and doorman were esp. excellent. Biggest complaint was the somewhat slow elevator that only held about 3 people at a time (theres two, they are just tiny). If thats my biggest complain, I think its a darn fine hotel! We had a lovely experience all the way around. Would recommend highly and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location, Kid-friendly”
Reviews.Author: gtpc
Reviews.Content: My family and I (mom, sister, two children) stayed for five nights in early Nov. The location was brilliant, and the rooms spacious and kid friendly. We had two connecting rooms -- high ceilings, generous space , well appointed bathrooms, but water pressure in the shower was very low. I had read the reviews that breakfast buffet was great, and was a bit disappointed. if you've ever been to a hotel in HK, SIngapore or Taipei, the breakfast buffets at the five star hotels are truly stupendous. Service staff at the restaurant were friendly, however, the concierge seemed too busy most of the time, and a bit aloof. We found our way around without too much trouble without their help. The location of this hotel is brilliant! RIght next to the Hassler, on the Spanish Steps; a quick trip down the steps takes you to the heart of shopping. Via Condotti, Via del Corso, Via Frattini, etc. are all right there. Even the kids didn't fuss too much as getting home from shopping was only a 5 minute walk. We were even able to walk to the Colosseum/Forum/Capitoline Hill with the two children from the hotel. Am looking forward to coming back to stay here sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not memorable”
Reviews.Author: Pooferone
Reviews.Content: The most "industrial" and "touristy" of any of the hotels we stayed at during our trip to Venice, Florence and Rome. Room was OK, location by the Spanish Steps (all 136 of them) was also OK. Concierge recommendations for meals were average at best. I'd look for something else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good - just not that good”
Reviews.Author: calvados13
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights week commencing 16th october 2006. Like earlier reviewers I cannot fault the location of this hotel if you wish to stay in elegant surroundings close to all the wonderful attractions Rome has to offer then this is the place. As an Intercontinental Ambassador (joining is recommended) we were allocated a Junior Suite prior to arrival (the online 'view booking' facility confirmed this. I wasnt to find out just how nice the room was until almost an hour after arrival at the hotel at 3pm as it wasn't ready despite the booking confirming availability from 1pm. OK - so we had a free drink in the courtyard area and didnt worry too much. When we finally got into the room we were not disappointed and complimentary flowers, fruit and a bottle of red wine were awaiting us. The following morning I discovered that the room had no coffee making facilities so ordered some from Room Service. It arrived around 15 minutes later and was stone cold. To be fair it was quickly replaced but I just feel that the level of service at this hotel was not up the standards offered by other Intercontinentals. That is not to say the service was particulary bad just not as good as I would have expected. I did mention this to the Guest relations Manager on our final evening and he was most apologetic and said the hotel was full that week. I would go back to this hotel and hope maybe next time it will be 'perfect'

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lrr720
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect - a very short walk from the top of the Spanish Steps, and within walking distance to all major sites. Also, there is a metro station nearby for those sites not within walking distance (such as the Vatican). The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was nicely appointed and well-kept. I had a single room, which was very small, but not much smaller than other hotels that I have stayed in in Rome. The bathroom was great - well above my experience at other Rome hotels. The breakfast buffet, which was included in the price of our rooms, was excellent. There was a wide variety of foods and the courtyard in which it was served was beautiful. Had we not been anxious to get out into the city, we would have spent more time just relaxing in the courtyard. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel the next time I am in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back to this hotel when in ROME”
Reviews.Author: Faberge
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Pricey, but well worth it. Some co-workers stayed in another 4-star, but it was not nearly as nice - they had no Internet access and much smaller rooms. We had a lovely room, spacious by European standards, with all the extras one could hope for. Location is excellent - Spanish Steps are great exercise. Great for the business traveller - wired and wireless Internet access (for a fee), nice bar area for meeting customers or co-workers. Service was exceptional. Maid service was great and the housekeeping staff was much above what you would find here in the states. Doorman was very nice - always a smile and a helping hand. Front desk was a bit more formal, but all the same very nice. Breakfast was more than we had even hoped for, but make sure you get it included in your rate. It will cost you about 34 Euros for two to add it to your room, but if you don't, the buffet will run you 33 Euros a piece. Rome is a beautiful city - very friendly - and the Intercontinental reflects the same. Hope to come back some day and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: European_Travelers
Reviews.Content: The InterConti de la Ville is an excellent hotel. We stayed for four days in September and were not disappointed. Pro's: Location - probably one of the best location's in Rome, at the top of the Spanish Steps (fabulous views!) you will be able to walk to many of Rome's attractions. There is also a subway station right next to the hotel (look for the elevator) - the Vatican or the Colosseum are only 10 minutes by subway. Rooms - we stayed at a luxury room with a terrace - the room had everything (including flat screen TV) you would expect from a European 5 star hotel. Staff - friendly, competent Breakfast - their (champagne) breakfast buffet is excellent - we recommend to book the room including breakfast (otherwise you will be charged Euro 33 per person). Tip: you may consider joining the Ambassador Club - you may get a free upgrade. We also received complementary wine & water and fruits upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “central location/helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: liketotrave
Reviews.Content: Great location! We stayed three nights in august. we got a two twin bed room which was on the front of the hotel. a little noisy, but comfortable. the room and bath were clean and classicly decorated. In the afternoon the there were refreshments and snack, but no morning coffee. the staff was very helpful and english speaking. The hotel caters to english speaking tourists and business travelers. The hotel restaurant and bar seemed very nice and relaxing. evening live music in the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: ravelbag
Reviews.Content: We have just spent one of the most perfect weekends ever in this beautiful hotel. We had reserved a junior suite with balcony but as Platinum Ambassador members were upgraded to a Suite. We were in Room 727 on the 7th floor with the most magnificent terrace - over 400 sq feet in area - from which we enjoyed beautiful views over the city. The suite itself whilst not over large was beautiful and spotlessly clean. It was so refreshing to enter the suite and find a genuine welcome greeting together with a supply of water, a bottle of delicious red wine, plus a bowl of cherries and a bowl of fresh apricots. From the time the limousine met us at the airport till the time the limousine deposited us back to the airport every member of staff that we encountered could not have been more polite or tried harder to be pleasant and courteous and provide service. Over and over we were assured "Please tell us if there is anything that you need". The breakfast area came as a surprise. On the 2nd floor there is an indoor area but also two courtyard areas which are very pleasant indeed. The breakfast was very good (but I am glad it was in my room rate as at 33 Euros it was not cheap!!) and with a nice choice including - hot waffles with a great choice od toppings. I am told they were delicious but forbidden on my diet!! The location was excellent and so close to so much in this beautiful city. We did find ways by going out the hotel door and turning left to avoid the continual climb up the Spanish steps!! During our stay it was my birthday - and simply I presume from my passport details - the hotel realised this and I was presented with a chilled bottle of Prosecco and birthday greetings. This is what makes a good hotel a great hotel. After a truly horrendous experience at the InterContinental in Pargue - to be avoided at all costs - this was a gratifying and so pleasing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Happy_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights during the final week of June at the Hotel de la Ville in Rome. (Not one taxi driver knew what I was talking about when I said "Intercontinental" Hotel de la Ville so it seems to be better known to locals without the global brand name attached.) What a terrific hotel. I was assigned a room on the 5th floor facing the inside patio which serves as the hotel breakfast room and bar. There is a nice lounge singer most nights and the music, which stopped promptly at 11:30 pm each night, was pleasant to hear in my room. The patio was also a terrific spot to start the day with breakfast (very nice buffet) and end the day with a cocktail. The room was tiny but I was paying a very good corporate rate. We had two twin beds pushed together. While there was a fairly nice sized closet with safe, the entire dresser was actually a disguised mini bar. I would have preferred a drawer for my socks and underwear. Room was elegant and spotless. However, there really was only about a foot of space to walk around the bed and walls/furnishings. Given the rate and luxury of the property, I was perfectly happy. Location also cannot be beat. You are on top of the Spanish Steps which puts you within minutes of the top sites of Rome (i.e. 5 minutes walk to the Trevi Fountain) and its best shopping as well. It is also convenient to the Borgese area and Via Veneto for dining and evening options, many of which are less tourist focused. The only downside is that after a day of walking in Rome, which was very hot, you may not be in the mood to climb the Steps. The Steps are also a congregation point for everyone it seems at night and I was there during World Cup Quarterfinals and it was the center of celebrations. Hint - the subway is down a narrow street just next to the Steps and there is an elevator to take you to the top. Two of five nights I was lazy and took the elevator. The hotel has a single computer in the lobby for internet use and it was always busy (morning, noon and night) even though a password is assigned to guests with a 20-minute usage limit. Bring your laptop if you need to access email, etc. The hotel staff was great other than the concierge staff. The concierge staff seem generally cranky when asked for the Internet password for the lobby computer, directions, restaurant advice or a map. When we checked out at 7 a.m., no one even bothered to help us get a taxi. The bellman, doorman and concierge were enjoying the cool lobby on that hot Rome morning. I would think rooms facing the street would be noisy as I was surprised at the volume of traffic, including big trucks, that went racing down the cobble stoned street. Thus, request a room facing the patio which is quite pleasant. Many rooms had terraces facing the patio. A great choice in Rome. You cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: andy1961
Reviews.Content: No question, the IC De La Ville is a wonderfull place to stay. Great location, excellent service. Is it pricey?? Yes, but you pay for what you get. If you want to make it a little easier on the pocketbook, join the Ambassador Club (Priority Club) for $150.00 USD before you go. You'll get a room upgrade along with one night's free accomodations. Well worth the upgrade alone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a former business traveller that always stayed at the Mark Hopkins InterContinental in San Francisco. I decided to book a standard room at the De La Ville based on my experiences with the InterContinental chain. My husband and I stayed here the last few nights of our trip to Italy. By the time we got to Rome, we were exhausted from travelling so much and sleeping in hotels that were loud and disappointing. I had requested an early check in. We arrived about noon and they quickly found us a room. Our room was somewhat small but not uncomfortable. It was expensive to stay here but when staying in a large city and as close to one of the major attractions, this is to be expected. Our room overlooked the inner courtyard and was beautiful! It was a nice change to wake up to the sound of birds chirpping in the morning. The staff was awesome! The room was cleaned to perfection everday. The concierge was amazing! He sometimes had a phone up to each ear and was helping someone standing in front of him! He rocked! Whatever you needed, he knew where it was or how to help you. Room service was great. The waiters in the courtyard restaurant/bar were professional and fun! We went there every night to wind down from the day. THANK YOU DE LA VILLE! If we ever return to Rome, we will stay with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm reception”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the De La Ville, and can say for a busy, completely full hotel they take the time to make the stay as enjoyable as possible. The reception is friendly, helpful and they try to give you the best room possible. We wanted quiet and they gave us a great room with a terrace on the inside with large pots of flowers. The rooms are a bit small, but this is Rome and space is short. We were celebrating our anniversary, they actually set up a table for lunch on the terrace even though it was closed (the terrace overlooks the city) and draped it beautifully and served (only us) up there a wonderful lunch! Our stay was memorable and our friends who live in Rome and visited us there were impressed also. You hear so much about the Hassler next door and the De Russie that this lovely property is overlooked. We would definitely stay here again. As an aside, when we left, our Florentine friend picked us up, the doorman got all excited and kept telling us how nice it was to hear his Tuscan dialiect and how "Italian" he sounded! Just a truly nice experience in the beautiful city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “best view of rome”
Reviews.Author: kteaches
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the staff at the Intercontinental for a wonderful 25th wedding anniversary stay in the most beautiful room in Rome. Our balcony was dreamy with sunsets and views that would normally be reserved for royalty or a celebrity. Our room was not ready upon check in and the front desk gave us complimentary drinks in the bar while we waited. Our room still wasn't ready as promised but since my husband and I were meeting friends we were off to the Forum and Colosseum for the day and lots of La Dolce Vita. When we returned we found our room to be spectacular (722) with a view that was truely heavenly and a huge patio with lovely potted geranium flowers and evergreens. In addition the manager sent us a bottle of wine and fresh fruit basket for the inconvenience of our room not being ready. What a treat that was and we were oblivious to the inconvenience as exploring and discovering the best of Rome was all we were really after. Another plus for the hotel is the concierge made reservations at a restaurant for us and we were treated like royalty with complimentary Prosecco before dinner and limoncello after dinner. Italy is such a fabulous country to visit because their hospitality is so welcoming, This was my husband's first trip and he can't wait to return. We have wonderful memories that will last forever.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, recommended”
Reviews.Author: GigiYing
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental with my sister for our first visit to Rome and we were impressed. Staff were generally very polite, especially the concierge, restaurant and maid staff. As for front desk, it seemed to depend who you encountered, but no-one was actually rude (perhaps just a little snooty on occasion). We booked a car from the airport (Fiumicino) which I recommend as it is only a little more than a taxi and the driver was very polite and went to some lengths to introduce us to Rome. The hotel's location also makes you feel special, as it is within walking distance to so many essential sites and is a stone's throw from the Spanish Steps. The breakfast buffet was fine - quite tasty, and the wait staff again did a fine job, especially during the hectic mornings. I was very happy with the room, as it was tastefully decorated and, with my Ambassador Club membership, we received an upgrade to a room with a terrace. We had warm weather and were pleased to have the opportunity to sit outside. All in all, we had a wonderful time in Rome, and I would definitely return to the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite up to par”
Reviews.Author: smrnj
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 3 night stay at the Intercontinental. Upon check-in, found the staff to be rude and callous. Had a Classic Deluxe Room, which was adequately sized, but can't imagine what one of the smaller rooms must have looked like. For the price, you would expect turn down service, but there is none. Found the concierge, chambermaids and bell staff all to be courteous, knowledgeable and well-informed. They more than made up for the front desk staff which could use some lessons in hospitality. The gym could use a multi-purpose weight machine as there are basically only cardio machines. The breakfast is quite good and the restaurant staff is top-notch. The location, right at the Spanish steps is convenient as there are several main attractions in the area, and a metro stop right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiancee stayed here last weekend April 15th and I cannot speak highly enough of the staff, accommodation and location! We were upgraded to a deluxe terrace room with terrace...which consisted of a balcony with two sunbeds and potted plants/shrubs etc the size of a small golfcourse! The balcony had stunning views over the city of Rome. On arriving at the hotel we had booked a chauffeur drive car but due to a medical emergency our plane had been diverted from Dublin to London on the way and this meant a 2 hour delay on arrival. I rang the hotel from London whilst on the ground in Heathrow but the staff could not have been more helpful in rescheduling my pick up! Everything ran smoothly from arrival to departure and I'd consider this hotel a real treat for anyone thinking of staying in Rome! I'd just like to use the site to say thansk to allt he staff especially Pamela and Ricardo....I'll definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stealth54
Reviews.Content: As Ambassador Club members, we took a limo service from the airport for 46.50 euros that is highly recommended. Clean, new Mercedes with courteous driver. Arrival at the hotel was great with guest services checking us in. Had been upgraded to a junior suite with two balconies with view of Spanish Steps, a couch, two arm chairs as well as the two double beds of a standard room. They graciously accepted our one free night coupon that Ambassador Club gives you once a year. The breakfast that is included is the best that you could ask for. Everything is hot, fresh and delicious. Even have a great selection of low-fat, dietetic items with fresh fruit galore. Coffee was hot and brought promptly, including refills. During the day, we used the bar for coffee and drinks. The concierge service was highly professional and very helpful. From the hotel the metro is very close, although not recommended if you don't mind buses or taxes. The metro is quite dirty and not a good experience, whereas the buses or cabs allow you to see the sights and are equally inexpensive. What can you say about Rome that hasn't been said elsewhere? Truly a magnificient capital full of history, glamour, fashion, exceptional cuisine, friendly and flirty waiters, beautiful and friendly people everywhere and a delight to visit again and again. Do stay at the Intercontinental - you wil not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “exellent”
Reviews.Author: mcnx
Reviews.Content: the location is the best in town, the brekfast is one of the most beutiful i ever seen,the staff are very professional, the concierge is very helpful, the room are nice, but the best thing in Rome is Rome. If you came here you must stay at De La Ville, and have a drink with Antonio the Barman. Very Very Good

Reviews.Title: “The staff at this hotel is professional, kind and helpful - how refreshing!”
Reviews.Author: LouiseThelma
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to be in Rome for Christmas and New Years Eve and stayed at the Cavalieri HIlton, which I loved, but it is quite a distance if you want to shop and see the central sights. This trip was with a shopping friend and we wanted to be closer to the Spanish Steps and the Via Veneto. The Intercontinental was very pleasant and a super location for us. The room was small, even though I had been upgraded because of my Ambassador Club membership, and the size made it a bit uncomfortable for two people. But, the bathroom was large and the room was clean. Our view would have been better if there wasn't a crane and workmen right across the street. The Lobby decor was a strange integration of lovely old Italian hotel and new bland beige. It really looked like a lot could be and should be done with it by a competent decorator. The staff at the hotel made up for any problem with room size or inconvenience. They were kind, professional and nice. The restaurant was wonderful, including the excellent menu and maitre'd. The upstairs bar was tended to by a polite, attentive man. Although there were not a lot of people in either the restaurant or bar when we were there, it was wonderful. The concierge staff was very very helpful and professional, I was impressed. And, the front desk tried very hard to make everything go smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with a great location”
Reviews.Author: voyaginggal
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the InterContinental De La Ville for three nights--and for three nights, it was a great choice. The reason: The hotel's location is just splendid, and above all, in a safe area. I must say it was delightful descending the Spanish Steps, embarking each day on our journey throughout Rome. Ascending the Steps in the evening was quite enchanting, sans the many "salesmen." To be quite honest, De La Ville was very nice, albeit nothing extraordinary for a four-star hotel. But we felt safe, in good company (Rome's Hassler is practically next door), and among a pleasant class of people. May I suggest an excursion from Rome: We hired Giovanni Gargiulo of ---- to take us to the Amalfi Coast for the day. It was truly the best and most memorable day of my life. Amalfi, Positano and Sorrento...three places you must go. It was a dream and I still can't believe I was there. Giovanni is pretty fantastic himself. Worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION BUT NOT UP TO THE INTERCONTINENTAL STANDARDS”
Reviews.Author: Shopper3042
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at this hotel in late October, 2005. We loved the location and it was very convenient. We had joined the Ambassador Club so we did get one free night but not an upgraded room, no free breakfast until we complained to the management. The room was nothing special, bathroom was small for a 5 star hotel. Friends who traveled with us had a smaller room but a large terrace outside their room. The elevators were so small that two people and their luggage were all that could fit into the elevator at one time. The conceirge staff was not very helpful, the front desk was surly at best. We loved the city of Rome and as I said this is a great location but it is certainly not my idea of a 5 star hotel - more like a fancy Holiday Inn express. It is a shame that Holiday Inn bought out Intercontinental and did not improve them to Intercontinental standards. We will stay at the Marriott on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: 510RandyS
Reviews.Content: We chose the InterContinental De La Ville for our 7-day vacation in Rome because of the favorable reviews we had read in TripAdvisor, and were very satisfied with our decision. The hotel is situated in a fantastic location at the top of the Spanish Steps, convenient to all tourist sites, restaurants, shops, and the metro. The concierge staff is simply the best, especially Pino. We were so pleased with his dinner recommendation on our first evening that we asked him to choose restaurants for us every night of our stay. All were outstanding (especially Mirabelle in the Royal Splendid Hotel and Al 34 on Via Mario de Fiori). Service at the hotel was very friendly and personal. We were greeted warmly every time we entered or left the hotel. We recommend asking for a room overlooking the interior courtyard, though, as our first room overlooked the street and was so noisy that neither of us got any sleep. Our room was on the small side and the furniture showed signs of wear, but it was very comfortable. The bathroom was marble and 5-star hotel quality. We ate in the hotel's restaurant one evening (at Pino's suggestion) -- food and service were both excellent. All in all, this was a fantastic hotel and definitely the one we will return to on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Intercontinental!! Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel! My sister and I stayed here over New Year's 2006. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous! The concierge suggested some wonderful restaurants and made reservations at the museums for us. The breakfast was fantastic! Great location! We walked pretty much everywhere. It it close to several metro stops as well. I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Small room”
Reviews.Author: shepsle96
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a week during the Summer of 2005. The location is just great, the prices for a 4/5 star in Rome was great. The service was good, however the bedroom was not what one would expect for a quality hotel. Even by European standards our room was small, really small - more like a box than a hotel room. We did have a nice view but the price we paid was not being able to sleep with all the traffic and other noise coming from outside. No upgrade despite being a priority club elite. Probably would save my money and stay in a IC in another city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience at this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cowtwngrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the De La Ville December 26 - Jan 1st, and found it to be a fantastic choice of hotels. First, the hotel could not have been in a more convenient location. (At the top of the Spanish Steps, which is within walking distance to great shopping and restaurants.) We walked to and from the Vatican, to and from several museums, and when we couldn't walk, it was easy to get a taxi from the centrally located hotel. Our flight arrived from the US around 7a.m., and I had emailed the hotel concierge a few days prior to our arrival to see if we could have an early check in that morning. They hotel staff quickly replied and said that they would do their best to have a room ready, but because the hotel was at capacity, they couldn't guarantee they'd have a room ready that early in the a.m. We were pleasantly suprised to learn when we arrived that our room was ready for us. It was nice to be able to drop the bags off, have a place to freshen up after the long flight, and then hit the streets for our first day of sight-seeing. We found the front desk staff to be very polite and cordial, but it was the service of the concierge staff that was so exceptional! Any question we had about a restaurant, the location of a particular store, etc, they promptly answered. The concierge staff made dinner reservations for us each night, and they were even able to get us reservations for New Years eve at the last minute! (Ask for Daniel at the Concierge desk when you go. He's the best!) We stayed in a Deluxe room, that was not exactly large by American hotel room standards, but much larger than some European hotel rooms I've stayed in before. The room had a great view of the hotel's inner courtyard, complete with a small balcony with a cafe table and chairs and flower boxes. The housekeeping staff came daily, and were very friendly in passing in the hallways. They even came back each evening to turn down the beds. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome! This hotel is a Priceline participant, so you may be able to get a deal online. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more pleased!!!”
Reviews.Author: NC_Travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the IC De La Ville for 6 nights in mid December 2005 and were absolutely happy with the choice! What led us originally to book here was the great location at the top of the Spanish Steps and the close shopping and dining of Via del Condotti and Via Veneto. It was also a very pleasant 15 minute walk to the Galleria Borghese through the Villa Borghese Park (Rome's version of NYC's Central Park but much more peaceful and clean). It was very nice to have that large spot of green grass and trees so close to the hotel for a respite from central Rome's busy streets and sounds. We were orginally assigned a room fronting on Via Sistina as we had asked for city view. The room was nicely sized and had two sets of windows, one normal set outside and one set on the inside for soundproofing. When both windows were closed it was quiet but the temps approached the 60's and we opened them for some cooler fresh air and it was pretty noisy. So we asked and were moved after two nights in this room to one located on the interior courtyard. Very nice and quiet with the windows open! The bathrooms are very spacious with marble flooring, bidet and a deep tub that was great for soaking. Room service (ice, food, luggage etc) was very speedy and always courteous. The front desk and concierge were just as efficient and helpful. The Coliseum, Roman Forum and Palatine Hill are all within a 20-25 minute walk from the hotel which we did for exercise and a chance to see the city up close. The balance of the travel we did by cab although there is a very close Metro stop near the Piazza di Spagna. Vatican City is also about a 10 minute cab ride from the hotel. Quite nice was the fact that there was a cab stand in front of the Hassler Hotel next door and the doorman would just signal for one and we'd be off - no waiting! We enjoyed the breakfast buffet (full, not Continental!) but did not have dinner at the hotel but we understood from other guests it was great. We'd definitely stay here again because it offers such a central location with nice views over the city and all the staff including the doormen were absolutely fantastic!! I would recommend that you join the InterContinental Priority Club if you plan on staying here as the hotel offers some potential additional services and upgrades if you are a member. Buon viaggio!!

Reviews.Title: “SimplyA Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: VOM
Reviews.Content: Title says it all! My wife and I booked an executive suite here as part of a long-delayed honeymoon. It was, unsurprisingly, wildly expensive, but we sure got our money's worth.. Suite - Marvellous. Enormous lounge, huger bedroom, all expected facilities and then some.Excellent beds. Smallish but pleasant bathroom. Restaurant - Great breakfast. Ate dinner on our first night, and was very impressed (try the warm sea bass carpaccio!).We heard that the chef and his team are relatively new - they're very very good. Maitre d' and waitresses were 100% professional. Staff - Beyond criticism. My wife unfortunately became very sick (had to happen on a honeymoon!!)with a vicious tummy bug that left her empty in every conceivable way, but the staff couldn't have been nicer (thanks again to housekeeping!), making what could have been an embarrassing situation no problem at all.Concierges, reception, bar staff (grazie Nicole and Antonio) - all polite, helpful, and again professional to their fingertips. I was worried that before our trip, I could find nothing about this hotel in my guidebooks (Time Out, Rough Guide, Fodors). Now I'm delighted - better availability for our next visit! My one gripe was the weather - couldn't have been wetter - but I guess that's out of the De La Ville's hands. Nothing else was though.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: AmoItalia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after joining Intercontinental's Ambassador's Club and finding what I considered a good rate on the hotel's website for a deluxe room. Before my arrival I arranged for transportation from the airport, which was very efficient and relatively inexpensive (for Rome anyway). I had also requested to have one of the hotel's deluxe rooms with a balcony, but received an email back from the hotel stating that it would be an additional 80 euro per night for that type of room. Strange I thought, since the Ambassordor Club guarantees an upgraded room, and I was simply asking for the room category that I had made my a reservation for. After sending another email to the hotel (and referencing my Ambassador Club #), at check in I was given a shoebox size standard room, however with a balcony that was about 3 times the size of the room. Fine I thought, until it started pouring rain, and I was stuck in the shoebox with no balcony to escape to. I asked the manager to be moved to a deluxe room and instead was patronizingly given a superior room with a communal balcony (the exact room shows up on the hotel's website entitled "superior room w/balcony"). I resented having to ask for what I had reserved and paid for, and got tired of calling management, so I promptly checked out the next morning. At check out I was amazed to see that the credit card deposit that I had prepaid had not been deducted from the bill, nor had the free night certificate that I had redeemed at check in. This resulted in an additional charge of 440 euro, that I had to argue with the reception clerk to get deducted. The man was completely rude and made me feel petty for noticing the charges! A 5 star hotel? I don't think so! Furthermore, all of the nice little perks that were promised by the Ambassador Club, never happened here. (Daily gifts? Personalized service? Upgrade? Not!) All in all, this hotel was just too much work. I had to ask for everything. I just wanted to relax, be pampered and enjoy Rome. Fortunately for me, that is exactly what happened when I checked into the The Hotel de Russie, after I checked out of the Intercontinental. The De La Ville just re-confirmed what I had already known, but wanted to believe otherwise. You get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful De La Ville”
Reviews.Author: ala_7
Reviews.Content: Having been to Rome a number of times I wanted somewhere special to stay when I took my parents there to celebrate their 65th and 70th birthdays. I had walked past the De La Ville on previous visits and thought it was fantastically situated although I was not greatly impressed by the entrance lobby. I took the plunge however after reading reviews on the Tripadvisor site. What a gem! I would not now consider staying anywhere else when visiting Rome. I had booked a small suite for the three of us; the hotel management upgraded us to a magnificent suite on the 7th floor with wrap around terraces and wonderful, far-reaching views of Rome from The Vatican to The Wedding Cake. It is the only hotel I have stayed in in Rome where it was quiet enough to get a good night's sleep! The staff were very friendly and helpful and we had a fabulous stay. I would recommend this hotel without reservation

Reviews.Title: “Great location; excellent service”
Reviews.Author: pghvisitor
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is perfectly located, a stone's throw from the Spanish Steps and the Spagna metro stop. It's possible to walk almost anywhere from here; even the Vatican and the Coliseum. A particularly good location for shoppers. Service is as good as advertised: doorman, concierge, front desk, and restaurant maitre d' were all friendly, smiling and helpful. We called for extra tissues; they arrived immediately, and the next day, all of the bathroom supplies were overstocked to make sure we had enough. The hotel car service from the airport is a good deal, especially if there are a few of you, and you're groggy from an overnight flight. We cleared customs and were greeted by a friendly, English-speaking driver, who whisked us to the hotel in a new Mercedes...not bad for 49 euros flat rate...less than a taxi. A few minor gripes: the breakfast buffet is substantial, but typically hotel expensive at 29 euros. If you don't need a huge American breakfast, consider getting a cappucino off-site. We're Preferred members, and supposedly got an upgraded room. It was fine, but not a suite or balcony room as some people mention here. The rooms facing the courtyard have no view but are very quiet for Rome. The walls were pretty scuffed up, but the room was very clean. The hotel has installed an intrusive marketing device on its televisions. We would come back in the late afternoon, tired after a long day's sightseeing and hoping to rest for a while before dinner. At about 6pm, all of the hotel televisions come on automatically, with a loud beeping (like a tornado warning message) and a sales pitch for the hotel restaurant.
