It was loud enough to make us jump out of bed! Once you managed to turn your set off, you could still here the beeping throughout the hotel! Bad idea for a luxury hotel. Finally, we had to go through a lot of contortions to get the correct rate for the room, but this was resolved to our satisfaction. These were all minor issues; the hotel is well worth considering, especially if you can book a reasonable rate. We paid about 200 euros; the Hassler next door was 600!

Reviews.Title: “Mingle with Sean Connery! A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coluche105
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at this hotel and, all in all, we were very satisfied. Sean Connery and Valentino both stay there when in town so they must be doing something right! Great location, very professional staff, nice rooms. The building is from the 15th century so many of the rooms are quite small; each room literally has a different shape. My bathroom was a sort of triangle. When I arrived I was shown to a room with a lovely private terrace in the courtyard but, as it was only large enough to accommodate two single beds and not much else, I asked for a larger room, as a friend was to join me the next day. I must say that the manager, Giacomo, really bent over backwards to please me and eventually gave my friend and I two single rooms for the price of a double! Tasteful room furnishings, a choice of soft and hard pillows on the bed, nice bath products, very plush terry robes and towels, a relatively good choice of TV channels. What I would have appreciated in addition were iron and ironing board, tea and coffee maker and free radio (if you wanted to listen to music, you had to pay for it). Toll free calls made with a phone card are billed 2.50 Euros per call. I ordered room service twice: the second time was fantastic with a delicious salad and assorted breads, all on a table with wheels, the first time was a disaster as I arrived at the hotel very late and ordered after 11pm. They brought me a tray with a tiny chicken sandwich on wonder bread with a few wisps of chicken for 15 Euros, which I immediately sent back. Do NOT expect good food after 11 pm as there is no cook available. The fitness club is very basic and I didn’t use it. There is one of the largest fitness clubs in the world about 15 minutes from the hotel with everything you can imagine. We got our rooms through Priceline for the bargain price of $189.00 per night. I would most definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Steps from Spanish Steps”
Reviews.Author: CaWino
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a ten day trip to Italy - Seven days on the Amalfi Coast and three in Rome at the Intercontinental De La Ville. After staying at a couple of budget hotels on the Amalfi Coast, the plushness and luxury of the De La Ville was a real treat. The location is excellent. It is located just a few steps away from the top of the Spanish Steps. Our room was superb. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were excellent - reminiscent of what you would find in a very good B & B. Our room faced the street and was on the first floor. It was very quiet though, thanks to modern windows. The room also included a large screen TV and room safe. The bathroom was well equipped and decadently trimmed in marble. Towels were thick and plush. It had a nice combo tub & shower. The staff was friendly enough and helpful. The hotel has a concierge desk and they did provide worthwhile information regarding restaurants. I would like to add that we booked this room through bid on priceline and got a good price at $210 per night. The De La Ville is one of the few five star hotels available through priceline.com. If anyone intends to use priceline, I suggest a look at ---- first. You can get excellent info on what others have experienced in the bidding process. Be sure and read hotel FAQ's.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for your Rome trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old son and I just got back from a 7 night stay. The hotel is ideally located. The room was a nice size with two twin beds, TV, and large closets. There aren't any dressers so you are forewarned. The closets have lights in them. The bathroom is on the small side but was nicely done. The bathroom sink needed more counter space for toiletries. We had a room on the third floor overlooking the street below. Double windows kept out all of the Rome noise. The noise from the room next door was a problem though. I had to call down one night (at midnight) to have them quieted. I could also hear the people above us. Just so that you know, I sleep with earplugs and I still heard them. I didn't eat at the restaurant but did order room service. It came quickly and any problems were handled immediately. The food was pretty good. I got this hotel on a Priceline bid so breakfast wasn't included. We did find a small bar (cafe) around the corner and for 10 euros total my son and I ate well for breakfast. Antonio the bartender was wonderful. The concierge people and front desk people were extremely helpful and knowledgeable about their city. The items I mentioned above are just for anyone interested in what they may find. We really did enjoy this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Grazie!”
Reviews.Author: WanderingAmerican
Reviews.Content: What can I say?!? I am almost afraid to recount our story because others would certainly follow our lead and the hotel might get inundated with requests for the same wonderful treatment. But I owe it to the hotel to give it the highest rating possible. Back in February, I emailed the hotel looking for accommodation in August for our family (my husband and I, and our two children). I told them that I did not want to spend too much on the room and that I would prefer one standard room to fit all four of us, if possible. I received a reply within hours from the general manager giving me their suite normally priced at 1700 euros a night for 339 euros with breakfast. Our reservation was through the hotel and not through corporate and so when we checked in, we had to check in through special services. The suite was a dream. The staff, especially Danieli was very friendly and really helpful. Waiting for us in our room were a bottle of wine and fresh fruits. The housekeeper gave you enough towels to drape the place. Concierge was very friendly. The valet even negotiated a flat fee for us to the airport. And the restaurant? The maitre d' was very mindful of our son's food allergies. Breakfast was more than adequate and delicious. Dinner on the rooftop terrace was fantastic. The people who emailed me in February were away on vacation but I do appreciate you, Francesca and Luigi! Sometimes, you really just have to ask!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but less than expected”
Reviews.Author: Lisa827
Reviews.Content: My 14-year old son and I just returned from Italy, and the Intercontinental De La Ville was our last leg of the trip. As stated in prior reviews, the location of the hotel can't be beat. We stayed in an executive suite, which in my opinion was not worth the price. The executive suites do not have 2 bathrooms as stated, they have one. Maybe some of the other ones do, but not the one that I was in. Check-in is at 1:00. When I arrived I was told that my room would not be ready until at least 4:30 because the current guest had a guaranteed late check-out. We were, however, placed in a temporary room to rest and freshen up. The temporary room was a standard room. It was smaller than the executive suite, but lovely. The hotel is nice, and it is comfortable. I would stay there again, but would save the money and stay in a standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Helped make my trip perfect”
Reviews.Author: egoody25
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Intercontinental De La Ville while on my honeymoon and I am finding myself missing the hotel terribly as I write this review. We got there and upgraded our room to the 7th floor with a balcony for only $40/night and it was the greatest decision of my vacation. The room was very large and the balcony was mind-blowing. The view from the balcony overlooks the entire city of Rome and since breakfast was included in the room rate we only had to pay 5 euro extra to be served breakfast on the balcony. Also, the breakfast was not the typical European breakfast. This was a full American breakfast that would make us all proud. The room was great and the bathroom was huge! The concierge was very helpful and they knew of some great inexpensive restaurants that were within walking distance of the hotel. All in all, this hotel deserves a much higher rating and it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental (near Spanish Staps)”
Reviews.Author: samojim
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for five nights in early July with our two teenage sons. We had a BLAST! Hotel is in great location, concierge was more than helpful (all of them). We finished each day wih cocktails in the patio courtyard and got to know everyone pretty well by the time we left. Overall quality of the hotel was good and our rooms were fine, like most older Europe hotels, it is tough to compete with a new Four Seasons! Air conditioning was perfect, nice and cool. We ate at at least 10 difference restaurants and I can't remeber any names, they were all good. We also used Sean and Ross at Angels Tours for three different tours. They were great and the kids really enjoyed them. We took thee of their tours, Sena was particularly good at the Vatican. If you are into really specific detail on the history of Rome you can probably find a more in depth tour. Because they go in small groups (10 or fewer) it is great with the kids. We saw a number of groups with 20-30 people, they looked miserable. If you want a workout facility, the IC is pretty poor, just a bike and treadmill.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Rome”
Reviews.Author: MEMORYBUYER
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location. Small, unremarkable rooms. We moaned and complained to the front desk, and after they "discovered" that we were both platinum and ambassador club members, we got a suite upgrade for a very minimal amount of money. This made all the difference in the world. There are NO KING BEDS in any rooms other than the suites. We expected the king and would have booked elsewhere if we'd have known they didnt have it, but thank goodness for the suite upgrade. Great hotel location at the top of the Spanish Steps. Ask for room 546 if you want a suite with a 500 sq ft sun deck included! The photo enclosed in this review is the PRIVATE deck for this room. Really spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sandy31
Reviews.Content: Our four night stay at the De La Ville IC was delightful, with a prime location right next to the Hassler, at the top of the Spanish Steps. Although our room wasn't large, it was well-appointed, with a balcony that extended the length of the room and bathroom, overlooking the hotel courtyard, which was quiet and serene. We were on the 6 floor and just passed the elevators was an outdoor roof area with tables and chairs and a panorama view of the city. The staff and concierge were friendly and helpful. We are IC members and turned in points for one free night, which really helped against the euro. A wonderful buffet breakfast was also included with our membership. IC membership is a great deal, offering several nice perks, along with lovely hotels in prime locations throughout the world.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: babswel
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location in town. The rooms were quite adequate and the personnel (especially the friendly concierge Mr. Oddis and Mr. Pino) helped us a great deal. The food there is also quite good. Worth the money. Join the Priority Club (Intercontinental) and get one free week end night.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: mej1724
Reviews.Content: My wife ,my five year old son,and I stayed there in late May. The staff was great and room was fine. We had to eat dinner at the hotel one night because our son was ill. One of the best meals that we ever have experienced. They brought toast to our room at 11 at night free of charge for our son. One bock from top of Spanish steps. Gelato place Blue.... 2 blocks away awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But Average Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked through room through Priceline, bidding on a 5-star hotel in central Rome. We were given a standard room on the first floor - the hotel is very clean, but the room and bathroom were extremely small (although it had high ceilings). I agree with the poster who said housekeeping was lacking - the beds were barely made up, there was no turn-down service, and they didn't do the basic straightening up that you would expect in even a 3-star hotel. The room had very basic amenities - more like a 3 or 4 star than 5 star. However, the location is phenomenal - very central and swank neighborhood. We walked everywhere and loved having a central base to relax in during the afternoons. This room was fine given the Priceline bid we paid, but if you're paying the normal rate, I'm sure there are dozens of other truly 5-star hotels that would be better. We stayed at the Starhotel Metropole near the train station during our last night (easier access to the airport), and were blown away how much more plush the room was there compared to the Intercontinental. So if you want to stay literally on top of the Spanish Steps, book away - but if you're willing to deal with a less fashionable neighborhood, there are much better options.

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob710
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Rome. What an amazing city! We were there for 10 days. We can’t say enough about how wonderful our experience was while staying at this hotel. The location was so convenient. It’s at the top of the Spanish Steps and within walking distance of everything. Our room was great and overlooked the courtyard. Best of all, the staff really cares about their guests and it really shows. Giacomo Pica, Front Office Manager, and Nicola and Pino at the concierge desk went above and beyond the call of duty. They made my wife and I feel very special. When in Rome, everyone should stay at this hotel. Great hotel, location and staff. We’ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Rome and we were pleased with the hotel. We were a little concerned about arriving after midnight , but Pino, the concierege, arranged transportation and everything went like clockwork. We looked forward to breakfast in the mornings and our room was fresh and clean. Being located at the top of the Spanish Steps is a great plus, as you get some fresh air and escape a little of the smog/fumes that accumulate in the lower streets. We considered staying closer to the Piazza Navona, but to be honest, we are glad that we didn't - again fumes. I note this because my husband and I are great allergy sufferers and found that we were very comfortable where we stayed. The area of the Spanish Steps is definite walking distance to all locations as we walked to most of the central areas of Rome and to Vatican City (about 20 min). Our only complaint was being initially placed in a room on a smoking floor when we had specifically asked for a non-smoking room and confirmed that. Also, we were booked into a deluxe room and the first room was not. We merely rang the front desk and they showed us 2 other rooms (this is at 1AM), one of which was exactly what we had booked. Once I showed the reservation details of the room specs from the internet, we had no problem. We were also given a 4 PM checkout. We would definitely stay here again. Overall a very good place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for sightseeing and very clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Mood
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Intercontinental de La Ville was excellent. The location at the top of the Spanish steps was convenient to all our sightseeing. The staff are very attentive and helpful to us with our questions. Our room was very clean and overlooked the courtyard. The linens were particularly crisp and clean. We did not have the plasma TV but the wireless internet in the room for a small fee was convenient. The buffet breakfast was excellent and the staff was so attentive and friendly that we looked forward to our breakfast everyday. We did not try the restaurants for lunch or dinner so we can not rate this service. It was our anniversary and they sent up champagne and two glasses. We would return and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is a real find and a jewel in the centre of this wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a real find and a jewel in the centre of this wonderful city. It's location is supurb, at the top of the Spanish steps - with easy access to all of the sites. Check-in was excellent and I was escorted to my room by a member of staff, to find fresh fruit and mineral water waiting for me. I was then called ten minutes later by the same member of staff to check that everything was in order. The room was a good size for central Rome and had a fantastic view over the central courtyard with bar and restaurant. The room was spotless, with a plasma screen tv with high-speed internet access built in, plus excellent air-conditioning. It was also good to see sprinklers in the rooms - not common in Italy. During my stay, the staff went out of their way to be friendly. The hotel barman makes all feel welcome. I ate dinner twice in the restaurant and found the quality of both the food and the wine superb - the concierge also provided helpful suggestions and made reservations for some great hidden-away restaurants in the city. I'd more than recommend the hotel to those looking for high-quality standards - but with the added personal touch. It's location makes it first class for both business and tourism, or even a combination of the two!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the de la Ville”
Reviews.Author: Cambridgtravler
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel in December. Our room was a bit small (but this is Europe) but king size bed and beautifully decorated, nice flat panel TV, and had a large terrace with table and chairs. The staff were friendly and helpful and the concierge gave us great tips on restaurants. The restaurant was very good, we had dinner there one night, and the bar is a cozy place for a drink. The location at the top of the Spanish Steps is perfect, we walked almost everywhere. I would love to stay at the de la Ville again in good weather when the restaurant's terrace is open. In December (which is the off season) we got a special on this hotel, and it was an excellent value.

HotelInfo.Name: InterContinental de la Ville
HotelInfo.Address: Via Sistina 67 - 69, 00187 Rome, Italy
